loans.name: Mary Ratchel

texts.en:
Mary Ratchel S. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Mary Ratchel is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Mary Ratchel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mary Ratchel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Ratchel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ratchel is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Ratchel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, butter, and firewood

loans.name: Rahinatou

texts.fr: B. a appris la couture, après son apprentissage elle a ouvert son propre atelier dans lequel elle exerce son activité et ce depuis 2002. les gens aiment se faire confectionner des habits chez elle car elle est une bonne couturière. elle confectionne elle même des habits à partir des pagnes qu'elle vend à ses clients ou aux passants. elle veut acheter une  nouvelle machine à coudre pour remplacer l'ancienne machine, et aussi quelques pagnes pour confectionner de nouveaux habits raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit.
texts.en:
Ms. B. learned how to sew. After her apprenticeship, she opened her own workshop in which she has been operating her business since 2002. People like to have their clothing made at her place because she is a good seamstress. She makes the clothing herself using pagnes (colorful West African cloth) that she sells to her customers or to those passing by. Ms. B. wants to buy a new sewing machine to replace the old one. She would also like to buy a few pagnes for making new clothing. For these reasons, she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a new sewing machine and some fabrics

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia B. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Virginia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia provides transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating passenger van services. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Virginia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
El Sr. Pascual está casado, tiene una  hija en edad escolar.
 .
Él se dedica a la venta de comida rápida y de pescado en la zona de Ciudad del Este,  siendo un negocio de acceso a una clientela constante y formada, lo que colabora con que sea rentable. 

Es una persona destacada por su responsable conducta en cuanto al cumplimiento de sus obligaciones, tanto en el ámbito familiar como laboral. 

El préstamo al cual ha accedido le ha ayudado a crecer y desarrollarse un poco más en el ámbito de la microempresa.
texts.en:
Pascual is married and has a school-aged daughter. He sells fast food and seafood (fish) in the eastern zone of the city. Because his business has access to a constant and steady stream of customers, it is very profitable for him. He is known for his responsible behavior and reputation for meeting his obligations, both family and business. This loan has helped him grow and develop a bit as a small company.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Aisha has a business in cosmetics, which she has had for 10 years.  She also has rental houses and a tailoring shop.   

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase and stock more oil for hair treatments and weaves for ladies.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Aisha hopes to develop all her businesses.

loans.use: To stock more oil for hair treatments and weaves for ladies

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga J. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Hovd province in Mongolia in their own apartment. Both of his elder children are university students while his youngest child attends a local secondary school. His wife helps him with the business. 

Gantulga started his own business in 2005 by operating a raw material trading business. In 2009, he opened his second business, a used consumer goods retail business, after receiving a loan from the bank. Gantulga is a responsible for his raw material trading business while his wife manages the secondhand products retail business. Both businesses have proven to be successful, and the couple has managed to increase their working capital. Their earnings have enabled them to have their own workplace. 

For the future, he hopes to continue having success with both businesses and he is planning to save money for his children's future education. Gantulga is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more quality used consumer goods for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more quality used consumer goods

loans.name: C1240 Rwambona 4 Group

texts.en:
Venant is 50 years old, married with eight children who are between 7 and 21 years old.  Venant is the leader of a group called 'Rwambona' and this group is commonly known in the business of selling milk.  Venant and his team have been in this business for about 6 years and the  hours of their business are from 8 am to 6 pm every day.

Although Venant and his team have been in this business for about 6 years, their capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To change this, they need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which will allow them to purchase a dairy machine.  If this machine is bought, there will be a big increase of liters of milk to sell per day.  If successful, this team hopes that they will earn more profits than previously and in addition to that, they will keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: the purchase of a dairy machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a shop and expand his business.

loans.name: Rickson

texts.en:
Rickson B. is from the village of Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 34 years old. Rickson is single. To make a living, Rickson owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products, such as jewelry and watches, in the local community. Rickson has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rickson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rickson is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rickson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Víctor; el tiene 38 años de edad y es soltero; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía el restaura obras de arte en  madera y marcos dorados también restaura imágenes, a la vez el socio tiene su consultorio dental es odontólogo de profesión.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de material para su negocio.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Víctor is a member of the “Unidos para el Triunfo” (United for Victory) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Víctor is 38 years old and single.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his handicrafts business.  He restores wooden works of art and golden frames.  He also restores pictures.  At the same time he has a dental office as he is a dentist by profession.

He is requesting this loan to buy material for his business.  He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy material for his business

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de anticuchos y venta de granos secos, la socia vende los granos secos en las distintas ferias de San Sebastián y lo anticuchos también lo vende en los anticuchos en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de anticuchos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos secos como quinua, trigo y maíz.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the 'Maquimanta Purisun' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Justina is 55 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling 'anticuchos' (kebabs) and dried grains.  Justina sells dried grains in the different markets of San Sebastián and she sells her kebabs as an itinerant street vendor.  She would like to improve her kebab business.  She is requesting this loan to buy dried products such as quinoa, wheat and corn.

Justina is happy to be receiving this loan and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy dried products such as quinoa, wheat and corn

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos en su domicilio. Ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas para comercializarlos entre sus vecinos y trabajadores de la zona. El negocio ya cuenta con tres años de funcionamiento y durante este tiempo ha podido obtener una clientela fiel que prefiere sus buena sazón y buen trato. Los ingresos que percibe de este negocio son una fuente importante de ingreso para la economía de su familia.

Asunciona desde adquirir insumos para ampliar su negocio y poder aumentar sus ventas, su demanda ha estado aumentando y ello hace que tenga que esforzarse más para satisfacerla. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Asunciona is 31 years old, married and lives with her husband and three children in one of the villages that make up Lambayeque district, an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Asunciona's business is preparing and selling food in her home.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners to sell to her neighbors and workers in the area.  She has been running her business for three years and, during this time, she has been able to attract a loyal customer base who prefer her business for the good flavor of her food and her good customer service.  The profits that she makes from this business are an important source of income for her family's finances.

Asunciona would like to acquire supplies so that she can expand her business and increase her sales.  Her demand has been increasing and this means that she has to work even harder to meet it.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire supplies to expand her business and increase her sales

loans.name: Urkupiña Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “URKUPIÑA” es un grupo de 7 mujeres y 1 varón que están iniciando su segundo ciclo.   Su experiencia de trabajo del primer ciclo fue positiva por lo que han decidido continuar como banca comunal y solicitar nuevamente los servicios de Pro Mujer. 
Cada una de las socias tiene negocio propio, de servicio, producción o comercio. 
Para su organización, la B. C. Urkupiña cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Maria, una tesorera, la señora  Emiliana y un secretario de actas, el señor  Miguel.

La  Presidenta, la señora  Maria tuvo siete hijos, de los cuales dos viven con ella.
Desde hace quince años tiene como negocio la producción y venta de queso, indica que pasó clases para aprender cómo elaborar quesos, desde los más finos (suizo, descremado, montañez) hasta el queso criollo.

La señora Maria siembra para alimentar a las vacas que tiene, sin embargo, tambien requiere comprar alimento para las vacas.  Los quesos son vendidos en la Feria 16 de Julio, Feria de Villa Tunari, Feria de Villa Adela.  Con mucho orgullo la señora María comenta que sus hijos le colaboran en el trabajo, ella dice “sola no podría”.

Cuando se le consulta a la señora Maria  qué es lo que le atrae de la institución, ella responde “participar en el grupo”.
La Banca Comunal Urkupiña se ve fortalecida pues se encontraban reunidas las socias solicitantes, dos señoras que indicaron que ingresarían a la BC como socias adicionales (señora con chompa beis, señora de sombrero celeste) y una amistad del grupo (señora de mantilla a cuadros y gorro azul).
texts.en:
The village bank “URKUPIÑA” is a group of 7 women and 1 man who are beginning their second cycle.  Their work experience on the first cycle was positive, so they've decided to continue as a village bank and request again the services of Pro Mujer.  Each of the members has her own business, offering a service, product or commerce.   As an organization, the village bank Urkupiña has a directive board led by a president, Maria; a treasurer, Emiliana; and a secretary, Miguel. 

The president, Maria, has 7 children, two of whom live with her.  For 15 years she has had a business making and selling cheese.  She took classes to learn to make cheeses, from the most fine (swiss, fat-free, montañez) as well as traditional queso criollo. 

Maria planted food to give to her cows, but nevertheless she also needs to buy food for them.  The cheeses are sold in the July 16th fair, the Villa Tunari fair, and the Villa Adela fair.  Maria says with pride that her children help her in the work, and that "alone it wouldn't be possible". 

When you ask Maria what attracts her to the bank, she says "participating in the group".  The communal bank Urkupiña looks larger, since the original members were joined by two additional women indicated that they would like to join (the woman in the beige sweater, and the woman in the blue hat) and a friend of the group (the woman with the plaid shawl and blue hat).

loans.use: Buy bran to feed cattle

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a businessman who makes a living by running a green grocery. He also offers bicycle transportation services to people who trade goods in the local market. His wife helps him by running the grocery when he is busy transporting goods. His main goal is to open new outlets of his grocery store and hire people to run them. He is applying for this loan for 40,000 Kes, to buy pineapples, onions, melons and tomatoes to sell to customers in his store.

loans.use: To buy pineapples, onions, melons and tomatoes to sell to his customers

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en:
Niveen is a 35-year-old woman who lives with her parents in the city of Jenin. Niveen took tailoring courses after high school and started working from home, saving up to have her own small workshop later. Niveen and her brother, a Palestinian National employee, share taking care of the household expenses and their old parents.

Niveen and her husband want to open a small grocery store next to their house and need $2,000 to finish preparing the store. Niveen (who is photographed here) took out a loan from FATEN.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine and open a small grocery store

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El señor Edgar trabaja en la alcaldía en el área de asistencia técnica; con el dinero del crédito podrá cancelar las mensualidades de la Universidad Católica, donde está estudiando. Vive en casa de sus padres, es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA. Vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en: Edgar works as a technical assistant in the city hall.  This money will allow his to pay his monthly tuition at Universidad Católica, where he is a student.  He is single, has no children, and lives with his parents.  This will be his first loan through IMPRO and Kiva.  He lives in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Youse Fresia

texts.es:
Youse de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una tienda de víveres. Trabaja en la tienda desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm. 

Hace tes años comenzó con la tienda desde ese tiempo ha continuado con esfuerzo y dedicación para mantenerla con un nivel de ventas optimo para los ingresos de su familia. Vende arroz, azúcar, bebidas a un precio muy económico. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo víveres como arroz, bebidas, confites. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
Youse, 38 years old, is a hard-working woman who has a provisions store.  She works in her store from 7:00 am until 10:00 pm.

Youse began her store some 3 years ago and since that time, has continued her efforts and dedication to maintain a level of sales that will optimize her family's income.  She sells, rice, sugar, and drinks at a very economical price.  

Youse has great aspirations for her business and wants to use the loan to purchase provisions such as rice, drinks, and candy.  In the future, she hopes to have a well-supplied store.

loans.use: TO BUY RICE, SWEETS, AND DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Blanca Yajaira

texts.es:
Blanca Yajaira nació en la ciudad de Anta del departamento de Cusco, ella tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella y su pareja tienen unión un hijo. 

Blanca Yajaira se dedica al comercio compra y venta de ganado, ellos compran ganado en la feria de Inquilpata de la ciudad de Anta y después envían ganado a la ciudad de Lima. En esta oportunidad Blanca Yajaira requiere el microcrédito para comprar más ganado.  

Blanca Yajaira es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene de la lengua Quechua que traducido al Castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Blanca Yajaira was born in the city of Anta, Cusco Department.  She’s 28 years old and still lives in the same city where she was born.  She and her spouse have a son.

Blanca Yajaira is a livestock merchant.  They buy cattle at the Inquilpata livestock fair in the city of Anta and then send the cattle to the city of Lima.  On this occasion, Blanca Yajaira needs the micro loan to buy more cattle.

Blanca Yajaira is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  The word “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” comes from the Quechua and means “Women Who Work.”

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 58 years old, married and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lolita requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farming. Lolita has been farming vegetables for seven years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Lolita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farming.

loans.name: Sophors

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophors D. and her husband, Mr. Savoeun Um, who is 32 years old, live in a village outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have one young daughter.

To earn a living and to support their family, Sophors and her husband are garment factory workers. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to repair her family's kitchen and to fill the land around her house.

loans.use: To repair her kitchen and to fill the land around her house

loans.name: Margelina

texts.es:
Margelina es una mujer trabajadora D. 43 años D. edad. Ella esta casada y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos en la comunidad rural D. Guaraguaos ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura. 

Margelina se dedica hace 7 años a la crianza D. ganado ovino y vacuno que luego comercializa a la clientela establecida con la que cuenta. Margelina tiene  corrales apropiados y espaciosos que le permiten darle una buena crianza a sus animales.  Además D. comercializar sus animales, Margelina venD. diariamente la leche que le producen sus vacas.

Su esposo es agricultor y cuenta  con parcela propia donD. siembra mango y maíz.  Esta pareja se ayuda mutuamente para contribuir con los gastos del hogar

Margelina ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles, para comprar alimento balanceado a sus animales e implementar un  nuevo corral pequeño. Esto la ayudará a seguir desarrollando satisfactoriamente sus ventas.
texts.en:
Margelina is a hard-working 43 year-old woman who is married and has three children in her care.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and children in the rural community of Guaraguaos which is located in TambogranD. district - Piura.

Margelina has been raising sheep and cattle for seven years.  She sells her animals to established customers.  Margelina has suitable and spacious pens which allow her to raise her animals well.  In addition to selling her animals, she also sells the milk that her cows produce daily.

Margelina's husband is a farmer and he has his own plot of land where he grows mangos and corn.  This couple help each other in covering their household expenses.

Margelina has requested a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for her animals and to set up a new small pen.  This will help her to continue developing her sales in a satisfactory manner.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Marcevid

texts.es: Marcevid, de 36 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cayo de 40 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio al que Marcevid se dedica es la venta de frutas de la región, todas las mañanas sale muy temprano junto a su triciclo a vender ambulatoriamente por las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Entre las frutas que vende se encuentran el aguaje, ungurahui, chapo, entre otros, que son vendidos a precios muy accesibles, motivo por el cual tiene muchos clientes. Tiene un año en este negocio pero expresa que le va muy bien, además de que vende, ella misma puede disponer de su horario, así no descuida su hogar y su negocio. Pero el tener que caminar le es muy cansado, pero sabe que debe hacerlo para poder vender más. Con el paso del tiempo, espera tener un puesto en algún mercado de la ciudad  donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad sus frutas. Pide el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda avanzar con su negocio. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar del grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más frutas de la región para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende normalmente.
texts.en: Marcevid, who is 36 years old, is a very friendly and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband, 40-year old Cayo, and their 3 dear children.  She would like to offer her children a better quality of life.  Marcevid makes her living with a business selling regional fruit.  She leaves early every morning with her tricycle to sell her fruit on the streets of Pucallpa.  Among the fruits she sells are aguaje (purple palm tree fruit), ungurahui (ungurahui palm fruit), chapo (bananas), and others.  She offers very affordable prices, which is why she has a lot of customers.  She has been in this business for one year, but has expressed that it is going very well for her.  In addition to her sales, Marcevid arranges her own schedule, so she doesn't neglect her home or her business.  Having to walk is very tiring for her, but she knows that she must do it to sell more fruit.  With time, she hopes to have a sales stall in a city market where she could sell her fruit more peacefully.  Marcevid is asking all of you for help so she can advance her business.  This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to have obtained it and is prepared to punctually re-pay her loan.  Marcevid is a well-liked member of her communal bank because she is always concerned with the well being of the group.  With the thousand nuevos soles (USD $375) that she has requested, Marcevid will purchase more regional fruit in order to increase the quantity of merchandise that she normally sells.

loans.use: to purchase more regional fruit to stock up her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married with two children. Alicia is 56 years old and lives in Upper Disakan, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Alicia sells bananas for a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 2,000 PHP to purchase more bananas to retail.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Alicia hope to have a better living and make her children finish in school and have a good work to help the family.

loans.use: To purchased  bananas for her banana retail business

location.town: Dipolog-Upper Disakan, Manukan, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is a 48-year-old, married man living in the village of Rizal West San Isidro. He is grateful because he is blessed with 3 children. 

According to Orlando, he is able to earn about 9,000 PHP per month as a driver working within his village. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for almost 4 years. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy new wheels and sprockets so that he can make his daily transport routine.

Orlando hopes that he could improve his family's standard way of living through the profits he generates from his motorcycle transport business. He also hopes and prays that his requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy new wheels and sprockets for his motorcycle

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 46 years old and lives in Kakata, a town to the north of Monrovia. She is married and her husband grows and sells rubber. She has five children aged between 13 and 25, three of whom live at home and go to school. She did not attend school herself.
Hawa has a small business cooking and selling food and rice, biscuits and other dried goods. Her business is going well for her and she is able to make a profit. She started the business with money from her own savings. Hawa will use this loan to purchase more stock for her business. In the future, she would like to build her own home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham, a 31-year-old married father of a four-year-old who attends school, has been a farmer in the town of Eldoret in Rift Valley Kenya for five years now. His mixed farm produces milk, maize and beans which he sells to the local market. Abraham's biggest challenge has been drought which affects his output. Farming is his only source of income.

Abraham has made a loan request for 62,400 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with the dairy cow, his milk production will increase, and this means more sales and income. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable him to improve his family's living standard. Abraham plans to acquire a tractor in the future which will assist him in transporting his produce to the market.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa Lidia es madre soltera con una hija de diez años de edad y vive en una ribera muy bonita que alado pasa la carretera internacional, en esa ribera la gente es muy  trabajadora y busca la manera de dicar su tiempo en  algo que les deje beneficios.
Solcito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra de  mercancía como son: frijol, aceite, galletas, jabón, café, entre otros  para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, en done lleva cuatro años y comentó que le  va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso.
Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó ya que su esposo la abandono cuando su hija esta de cinco años y decidió dedicarse a algo que le deje ingreso  para  sacar adelante a su pequeña hija.
Lo que ella desea es que con esta actividad pueda tener sus propios ahorros para seguir apoyando  a su hija y darle una educación y con el tiempo terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Lidia is a single mother with a ten year old daughter, and she lives in a beautiful waterfront community that wings along the side of the international highway.  In this community, the people are hardworking and looking for ways to spend their time on something that brings them benefits.

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as beans, oil, biscuits, soap, coffee, etc., to stock her grocery store.  She started this four years ago, and comments that it is doing well and that she has had a good income from it.

Her inspiration for this activity started when her husband abandoned her when her daughter was five years old, and she decided to work in something that would provide her with income to move her young daughter ahead in life.

What she wants is to have her own savings as result of this business, so she can continue to support her daughter and give her an education and eventually a career.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 37 years old and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with two children.

Rowena has a shop that sells dry goods. She has had  this business for six  years. She requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase dry goods for her business.         

Rowena has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as dry goods for her general store.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresita De Jesus es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar la inscripción de la escuela don de estudian sus hijos, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder cubrir esta necesidad escolar. Desea que sus hijo sigan estudian, aprendiendo un buena educación, para que tengan un futura y  puedan ser persona con una carrera profesional. 
Dona Teresita De Jesus es empleado de una maquiladora en el área de producción, este ingreso es la fuente que tiene para su familia y con el cual un parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresita De Jesus is a single mother and has two children in her care.  

She is requesting a loan to pay for school tuition for her children since she does not have the necessary funds right now.  She wants her children to study and get a good education for a better future and so they can become professionals.

Teresita De Jesus works in the production area of a factory and her salary is the only source of income for the family.  She will use part of it to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To pay for tuition and school expenses.

loans.name: Méritouré

texts.fr:
Méritouré est une femme  de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un artiste. Elle a 02 enfants qui vont  à l’école. Le premier a 11ans et le dernier 05 ans.  
Méritouré fait le commerce des produits d’alimentation générale (boîtes de conserve, des bidons d’huile et des bols de riz) et des jouets d’enfant depuis 11ans. Elle sert toute sorte de client dans sa maison. Elle achète les produits à LOME. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la mévente après les périodes de fête. 
Méritouré a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 5 bidons d’huile et 10 sacs de riz. Elle veut réinvestir son bénéfice dans son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Méritouré voudrait rendre son activité durable. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit rendre son ménage heureux.
texts.en:
Méritouré is a 35-year-old woman who is married to an artist. She has two children, who attend school. They are 11 and 5 years old. For eleven years, she has been doing commerce in grocery items (canned foods, containers of oil, and basins of rice) and children's toys. She has all sorts of customers at her house. She buys the goods from Lomé. At the moment, her main difficulty is a drop in sales following the holidays. 

Méritouré has requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to buy 5 containers of oil and 10 sacks of rice. She wants to reinvest her profits into her business. 

In the next few years, Méritouré would like to make her business sustainable. With the profits, she says she expects to make her home a happy one.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 29-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and only child. He is the main income source of the family. He has been working as a freelance car trader and broker since 2005.  His business consists of buying cars and reselling them to make profits. Today, he is requesting $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to register a car and sign the legal papers. He is very truthful in his business and works directly with customers avoiding having any legal issues. In the future, he is hoping to expand his business and open his own car showroom.

loans.use: to register a car and sign the legal papers

loans.name: Ma. Erlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Erlinda is 52 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Ma. Erlinda is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase a variety of seedlings and fertilizers.

Ma. Erlinda has been farming corn for 31 years and earns additional income from a variety store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to repair her family home and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de frutas, la socia vende manzanas, naranjas, platanos entre otras frutas, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar naranjas, platanos, uvas, mandarinas y manzanas al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Sra. Vilma.  She is 29 years old, lives with her partner and has 4 children.  She spends her days working in her fruit business.  She sells apples, oranges and bananas, along with other fruit. She sells her fruit from a street stand and works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  This business allows her to help her children to get ahead.  Sra. Vilma wants to expand her business selling fruit.  She is requesting the loan in order to purchase wholesale oranges, bananas, grapes, tangerines and apples.

Sra. Vilma is happy about the loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale oranges, bananas, grapes, tangerines and apples.

loans.name: And Jëff Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité And Jëff est créé le 28 août 2009, il est constitué de quinze de femmes qui habitent le même quartier,elles sont voisines.Le petit commerce est leur principale activité.

La responsable madame Siga est âgée de 41 ans, mariée elle a dix enfants en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce de tissus, de pagnes et autres articles; elle a une bonne expérience de plusieurs années .Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en tenu rose.
Elle s'approvisionne dans les grandes villes et revend au village.
Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des marchandises en grande quantité pour renforcer son activité afin de se faire plus de revenus.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et à l'avenir acheter un terrain pour ses enfants et aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The And Jëff solidarity group was created August 28, 2009. It consists of fifteen women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small retail commerce.

The group responsible is Mrs. Siga. Age 41, she is married with ten children under her care. Her business activity is trading in fabrics, pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics) and other items, and has gained solid experience over several years.

She is standing on the right in the picture, dressed in light pink. She gets her supplies from large cities and resells them in the village.

Her ​​loan will serve to buy goods in large quantities to strengthen her business and obtain more revenue. Her profits will be used to assist her husband in dealing with household expenditures. In the future she wants to acquire a plot of land for her children and also increase her savings level.

loans.use: Buy goods for retail sales

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: La señora Clotilde se dedica a la venta de desayunos,  tiene vivienda propia y puesto de venta propio, la señora se dedica al negocio en mas de 10 años, cuenta con una amplia clientela a la cual le sirve por las mañanas el desayuno, la señora necesita el dinero para poder compara en cantidad los insumos como azúcar y cereales para la elaboración de sus desayunos y el saldo para hacerle unas mejoras al puesto que tiene en el mercado es una cliente que muestra responsabilidad es muy amable y trabajadora. Agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Clotilde sells breakfasts. She has her own home and her own sales stall. Clotilde has had this business for more than ten years. She has a large customer base to whom she serves breakfast in the mornings.

She needs the money so she can buy breakfast-making supplies, like sugar and grains, in bulk. She will use the balance to make some improvements to the sales stall she has in the market.

Clotide is a customer who shows responsibility, and she is very friendly and hardworking. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered to her.

loans.use: to buy supplies (sugar and grains).

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Mrs. Ben is a 31-year-od married woman with four children who lives in the Pouk district of Siem Reap province. She earns a living by selling fish thA. her husband catches along the Tonle Sap River. Her income depends mainly on the size of her husband's catch, and many of his nets are currently torn and broken. She is applying for this loan from HKL and Kiva to buy new fishing equipment for her husband. She will also use some of the money to repair her house, which has many leaks. This loan will allow her family to earn more income and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy new fishing equipment for her husband and repair her house.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 56 años de edad, es una hombre trabajador y dedicado a su labor en el campo, es conviviente con Rosalva que también es agricultora y ama de casa, fruto de esa feliz unión tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 12, 9 y 6 años de edad que son su mayor alegría y por los cuales  se esfuerza por salir adelante. Ellos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Alejandro es la agricultura, para eso tiene su terreno propio en donde tiene sombríos de palma aceitera, además de  plátanos, maíz, éstos últimos son para el consumo de su hogar. Asimismo cría aves de de corral como gallinas y patos, habiéndose iniciado en esta actividad desde hace 24 años. Actualmente cuenta con la ayuda de 4 peones a los que paga por jornada trabajada. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es poder estar en el campo, tener contacto con la naturaleza, donde se siente muy a gusto, además que le brinda lo necesario para vivir cómodamente, y para educar a sus  hijos, que son su mayor orgullo, por eso se siente con muchas ganas de progresar y mejorando sus técnicas de cultivo comprando un tractor agrícola. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado dice sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser excelentes personas. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles. Los invertirá en la compra de abono  en volumen para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 56, is a hardworking man who is dedicated to his work in the fields.  He lives with Rosalva who is also a farmer and housewife.  This happy union produced four children who are 17, 12, 9, and 6 years old; they are his greatest joy and the reason he strives to get ahead.  They all live together comfortably in their own home.

Alejandro’s activity is farming.  He has land of his own where he grows palms for palm oil and also bananas and corn; the latter two are for home consumption.  He also raises barnyard fowl like chickens and ducks having started this activity 24 years ago.  He currently employs four laborers that he pays for each day worked.  What he likes about his activity is being able to be out in the countryside, to have contact with nature where he feels very good.  Besides, it provides what’s needed to live comfortably, to educate his children who are the source of his pride.  Because of this, he very much wants to make progress and improve his farming techniques including purchasing a tractor.

This will be MFP loan #3 and he hopes for your cooperation to continue toward his goals.  He says that he feels good in his communal bank because he considers the members to be excellent people.  He will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy manure in volume to improve the quality of his land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Seruni Indah Group

texts.en:
Fitri is 33 years old and married with two children. Her children are 10 years old and 8 years old and are going to school. She has been selling mie ayam (chicken noodle soup) since 2009 in front of her house. Her shop is always full of customers but she doesn't have a lot of seating space for them. So now she is taking her second loan from VisionFund Indonesia to purchase a table and chairs. Her husband works as a low-level employee at a nearby hotel but his salary is not enough to support all the needs of the family.

In the future, she hopes she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for a table and chairs for her food stall

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 47-year-old, married woman blessed with four school-age children. She is a very industrious woman because, aside from the farming business that serves as their main source of income, she also engages in hog fattening production. She does this work for her family. She wants to lift her family out of poverty and save for the education of her children. That’s why she is strong and enthusiastic for her work. 

For Erlinda to achieve her dream, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and insecticides used to develop her farming business. She just hopes to make a profit out of these inputs to lift up her family from their poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used to develop her farming business

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formo por medio de una de las miembros, quien informo a sus vecinas acerca del programa de comité de mujeres, de esa manera invitaron a vecinas y amigas de su comunidad a formar parte de ella. El comité actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa y están muy entusiasmadas de llegar al máximo nivel.
Lorenza es una de las miembros, ella nos comenta que se dedica a la costura en general. Ella realiza muy buenos trabajos y es por ello que le va muy bien, se ha hecho muy conocida en el barrio por eso. Gracias a su trabajo puede ayudar en la casa y con los gastos del día a día. Su meta es agrandar su taller y seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, cierres, botones y demás insumos necesarios para abastecer su taller de costura.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by one of its members. She told her neighbors about a women's committee program and invited her neighbors and friends in the community to join. The committee at present is in its first cycle of the program and they are very enthusiastic to get to the highest level.

Lorenza is one of the members. She tells us that she does general sewing. She does very good work and that is why it is going well for her. She has become very well known in the neighborhood because of that.  Thanks to her work, she can help out with the day to day expenses at home.  una de las miembros, ella nos comenta que se dedica a la costura en general. Her goal is to enlarge her workshop and keep growing. 

She is asking for the loan to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and other necessary materials for her sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and more.

loans.name: Samoa

texts.en:
Samoa is thirty one years of age and is married with no children.

Samoa owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has four years of experience in this business.  Samoa needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Samoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Samoa's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Aroma Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
En una comunidad del Estado de México se ubica una pequeña hacienda la cual es querida por todos los habitantes debido a que allí se llevan a cabo reuniones o fiestas gracias a su belleza y estilo único. No obstante, todo el pueblo es rico en recursos naturales y cuentan con flora y fauna típicas de la región.
   Doña Magdalena es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre a quien le gusta preservar las tradiciones de su comunidad. Siempre ha tenido la responsabilidad de cuidar de su familia y hoy en día todos sus hijos han logrado ser independientes.  
   Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la venta de ropa dentro de su comunidad pues es un negocio que la ha brindado la oportunidad de alcanzar sus metas. En esta ocasión solicita un crédito para comprar ropa para bebés ya que muchos de sus clientes le han solicitado ese tipo de mercancía. Lo que dio inicio a su actividad fue que uno de sus hijos se dedicaba al comercio y la ropa era el mejor producto que ofrecía pues las ganancias eran mayores y el esfuerzo era menor. 
   Por todos sus logros, está muy contenta y agradecida con VFMéxico porque gracias a su crédito ampliar el local donde desempeña su actividad. “Para mí es mejor tener una gran variedad de ropa para así poder ofrecer a mis clientes lo mejor y que regresen con gusto y me recomienden” expresó con una sonrisa. La próxima temporada tiene pensado implementar la venta de artículos navideños para lograr reunir más ingresos. 
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son María Maura, Agripina y Angélica quienes invertirán en gallinas y pavos; Ma. Lourdes, María Teresa y Adriana, en cerdos; Magdalena, en herrería y Ma. Rosa, Elma y Edith, en ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del centro del municipio, Magdalena es quien viste el suéter azul.

loans.use: comprara ropa

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Sowanou

texts.en:
Mr. Sowanou H. is an energetic man. Married to a shopkeeper for twenty years, he has eight children, two of whom are in apprenticeships. The income from his wife’s business is not enough to contribute to the family’s needs. Mr. Sowanou H.’s business is the production and sale of the local drink, “sodabi,” which is very popular in the region. The quality of the drink he produces has led to him receiving orders from as far as the capital, Lomé. In order to be able to produce a large quantity of sodabi, he must be able to buy enough palm trees. To do so he would need substantial financial means, something which Mr. H. does not have. He is requesting a loan of $850 to buy palm tress and produce and sell sodabi. The income generated by the sale of the drink could help Mr. H. bear his numerous household expenses.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Sowanou est un homme dynamique. Marié à une commerçante depuis une vingtaine d’années, il a au total huit (8) enfants dont deux (2) en apprentissage. Le revenu issu du commerce de sa femme ne lui permet pas de contribuer aux besoins familiaux. Monsieur H. Sowanou exerce comme activité la production et la vente de la boisson locale « sodabi » bien appréciée dans la zone. La qualité de la boisson qu’il produit fait qu’il reçoit des commandes depuis Lomé la capitale. Pour pouvoir produire une grande quantité de sodabi, Il lui faut alors acheter assez de palmiers. Ce qui demande assez de moyens financiers dont Monsieur H. ne dispose pas. Il sollicite un crédit de $850 pour l’achat des palmiers, la production et la vente du sodabi. Les revenus tirés de la vente de la boisson pourra aider Monsieur H. à supporter les nombreuses charges de son ménage

loans.use: To buy palm trees to produce and sell “sodabi”

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en: I have been selling clothing for three years, and I need to enlarge a room in my house to be able to keep my product. I support my family with this work.

loans.use: To sell clothing and improve my home.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
My name is Julieta Rodríguez and for the past four years I've been selling used clothing for children, men and women. My customers are very loyal, in my community people are very poor and they don't have enough money to buy expensive things, and I sell clothing that is almost new at a very low price. My goal is to purchase more clothes so as to have a greater stock available and make more sales. With the earnings I want to remodel my shop and make it bigger so that my customers are more comfortable. Since my shop is in my own home, it will be easy to remodel.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Julieta R. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada para damas, caballeros y niños, actividad que tengo de realizar durante 4 años, los clientes son excelentes ya que nuestra comunidad es muy pobre y la gente no tiene mucho dinero para comprar cosas muy caras y ellos me prefieren a mi porque vendo la ropa casi nueva y de calidad a un precio muy bajo, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio, hacerlo mas grande para tener una mejor atencion a mis clientes y como mi negocio es en mi casa de habitacion me resulta mas facil remodelarlo

loans.use: purchasing used clothes

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is a 57-year-old energetic mother of six, a resident of the Vituka area in Dar es Salaam. She has been in the charcoal business for the past five years, and it has been improving and profiting ever since she received business training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. She travels monthly to nearby surrounding regions (Morogoro, Tanga and Pwani), where most of her suppliers are stationed, for charcoal. She is both a wholesaler and a retailer. On  average, she sells seven sacks of charcoal. She has a big store at her place and it’s her plan to open up other centers for her business. She is in need of USD 750 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Build another store for charcoal and expand on the stock

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a courageous woman who has secured the well being of her only son, her reason for living, for many years. He is now a good and useful man to society, which is reason enough to fill his loving mother with pleasure and motivate her to be successful. Through the years, she has performed several tasks such as hand-weaving garments, the distribution of products, and so on. But the main task that she currently performs is embroidery and the application of sequins to blouses that she sells as handicrafts. Thanks to her consistency, Yolanda has seen her business grow to the point that it can sustain her economically. Her great love for her son urges her to keep making progress, and that's why she requests a loan of $675 to rent a small craft shop in the middle of her city and formally offer her goods safely and in a sufficently large space. We support Yolanda's continuing growth, and we're counting on you.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer

Yolanda es una mujer coraje, que durante varios años le ha procurado bienestar a su único hijo, quién se ha convertido en su razón de vivir; él ahora es todo un hombre de bien y útil a la sociedad, razones suficientes que llenan de satisfacción a su amorosa madre y la motivan a desempeñarse con éxito.A través de los años ha desempeñado múltiples oficios como la fabricación de prendas tejidas a mano, la siembra de productos, etc. Pero la tarea principal y la que actualmente ejerce es la de bordado y aplicación de lentejuelas a las blusas que comercializa como artesanía.Gracias a su constancia Yolanda ha visto crecer su negocio que le permite sostenerse económicamente así mismo el inmenso amor de su único hijo la impulsan a seguir progresando, es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 675 dólares para poder arrendar un pequeño local artesanal en el centro de su ciudad y así ofrecer sus productos de manera formal con seguridad y en un espacio adecuado.Apoyemos a Yolanda a seguir creciendo, contamos contigo.

loans.use: Renting a local shop for the sale of handicrafts

loans.name: Marizta

texts.en:
Maritza has been preparing and selling delicious Peruvian dishes from her two portable stands for the past 8 years. She prepares all the regional favorites of her hometown of Ayacucho, Perú including chicken soups, “puca picante” which is a dish containing beans, peanuts, beets and potatoes, and “modongo” a favorite weekend dish that contains corn and beef and cooks all night long. Although she cooks a variety of foods, Marizta’s specialty is “chicharrón,” which is deep fried pork. This she sells just around the corner from her home in a busy market area. “Mari,” as her friends and neighbors call her, sells here during the weekdays and her stand has become a very popular attraction for all in the area. Her second stand is set up in the rural countryside of Ayacucho, a few hours outside the city limits. Because it is very popular for families to take a relaxing day trip to the country during the weekends, Maritza has taken advantage of the weekend traffic, selling a wider variety of dishes to many passersby. Maritza also travels to all the festivals in the area, selling to the large celebrating crowds.

One day, Maritza says she would love to open a large restaurant in the city center of Ayacucho. This has been a dream of hers since she was a young girl, she explains, as cooking has always been her passion. This is where her village bank comes in. Two years ago, Maritza began taking out loans to increase her business and her profits, helping her circle in on the eventual accomplishment of the opening of her restaurant. She has loved being a part of her village bank because she says it has taught her how to save her money in the bank where it accumulates interest. The confidence and ease with which she is given a loan has also increased her self-confidence and motivated her to work even harder in the growth of her food business. Maritza is requesting a loan of $800. With this money, she will be able to buy larger amounts of pork for “chicharrones,” as well as firewood for her small stove and other necessary ingredients.

loans.use: To buy pork for “chicharrones”, as well as firewood and other necessary ingredients.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: R. Shahin is 40 years old and married with 2 children. He is from Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory in the Kelbejer region, situated in the west part of Azerbaijan.  Shahin began his business 12 years ago. He is the only earner in his family and is busy with repairs to his home. He wants to increase his client list and needs to buy necessary tools and equipment for his business. He wishes to take out a $300 loan to expand his repair area and to purchase more equipment. He believes that this expansion will allow him to improve the living conditions of his family and he plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment

loans.name: Mohammad Yasin

texts.en: Mohammad Yasin lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of 4 children. He is an educated man but he also has 10 years' work experience in agriculture. He has lots of land to cultivate so he is requesting an individual loan to buy things he cannot otherwise afford such as fertilizer and seeds to expand his business. He needs to do this to support his family and enroll his children in a better school. He is happy that he can continue his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es:
The only reason Magnolia has been selling ice cold drinks (beer and soft drinks) for a long time, is because her husband used to work in a well-known brewery in her region. Everything was going well with the business until the day her husband, Julio, fell seriously ill and they had to make significant expenditures for treatment and to help him recuperate. At 43 years of age, Magnolia is the mother of 2 children and for them, she has become confident and capable of moving ahead in her life. To achieve her objective, she needs a loan as soon as possible. Let's help Magnolia make it, she won't fail you.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Magnolia se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas(cervezas y gaseosas) desde hace tiempo, por única razón de que su esposo trabajaba años atrás en una empresa cervecera reconocida de su región. Todo marchaba muy bien en su negocio hasta que un día su esposo el señor Julio se enfermó de gravedad y tuvieron que hacer gastos muy significativos por el tratamiento que lo ayudaría a recobrar su salud. La señora Magnolia a sus 42 años es madre de dos hijos es por ello que se muestra como una mujer decidida y capaz de salir adelante. Para cumplir con este objetivo ella necesita de un capital de inversión lo más pronto posible. Ayudemos a la señora Magnolia a seguir adelante, ella no te defraudará.

loans.use: To implement her business.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 42 year-old Philomena M., who is married with two children, aged 13 and 17, and has one other dependent, her nephew.
In 2006 Philomena established a business involving automobile spare parts, gas, and welding, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional spare parts for resale. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Hermelinda Elvira

texts.es:
Hermelinda, who belongs to the lending group, Mujeres Trabajadoras de Huaraz ("Working Women of Huaraz"), makes a living selling groceries and colas. Her business is located in her house in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. With the S/.300 loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy rice, cooking oil and pasta for her shop.

Hermelinda, 27, has 2 children. Her husband is a teacher and both work to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Hermelinda, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres Trabajadoras de Huaraz, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y gaseosas, su negocio esta en su domicilio ubicado en Billón Bajo Pasaje 25 en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 , el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas , comprará: un saco de arroz, un balde de aceite y bolsa de fideos para su bodega.

Ella tienen 27 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, su esposos es profesor ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos .

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Candida Rosa A. is a lady that makes living selling clothes which she does in her own stall at the municipal market of the City Sandino in Managua.

She started her business with little capital counting on her 3,000 cordobas (USD$ 157) from her savings and loans obtained from lenders. As time has passed, she has been able to stock her business with the support of the loans from Ceprodel, which she has used to buy merchandise and grow her business. Currently she needs to buy articles of clothing such as pants, shirts, etc. For this reason she hopes that her loan will be granted and she can continue her business of selling clothing and continue to improve the support of her home and enable her four children to continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Candida Rosa A. es una dama que se dedica a la labor de venta de ropa que comercializa en su propio tramo en el mercado del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Inició su negocio con poco capital contando con C$ 3,000 (Tres mil córdobas) obtenidos por sus ahorros propios y préstamos realizados a prestamistas. A medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo ha logrado surtir su negocio apoyándose de los créditos recibidos por CEPRODEL el cual los ha utilizado para la compra de la mercadería y ampliación del negocio. Hoy en día su necesidad es la compra de la ropa como pantalones, camisas, etc. Por esta razón es que espera en que su crédito le será otorgado para así continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa para continuar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación y así sus cuatro hijos puedan continuar estudiando.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen is 44 years old. Her famiL. includes three children, one grown daughter and two school-aged children. Before joining the Fund the famiL. depended on income from raising livestock and farming, ventures in which there were no shortage of difficulties. In 2006, Mrs. Nguyen joined the Fund. With receipt of the first loan, she invested in renovating the livestock pens and buying more pigs to raise. Her husband works as a construction worker to supplement the famiL.’s income. Thanks to the livestock business doing well, and thanks to the extra income from her husband, the famiL.’s income has reached 3,500,000 VND per month. To buy more sows for breeding and more wheat for use as livestock feed, she hopes to receive the requested loan of 9,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lý năm nay 44 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 người con, một người con gái đã lớn, hai người con đang trong tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương thu nhập chính của gia đình chị dựa vào chăn nuôi và trông trọt do đó gặp không ít khó khăn. Năm 2006 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương. Với mức vốn vay ban đầu chị đã đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại, mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Chồng chị cũng đi làm thợ xây để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Nhờ công việc chăn nuôi gặp nhiều thuận lợi, và nhờ có thu nhập từ nghề phụ của chồng thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị đạt 3.500.0000đ/ tháng. Để mua thêm lợn giống và mua lúa dự trữ làm thức ăn chăn nuôi chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ . Thu nhập 3500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Buy pigs and feed

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German lives together with his parents in “Brazil Street”, in the neighborhood of Ballivian in the city of El Alto.

German sells spare parts; he buys cars which have had an accident, dismantles them and later on sells the spare parts at the main market of El Alto. The loan he will receive he will use it to buy more cars and sell spare parts.

It is the first loan he takes with Impro and the analysis that was done qualifies him to obtain the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

German vive en la calle Brasil de la zona Ballivián en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive en la casa de sus padres. Trabaja en la comercialización de chatarra, la cual consiste en la compra de vehículos siniestrados (volcados, chocados) los cuales los desmantela y los vende como repuestos en la principal feria de la ciudad de El Alto El crédito lo destinará como capital de trabajo, para la compra de más vehículos y poder vender los repuestos y partes que aún están en estado de uso. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy more damaged cars and sell spare parts

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es:
Bibiana is single and 36 years old, she has a son who loves her very much. She lives in her parent’s house, they help her with her business.
Bibiana works daily selling beauty products, she works for three lines selling by catalogues, she is a very high spirited woman, and what she sets her mind on she conquers.
This is why she decided to start this business, because it seams profitable to her, she works all day and has one year on this business. What she likes the most is to socialize with other people. Business is good and currently she is leader on one of the lines she works for. Bibiana works to help her parents with daily expenses and for her son’s education.
With the loan she is asking, she wants to improve her business, and buy a showcase to keep in good condition her products and to exhibit them.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Bibiana es soltera, tiene 36 años, es madre de un hijo que la ama mucho. Ella vive en casa de sus padres quienes le dan la mano en su negocio. La venta de productos de belleza es el trabajo diario que tiene Bibiana, trabaja para tres líneas de productos de belleza por catálogo, es una mujer de armas tomar y lo que se propone, lo cumple. Por eso, decidió incursionar en este negocio, ya que le parece rentable, trabaja todo el día desde hace ya un año. Lo que más le gusta es socializar con otras personas. Le va muy bien, actualmente ya es líder de una de las líneas para quien trabaja. Bibiana trabaja para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos diarios y para la educación de su hijo. Con el dinero que solicita quiere implementar más su negocio, así como también comprar una vitrina para tener en una buena condición y exhibición sus productos.

loans.use: Stock products and buy a showcase to exhibit her beauty products / Implementación de mercadería y compra de una vitrina para la conservación y exhibición de sus productos de belleza.

loans.name: Joseph Ben

texts.en: Joseph Ben E. is married and has 3 children. He has received schooling through junior high. Joseph sells fishing net, lead ropes and other fishing materials at Elmina, which he has done since 2002. His wife is a trader. Joseph uses his income to pay for the children's school fees and other utility bills. Joseph will use the loan to add to his capital to increase stock for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Joseph plans to reinvest for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: To increase stock for sale

loans.name: Perla

texts.es: Perla vende comida por las noches desde hace varios años atrás, es una mujer que se considera polifacética del trabajo, ya que por las mañanas también vende fruta ambulatoriamente, cuando no hay fruta vende verduras y así varia en la venta de cualquier otro producto según la necesidad de las personas. Sus negocios le resultan rentables debido a que su casa, está ubicada en un lugar muy transitado, sobre todo turístico. Tiene 46 años, es madre 5 hijos que ya son independientes y trabajan. Lo importante para ella es salir adelante y no quedarse atrás, quiere incrementar y ampliar  su negocio de venta de comida, ya que tiene gran acogida debido a su buena sazón y jovialidad. Sin embargo para que siga adelante, estima la cantidad de dinero que solicita en calidad de préstamo. Apoya a esta madre que demuestra sus dotes para los negocios.
texts.en:
Perla has been selling food at night for many years. She is a woman that considers herself to be versatile in business since in the mornings she sells fruits in a mobile manner. When there isn't fruit she sells vegetables and this way varies the products to be sold according to the needs of the customers. Her businesses have been profitable due to her house, which is located in a very busy area with many tourists. She is 46 years old and a mother of 5 children that are independent and working. The important thing for her is to continue ahead and not to fall behind; she wants to expand her food selling business since she has a great following due to her flavorful cooking and cheerfulness. Nonetheless, in order to continue ahead she needs a loan in the amount that she is requesting. Support this mother that has shown her business talents.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her food selling business

loans.name: Aseh Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a widow with seven children. She lives in Mbengwi, a town about an hour outside Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in selling palm oil and rearing pigs. More specifically, this loan will be used for pig feed and the purchase of palm oil. She intends to invest 30,000 CFA (60 USD) of her personal savings in her businesses.

This is Lydia's fourth loan; she has been a member of GHAPE since 2004. The prime location of her business will help her succeed. As well, her children can help her whenever she needs an extra hand or if she is ill. She also has the security of large pigs to sell if she ever needs extra capital.

The profits from this loan will be used to take care of her young grandchild and pay the school fees for her two children under 15. She profited largely from her past loans and was able to exchange ideas, problems, and solutions with other members and credit assistants. This exchange of information has helped her business skills greatly.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Pig feed, a male pig, a female pig, palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Mayda es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Grandes Retos”, tiene 33 años de edad y es madre de una niña. Su más grande éxito en su vida personal es ser profesional y como única dificultad es que está separada y sus ingresos son los únicos con los que cubre todos los gastos familiares.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa y joyas a pedido, que trae desde la ciudad de Lima y distribuye a sus clientes al crédito y al contado. Su último crédito de 300 soles lo invirtió en la compra de joyas y zapatos. Mayda comenta que le gustaría recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en: Mayda is a member of the "Mujeres de Grandes Retos" communal bank. She is 33 years old and is the mother of a little girl. Her biggest success in her personal life is being a professional and her only difficulty is that she is separated and her income is the only one that covers all of the family expenses. She works in the sale of clothes and jewelry, which she brings from Lima and distributes to her clients on credit and with cash. Her last credit of 300 soles was invested in the purchase of jewelry and shoes. Mayda comments that she likes receiving trainings to better her business and personal life.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and shoes.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es madre de 3 hijos: Patricia de 39 años, Jesús de 36 años y Coral de 33 años, todos adultos.
Ella inició el negocio en Abril de 2003 porqué necesitaba tener un ingreso para sostenerse ella y una hija que tenía muy enferma ya que hace mas de cinco años su esposo los abandonó y dejo de ayudarles. Lamentablemente su hija murió tiempo después inicio el negocio gracias a una vecina que la animó a que vendiera productos de belleza ya que ella le decía que estos productos siempre tienen una buena demanda. Poco a poco fue progresando porque sus clientes fueron aumentando al igual que sus ganancias y al día de hoy le va bien. Además de la venta de cosméticos en esta temporada navideña ella elabora manualidades alusivas a la navidad con lo que incrementa un poco más sus ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $10,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar cosméticos y materia prima para la elaboración de sus que le permitirán atender los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marcela is a mother of three children: Patricia of 39 years, Jesús of 36 years and Coral of 33 years, all of whom are adults. She started her business in April of 2003 because she needed sufficient income to support herself and one of her daughters, who was very sick and whose husband abandoned and stopped supporting them over five years ago. Sadly, her daughter died a short while after she started her business. She started selling beauty products after being encouraged to sell them by a neighbor who said that there was always a good demand for beauty products. Little by little she made progress as she increased her customer base as well as her income, which is still progressing to this day. In addition to selling cosmetics, she sells Christmas themed handicrafts during the Christmas season, which help to increase her earnings.

Marcela needs a loan for $10,000 MXN, which she will repay in 12 payments. The loan will be used to purchase cosmetics and raw materials to create her Christmas handicrafts so that she can fill the orders from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda A. is forty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three girls and three boys. She says two of her children have completed junior high school. The rest are still in the basic school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming as well as a commercial community.
