Belinda works hard to help her husband take care of the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops such as cassava in the community they live in. She sells fresh yams in the local market square. Belinda buys tubers of yam all the way from Techiman in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana and sometimes from the surrounding villages. She has been in business for about six years. She also distributes the yams to food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy tubers of yam on large scale so that she can cut down on costs, as in frequent trips to procure the goods, and so maximize her profit margin. She hopes to help her husband see their children through school.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam for re-sale

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “03 D. Mayo”, en el barrio Progreso, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno; tiene 68 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 07 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (primero D. primaria).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años; tiene un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes y golosinas al menudeo; su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (golosinas). 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 400.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá complementar su negocio y comprar mas mercadería (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.), con lo cual podrá ofrecer a sus clientes todo lo que necesiten, ella piensa sostenerse así misma en cuanto a su salud y alimentación, y ayudar en algo a sus hijos puesto que ellos están lejos y tienen su propia familia.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the communal bank "The Third of May" located in the neighborhood named Progress, in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, and in the department of Puno. She is 68 years old, is married and has 7 children. She was unable to complete primary school.

She has worked in the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 2 years. She has a business where she sells groceries and candy. Her first loan was for 300 Soles, which she used to buy candy to sell.

With this new loan of 400 Soles she will be able to help her store by buying more merchandise like rice, sugar, pasta, milk, etc. She plans to repay the loan in 5 monthly quotes. With the new merchandise she will be able to offer her customers everything they need. She works hard to be able to take care of herself and her family. Her children are grown and have their own families, but she would like to be able to help them if they ever need it.

(Translated by Ally and Thatcher of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise like rice, sugar, pasta, milk, etc.

loans.name: Adjowa Egbe

texts.fr: Egbe est une femme mariée qui habite avec son mari et ses deux enfants le quartier d’adidogomé. Elle fait comme commerce la vente du bois de chauffage et parfois aussi du charbon de bois. Elle a déjà obtenu de wages un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Actuellement son stock de bois de chauffe est épuisé c’est pour cela qu’elle demande à wages un deuxième crédit afin de rehausser son stock et satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Egbe is a married woman who lives with her husband and her two children in the Adidogomé neighborhood. Her business consists in selling firewood, and occasionally also charcoal. She already received a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, and it was repaid without problems. She's currently out of stock of firewood, this is why she's seeking a second loan in order to bolster her stock and meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Angela Maritza

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal en la ciudad de León la señora Ángela L. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en su propio establecimiento donde es visitada a diario por muchas personas.

Con el compromiso de brindar un buen producto al cliente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las frutas y verduras para así ofertarlas y continuar buscando la manera de mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the market known as La Terminal in the city of León, Angela Lopez works diligently in the fruit and vegetable stand where she is visited daily by many people. With a commitment to provide the clients with a good product she has turned to Ceprodel to apply for a loan with which to buy the fruit and vegetables she will then offer to her clients, as she continues to look for ways to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. is fifty-four years old. She is a widow and has three children. Currently, two are pursuing education in senior high school. Elizabeth lives with some of her children in a family house in a town called Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Elizabeth lost her husband after a short illness two year ago. She works with zeal as a single parent to support her family and provide for her children's schooling. She is a fishmonger and also sells used clothes. She sells her wares in a shed in the local market square. She procures her goods from wholesale fishmongers in the towns of Yeji and Mankessim. She has been in business for twenty-five years. According to her, most of her customers are food vendors in her community. 

Elizabeth believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and other assorted fish in bulk to serve a larger market and, eventually, help improve her family finances. She also wants to continue to provide for her children's education, which is very dear to her heart. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Joshua Trust Group. Members in this group provide guarantees for one another as social collateral to access the loan.  They also support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure tilapia and other fish in bulk.

loans.name: Simiatu

texts.en:
Simiatu is 43 years old and married with seven children.She runs a restaurant business, where she sells cooked foods, local gin, and other drinks. She hopes to obtain a loan amount of N50,000 in order to purchase more local gin and drinks to sell in her restaurant.

Simiatu sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin and other drinks to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline sells dresses and other clothes in their village that she purchases in Manila. She goes house to house selling her products, which also include frozen foods. Evangeline is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 as additional working capital for her business. She wants to prove to herself that she can improve her business on her own, allowing her to feel more empowered and confident. Evangeline is 52 years old and married to Leandro S., a village carpenter and farmer. They live in Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela, a rural place near the Cagayan River. They have three children who all have their own livelihoods and are preparing for their future families.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Milva Edith

texts.es:
Milva es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí.
Milva es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hija, Milva junto a su esposo tienen una tienda agro veterinaria llamada Nicol, ubicada en una avenida transitada en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Milva necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos veterinarios.
Los sueños de Milva son tener casa propia y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Milva is a meber of the Banco Comunal Capulí [Community Bank of Capulí]. Milva is 30 years old, has one child and with her common law husband has an agricultural veterinarian store called Nicol. The rented storefront is located on a main avenue and is open for business everyday. Milva needs a loan of 800 Peruvian Soles that would be invested in the purchase of veterinarian products. Milva dreams of having her own home and that her daughter becomes a working professional.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase veterinarian products.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.en:
Pablina is 58 years old and is married to Angel Benitez, who is 63 and who has been working as a chauffeur for more than twenty years, supporting the household expenses. 
Pablina started her business thirty years ago on her own initiative, as there were no other grocery stores in the area.  Her small grocery store continues to do very well and she has a well-established clientele, as her business is well stocked. 
She has five children, all older, with professional jobs thanks to the effort of Pablina and her husband.  She needs the loan in order to purchase general merchandise such as sugar, flour, herbs, rice, noodles, dairy products, breads and beverages in general.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as sugar, flour, noodles, rice, oil, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 58 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 07 hijos y no tiene estudios,  vive en la Comunidad de Sales Grande Sector Caballo Silla Condoriri Ilave.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor para engorde, los cuales los adquiere en las comunidades de la zona, luego los vende en la feria de Ilave

Su deseo es seguir con el negocio y comprar más ganado para cría.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la facilidad de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to the 3 de Mayo Community Bank, which is located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 58, married, and she has seven children. She does not have an education. She lives in the Sales Grande community, Sector Caballo, Silla Condoriri Ilave. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought regional products. She now needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy small livestock to fatten. She gets them from the communities in her area, and she later sells them in the Ilave fair. Her wish is to continue with the business and to buy more livestock to raise. (About her community bank) She likes the savings and the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock to fatten

loans.name: Edeltrudis

texts.en:
Edeltrudis is a member of the Juhudi borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is 50 years old, widowed, and mother of five children. Her children are ages 33, 31, 27, 25 and 22 years. 

Edeltrudis started her own business selling chicken seven years ago. She works 24 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Eldetrudis’ first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more chicken. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Eldeltrudis hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more chicken

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Capital to buy materials for her crafts

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide C. is a 57 year old mother of five. Her eldest is 29 and not living with them anymore. She joined CEVI in 2002 because her friend convinced her to join. Because she likes the policy and the interest rate ( 2% a month) of her loan, she has stuck with the program for seven years now. Her business is rice farming; she has been helping her husband till a 1.5 hectare farm to have an income to feed and clothe her family.

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming necessities and start a new business as well. Aside from farm she also raises pigs. She will also buy piglets and feed.

loans.use: Farming and piggery supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta L. is from the village of Poblacion,Sinacaban , Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Julieta is married and has 1 school-age child. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized "food and sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste etc.in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2008, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita T. is a seaweed grower. She has two children. Her eldest child is five years old and is ready to receive elementary education next year. She works all day to be able to earn an income to provide for their daily needs. The reason why she continually ensures the abundant growth of seaweed at her farm is to be able to save money for the future education of her children.

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy more seaweed seedlings. Now that she aims for business expansion, she needs more capital to realize all her business plans. Receiving a loan is truly worthwhile because this will help her increase her ability to produce income.

loans.use: To buy seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita L. is from the village of Olingan. She is 47 years old. Carmencita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Carmencita owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carmencita is just starting this business.

In 2008, Carmencita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmencita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Carmencita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Mrs. Hen U., 51 years old, and her husband, Mr. Nai Sok, 52 years old, have been married since 1975 and have 6 children: 2 sons and 4 daughters. Unfortunately, one of the children died. Two children are married and live outside the family home and the other two are garment factory workers. The family lives along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
Hen and her husband have been growing rice for 30 years. They grow the rice on their farmland in the village. Hen doesn’t have enough capital to develop her rice farm. This is why she is applying for her first loan of $700 to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and to pay the fees for plowing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita E. is from the village of Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Cristita is widowed and has 3 adult children.

In 2009, Cristita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Cristita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cristita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jocily

texts.en:
Jocily G. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Jocily is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocily owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling used clothing, locally known as ukay ukay in the local community. Jocily has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jocily is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jocily from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin B. is a 31-year-old single man, currently living at Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.

2009, Franklin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

He is requesting a loan amounting to 7,000 PHP as additional capital for his new business which is a sari-sari (variety) store. He will purchase items to make his new little store full of stock. This amount will be his 2nd loan from PMPC.

loans.use: purchase items/stock for his new sari-sari store

loans.name: Urpis De Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS D. CONFRATERNIDAD”; nuestros socios son en su mayoría residentes en la ciudad del Cusco y naturales D. diferentes departamentos del Perú.

Debido a que la ciudad del Cusco no cuanta con fábricas D. ropas, juguetes, y otros estos miembros del grupo son comerciantes que traen mercadería D. diferentes partes del país, por ejemplo del norte del país traen zapatos, D. la capital ropa y juguetes, del sur del país materiales D. construcción. Nuestros socios trabajan en el centro comercial D. confraternidad, ellos son comerciantes minoristas; los socios solicitan el préstamo D. dinero para poder viajar a traer mayor número D. mercadería para implementar sus stands.

Nuestros socios agradecen la oportunidad brindada y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Urpis D. Confraternidad Communal Bank. Most of our members resiD. in the city of Cusco, and they are from different departments in Perú. The city of Cusco does not have clothing or toy factories, and some members of the group are merchants who bring their merchandise from other parts of the country. For example, they bring shoes from the northern part of the country, clothes and toys from the capital, and construction materials from the south of the country. Our members work at the collective shopping center, and they are merchants with small businesses. The members are asking for a loan to be able to travel to bring a larger amount of merchandise to stock their stands. Our members are grateful for the opportunity, and they value the loan. They promise to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to be able to stock their stands

loans.name: Tiburciana

texts.es:
Tiburciana es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Tiburciana es conviviente y tiene 52 años, Tiburciana vende comida de manera ambulatoria en el paradero de una ruta de transporte publico, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Tiburciana necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne y papa.
Los sueños de Tiburciana son ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Tiburiciana is a member of the Agua Viva Communal Banka. Tiburciana lives with someone and she is 52 years old. She is a street food vendor on a public transport stop. She does this every day. Tiburiciana needs a loan of 750 soles which will be invested in the purchase of meat and potatoes. Tiburciana's dream is to expand her business and for her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat and potatoes.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en: Y. Sharofat is 47 years old and has sold foodstuffs in her grocery for more than five years. She began her business as a street vendor near the local school of her community. Over time she expanded her business and now she has a grocery store where she sells her goods. Weekly Sharofat travels to the neighboring town for purchasing new goods. Currently she is requesting a loan of 13,000 Somoni for purchasing foodstuffs to expand her business. Sharofat sincerely thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with the loan repayment. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem K., age 48, is married and resides with her children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is in a business of buying more rice in stock to resell to make more profit, earning an income of  $7 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. Her husband helps his wife in the business, earning an income of $6 per day. He has been with this job since 2000. K. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more rice from the local farmer in stock. This is her second loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva. (K. is pictured with her daughter.)

loans.use: To buy rice in stock for sale

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy M. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Mary Joy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Joy owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling wood in the local community. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Mary Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema M. S. is from the city of  Vehari in Pakistan. She has a two room house in which she has been living with her family for the last 20 years. She is an uneducated lady but she has very good talking skills.  She owns and operates her clothes selling business. She purchases clothes from different cites (Lahore & Faisalabad) because of their cheap rates and great quality items. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She sells the clothes in her community and earns good profit on it. 
Her husband name is M. S.. He is a milk seller. He gets milk from his cow and sells to the milk shops and in the community. Presently they have one cow but now they want to expand their dairy business. For this reason Haleema is requesting of a loan to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy another cow for a dairy business

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed is a 38 year old woman. She has resided in a two room brick house in a city Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 
She is a mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her elder son is 18 years old and works with his father. Her elder daughter is 15 years old and reads in 10th standard. Her younger daughter is 12 years old and reads in 7th standard. 
Her husband's name is M. S.. He runs a sanitary supplies selling business. His shop is located in the market. Naheed supports him by preparing decorative embroidered clothes. She gets orders from her neighbors, and from the cloth shops as well, and generates a good income. 
She is a regular client of Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). She is applying for a loan for the fourth time to purchase the sanitary supplies, such as (taps, water pipes) in bulk, to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase sanitary supplies.

loans.name: Surur

texts.en:
Surur A. sells ice cream and bread at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions and tomatoes to sell.  Surur is 40 years-old and a widow.   She has five children and they do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly S. is an old mother blessed with a daughter who appears in the photo here. Ly S., 60, was married but her husband died of senility years ago.

To generate a daily income, Ly S. owns a small machine that she uses to provide a rice-milling service to neighbors. She also buys rice to mill and sell to raise more proceeds. She always receives help from her daughter to conduct her business. The rice commands a special price.

Ly S. is applying for a loan in order to buy rice to store and mill later to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice to store and mill later to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna C. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old, is married and has eight school-aged children. Edna owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruit like bananas for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Edna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Shareefan's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan is Christian by religion. She comes from Borewala, a city of shrines in Pakistan. She lives with her husband who is a government employee and is a mother of six children. Five of them are getting their education while the sixth one runs a timber-selling business. 

A very talented lady, Shareefan supports her family by making and selling artificial flowers. Her daughters also help her in her business. Her son has been involved in his timbers-selling business for over five years. He sells the timbers in the community. He does this work to support his family financially. He had to quit his studies but he doesn’t want his siblings to have to quit their studies due to financial reasons. Therefore, he started this business.
  
Shareefan has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her son's business. He will buy the timbers in bulk which will help him in fulfilling larger orders on time. 

Shareefan is hopeful that this investment will make a positive impact on her son’s business and he will be able to increase his income in a result.

loans.use: Purchase timbers in bulk for resale

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita M. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Normelita is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Normelita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Normelita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Normelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Normelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Normelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Normelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Unidas Somos Mas ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Unidas somos más está formado por 9 mujeres quienes luchan día a día para mejora su situacion económica y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. La mayor parte de las socias viven por el sector Nonodel a unos 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, realizan sus reuniones en el campo abierto debido a que a sus hogares no es muy accesible que ingrese algún vehiculo.

La Señorita Laura B. vive en el cantón Deleg, es su primer crédito que realiza, fue invitada por su tía que ya pertenece al banco comunal, se dedica a cultivar la tierra trabajando como jornalera.
Nuestra socia es muy joven ya que tiene apenas 19 años de edad es soltera y vive en casa de su hermana compartiendo los gastos, su crédito lo va a invertir en ganado para empezar con este negocio, su meta es  tener  casa propia.

La Señora Hilda B. vive en el cantón Deleg, tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 10, 7, 5, 2 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estan estudiando en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo trabaja labrando la tierra como jornalero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia también se dedica al trabajo del campo como jornalera, labora todos los días de lunes a sábado, pero también se da  tiempo para cuidar a sus animales ya que cría cuyes y pollos, los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica, es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir para pagar la cuota inicial de un terreno que está adquiriendo, su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank Unidas was formed by 9 women who fight day by day to better their economic situation and to improve the quality of life for their families. The majority of the members live in the Nonodel sector, some 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. They conduct their meetings in the countryside because their homes are not very accessible by car. Miss Laura B. lives in Deleg canton. This is her first loan that she has used. She was invited by her aunt and now belongs to the community bank. She works cultivating the earth as a farm laborer. She is very young, only 19 years of age, is single and lives at the home of her sister sharing the expenses. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of livestock to start her own business. Her goal is to own her own home. Ms Hilda B. lives in Deleg canton, is 26 years old, and is married with 4 children who are 10, 7, 5, and 2 years of age. Her first 3 children are going to the local school. Her husband works as a farm laborer. The do not have their own home, so they are renting. This member is also working as a farm laborer. She works every day Monday to Saturday, but she also takes time to care for the animals that she raises – guinea pigs and chickens. She sells them when she has economic need. This is her first loan that she is getting from the community bank. It will be invested to pay the down payment on some land that she is acquiring. Her dream is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy livestock, downpayment on land

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 29 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo Elvish y su hija Luana. Gladis y Elvish distribuyen sandalias y sombreros por mayor en el mercado el molino, ellos dejan sus productos al crédito a sus clientes y al final del mes sus clientes les pagan una cantidad de dinero. Gladis abrió un puesto, en el mercado Molino, donde vende ropa para niños. La pueden encontrar en su tienda, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. 
 
Con su próximo préstamo, Gladis espera recibir $400 USD. Por el momento, tiene suficiente mercadería en su stand. Le gustaría con el dinero del préstamo traer sandalias de la ciudad de Lima y seguir distribuyendo a sus caseras  

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Gladis hace dos años atrás es que recién participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Gladis is 29 years old and lives in the city of Cusco with her husband Elvish and her daughter Luana. Gladis and Elvish distribute sandals and hats wholesale in El Molino (The Mill) Market. They sell their products on credit to their clients and at the end of the month, the clients pay them a quantity of money. Gladis also opened a stall in the Molina market where she sells children's clothes. You can find her in her stand 7 days a week, from 7:00 in the morning until 9:00 at night. With her next loan, Gladis hopes to receive $400 dollars. At the moment, she has sufficient inventory in her stand. She would like to use the loan to bring sandals from the city of Lima and continue distributing them to local housekeepers. The “Las Leonas de (The Lady Lions of) San Jerónimo” communal bank has completed its 10th loan cycle, and Gladis has participated in this bank for the last 2 years. Things are going very well.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SANDALS IN LIMA TO SELL TO LOCAL HOUSEKEEPERS

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix M. is from the village of Segatic Daku Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old. Felix is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Felix raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Felix has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felix joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Felix is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Felix from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of hs family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business.

loans.name: Francia Elena

texts.es: Francia Elena tiene 31 años, su actividad es una pulpería que está ubicada en su casa de habitación, por lo que ha sido muy reconfortante pues ella tiene que hacerse cargo de su hijo que solamente tiene 3 años. este negocio inicio como una idea para sufragar los gastos diarios del hogar, por lo que con su esposo han logrado surtir, ella siempre esta brindado muy buena atención a sus clientes, se levanta muy temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de golosinas, jugos, refrescos, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Francia Elena is 31 years old and runs a general store out of her house. This has been very comforting for her as she is able to care for her son who is only 3 years old. She started this business with the idea that it would help defray some of the daily household expenses. Along with her husband they have managed to stock the store. She always gives her customers very good attention. She gets up very early in morning and works from 7 am until 9 pm. She is requesting this loan to buy candy, juice, soft drinks, detergents and basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita T. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 61 years old. Clarita is married. To make a living, Clarita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Clarita is just starting this business.

In 2008, Clarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Clarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Jargal B., age 30, is single mother with two children. She lives with two children, ages 7 and 5, in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Gobi-Altay province, Mongolia. Her oldest daughter attends a local elementary school while her youngest son is in kindergarten. She operates a grocery as well as consumer goods selling business in a rented pavilion at the Shine Altai market in her town. 

She started her business in 2008 by selling only a dairy products in her rented shop with working capital of 300,000 MNT and since then she has managed to expand her business to sell not only a variety of grocery products but also consumer goods through her shop. Her earnings have enabled her to purchase a new ger and fence. 

Jargal is planning to buy her rented pavilion by next year. She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase 1,5 tons of rye in order to make and sell flour for the  upcoming winter.

loans.use: To purchase 1,5 tons of rye

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia P. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, beans, rice and fish  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice to sell.  Emelia is 46 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant farmer. She has seven children and five of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona L. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Alona is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Alona owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, snack foods, and canned goods in the local community. This is a new business for her. In addition to this business, she continues to make and sell food such as chicken and pork adobo. Alona has been engaged in this business for more than nine years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Alona is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 48 years old. Alex is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Alex owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alex is thankful for his business because it helps provide for his family's needs.

Alex joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alex is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim N. is a 37-year-old married woman and local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops and she always gets good results from her plants. Mrs. Sim N.'s family is currently facing difficulty with their living conditions because their house needs repair. To solve the problem, Mrs. Sim N. would like a loan to fix a broken part of her house.

loans.use: To repair a broken part of her house

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
Pablo de 40 años, es un hombre trabajador que con esfuerzo y dedicación hace 6 años atrás comenzó a trabajar con poco capital como ebanista de muebles.  Poco a poco fueron incrementando las ventas de los muebles que elaboraba. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha trabajado y lo han conocido como ebanista ya que trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm. Para tener más ingresos también tiene una pequeña tienda en la ventana de su casa donde trabaja con ayuda de su esposa ya que tiene tres hijos pequeños de 13, 10 y 2 años que estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Para seguir en el negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo madera, materiales para tener una producción de muebles alta. Uno de sus objetivos es establecer en el centro de la ciudad un taller de ebanista y tener así mayor demanda de sus muebles.
texts.en:
Pablo is 40 years old and is a very hard-working man. Six years ago, with effort and dedication, he began working with a little bit of capital as a furniture-maker. Little by little he increased the sales of the furniture that he makes.

Pablo lives in a peri-urban region called Perimetral. He has worked as and is known as a carpenter since he works from 8am until 8pm. In order to earn more income, he also has a small shop in the window of his home where he works with the help of his wife, since they have three small children, aged 13, 10, and 2 years old. The children study in a public school.

In order to continue with his business, he wants to buy wood and materials with the loan in order to have a higher level of production of furniture. One of his objectives is to establish a carpenter's workshop in the center of the city and to have greater demand for his furniture.

loans.use: To buy wood and materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 13 years. Her main products are maize, potatoes, sorghum, tea and beans which are all sold locally. Grace is 33 years old and married with five children who are between the ages of 18 months and 12 years old.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will go toward the education of her children. She plans to own a posho mill in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Evelia Del Socorro

texts.es: Evelia Del Socorro su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en Fundación y siempre ha sido muy responsable con sus cuotas. A pesar de los problemas que ha enfrentado en el negocio ha salido adelante. el crédito será para la compra de colonias, tratamientos, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Evelia Del Socorro is a cosmetics sales person.  She has had this business for the last 9 years. This is not the first time that she is getting a loan, because they have been of great help to her business.  She has been with the Foundation for a long time and has been very responsible with her payments.  In spite of the problems that she has had to face in her business, she has been able to get ahead.  The loan will be used for the purchase of colognes, treatments, nail polishes, lipsticks among other items.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, 41 years old, married and blessed with a three-year-old child, sells radios, watches, belts and calculators so as to earn a living.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more self-reliant because his business has grown.  Paul hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future, and he is now requesting 30,000 Kes to buy radios, watches, torches and belts.

loans.use: To buy radios, watches, torches and belts

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma lives in Okara, Pakistan, where she owns a 3-room house that she and her family have been residing in for the past 10 years.   Asma is 30 years old, and a caring lady who stays at home and works as a housewife. She is a mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her son is 2 years old and her daughter is only a year old. Both of them need her full-time attention and Asma takes care of them very well.
 
Her husband, M. A., is a driver by profession who rents a rickshaw that he drives. Through the rickshaw, he provides transport to passengers and receives his fares according to the distance of the destinations. He has been in this profession for 9 years.  

Asma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a rickshaw and start his own transportation business.  Driving a rented rickshaw is disadvantageous because it is not always available for him to drive for longer hours.  With his own rickshaw, he can set his schedule to earn maximum income. 

Asma is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loans, she has maintained good credit and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book (the Asasah Passbook) is Asma.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw to start a transportation business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
For the past 12 years, Rose K. has been selling cereals such as maize and beans in Effiakuma Estate, Takoradi. Rose has completed a junior high school education. 

Rose and her husband, a security guard, have one child, Rose’s income helps pay for the household expenses.
 
Rose will use the loan to purchase greater quantities and varieties of cereals for sale so that she can expand her business. She anticipates saving toward her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase greater quantities and varieties of cereals for sale so that she can expand her business

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Maria Rosa tiene 50 años D. edad, es separada y tiene 2 hijos menores. Vive en el distrito D. Olmos, en la provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo. DesD. hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta D. comida y bebidas. Cuenta con un puesto pequeño en el parque D. su comunidad. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más insumos. También, desea comprar suministros escolares para sus hijos menores ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 500 nuevos soles. Maria es muy trabajadora y responsable. Posee buenas referencias personales y laborales D. su comunidad urbana. Ha manejado otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones D. manera puntual.
texts.en: Maria Rosa is 50 years old, separated, and has two dependent children.  She lives in Olmos district, in Lambayeque province, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.  For 2 years she has been selling meals and drinks.  She has a small stall in her local park.  She is very well known in the area and has an established and loyal customer base.  Maria would like to expand her business by purchasing more supplies.  She would also like to buy school supplies for her children now that the school year has begun in Peru.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Maria is very hard working and responsible.  She has good personal references and work references from her community.  She has received previous loans and maD. her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for making her meals and to buy school supplies

loans.name: Flor Mechoacan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor Mechoacan llamado así porque los integrantes pertenecen a esta localidad llamada así y flor porque todas las integrantes son mujeres, es por ello que se llama así porque ellas son las flores de Mechoacan. Es una población de gente indígena mixteco que trabaja día con día para obtener dinero para mantener a sus familias.
La señora Patricia Hernández M. es la representante de este grupo, esta casada con el señor Abel quien se dedica a las labores del campo, tiene 2 hijos que estudian. Ella solicitó el préstamo para poder comprar insumos para la elaboración  de comida ya que ella se dedica a la venta de tacos de res y tacos dorados de pollo y chorizo. Además de ese negocio ella tiene una pequeña miscelánea que de igual manera le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su familia. Su meta de Patricia es engrandecer su miscelánea y que sus pequeños sigan estudiando y tengan una mejor preparación.
Marcelina Hernández Q. es otra de las integrantes del grupo una mujer admirable que siempre a trabajado para sacar a sus hijos adelante después de que se quedo viuda. Ella se dedica a  la venta de tostadas ahí en su comunidad, solicitó el préstamo para poder comprar mas insumos para la elaboración de sus tostadas, además de las ventas de tostadas ella también se dedica a la elaboración de comal (herramienta de barro que se utiliza para la elaboración de tortillas echas a mano).
Marcelina trabaja todos lo días para mantener a sus hijos, darles alimentación y educación, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan y la ayudan con los gastos y los 3 mas pequeños estudian.
Su sueño de doña Marcelina es poderles darle una buena educación a sus hijos y que tengan un profesión para que el día de mañana tengan mejores oportunidades y no sufran de las carencias como las que viven ahora. 
La mayoría de las personas que integran este grupo se dedican a la venta de antojitos como son tacos y tostadas, y solo una se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
This group is called “Flor Mechoacan” because the members are from the town of Mechoacan.  The word “flor” (flower) was chosen since all the members are women, which explains the name “Flor Mechoacan”.  This community has a population consisting of indigenous people of Mixtec descent who work day after day so that they can earn money to support their families.

Sra. Patricia Hernández M. is the group representative.  She is married to Sr. Abel, who is a field laborer.  They have two children in school.  Patricia is requesting a loan to buy supplies for preparing food.  She sells beef tacos and golden tacos with chicken and chorizo sausage.  In addition to this business, she also has a small variety store that helps to cover her family’s expenses.  Patricia’s goal is to expand her variety store so that her children can continue to study and be better prepared.  

Marcelina Hernández Q. is another member of the group.  She is an admirable woman who has been constantly working after she became widowed so that her children can stay ahead.  Marcelina sells tostadas in her community.  She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for making tostadas.  In addition to selling tostadas, she also manufactures “comals” (traditional griddles made of clay used for making tortillas by hand).  

Marcelina works every day to support her children, as well as feed and educate them.  She has five children altogether, two of whom work and help with the expenses while the three younger ones are in school.  Her dream is to provide her children with a good education so that they can pursue careers that will give them better opportunities in the future and not have to endure the struggles they are facing now.  

Most of the members in this group sell snacks such as tacos and tostadas.  Only one member sells household products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for tacos, such as chicken and chorizo.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila P., who is 35, aims for completeness in life. Precila is a college undergraduate and is happily married to Rolly, a farmer. They have been blessed with a good and sustainable flower farm for years now. Together, they live in Pooc 2, Silang, Cavite, Philippines.

Precila has been raising and selling all kinds of flowers and ornamental plants for years now. She raises ornamental plants and flowers which are normally present at Filipino home gardens. She serves hobbyists, offices, schools and her local community. Along with this business, she also manages a variety store which is adjacent to her house. Every month, Precila earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

To help her continue operation of her businesses, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this to pay for sacks of fertilizers for her flower and ornamental plants farm. She also intends to use part of this loan to buy additional grocery items as replenishment for her variety store.

Precila desires a big grocery store and able to buy their own house and lot someday. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of fertilizers for her flower farm and additional grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Leocadie

texts.en:
Leocadie is 28 years old and is married with three children aged between 2 and 5 years old. Leocadie sells various items in her arts business such as: crafts, drawing etc. Her business is well-organized. She has 8 year's experience in her business and she starts her work from 6am until 9pm every day. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lender via vision finance company in order to expand her arts business by purchasing more items to sell like: crafts, drawing etc for improving her business. With this profit, Leocadie will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To expand her arts business.

loans.name: Levi Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Levi Vanesse  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 30 años es propietaria de un tienda de variedades la cual inicio con su liquidación y el apoyo de su esposo hace año y medio. Ella trabaja junto a su hermana quien le ayuda en el negocio e invertirá el crédito en ropa y zapatos.

Levi tiene un niño de 4 años y espera la llegada de su segundo hijo y su meta es tener una tienda grande.
texts.en:
Levi Vanessa is a 30-year-old, hard working, enterprising woman.  She owns a novelty shop that she started with her severance pay and with help from her husband a year and a half ago.  She works alongside her sister who helps her with the business.  She will invest the loan in shoes and clothes.

Levi has a 4-year-old son and is expecting the birth of her second child.  Her goal is to have a larger store.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 56 años de edad, está casado y tiene 3 hijos. Él y su familia viven  en casa propia ubicada en el caserío Jesús Del Valle en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, esta es una comunidad pequeña y rural de gente pujante.              

La actividad que desarrolla Javier es la agricultura. Cuenta con  cultivos de banano y de mango, el cual asiste diariamente. Además, cría ganado ovino y aves de corral, los cuales vende a los pobladores de su zona, quienes son sus clientes fijos.

Javier solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles que utilizará en la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de banano y mango. Además, realizará labores de poda, deshierbo y aplicará foliares al los cultivos, para lograr una mejor cosecha y  producto que podrá  vender a buenos precios.

Javier canceló puntualmente el crédito que con anterioridad nuestra institución le brindó. Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele este préstamo pues le ayudaría a crecer en su actividad.
texts.en:
Javier tiene 56 años de edad, está casado y tiene 3 hijos. Él y su familia viven  en casa propia ubicada en el caserío Jesús Del Valle en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, esta es una comunidad pequeña y rural de gente pujante.              

La actividad que desarrolla Javier es la agricultura. Cuenta con  cultivos de banano y de mango, el cual asiste diariamente. Además, cría ganado ovino y aves de corral, los cuales vende a los pobladores de su zona, quienes son sus clientes fijos.

Javier solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles que utilizará en la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de banano y mango. Además, realizará labores de poda, deshierbo y aplicará foliares al los cultivos, para lograr una mejor cosecha y  producto que podrá  vender a buenos precios.

Javier canceló puntualmente el crédito que con anterioridad nuestra institución le brindó. Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele este préstamo pues le ayudaría a crecer en su actividad.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes, podar y deshierbar .

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is divorced. She has a grown son, Alexander. Yelena is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she sells women’s outer clothing in the central city market. She launched this small business 16 years ago.  Presently, Yelena has about 35,000 grivnyas worth of clothes in inventory. Her monthly profit amounts to 6,000 grivnyas a month.
 
Yelena is seeking a 15,000 grivnya loan to restock her merchandise and generate additional income. She believes a good array of clothing items will help her better serve the needs of her clients and increase her sales. Additional income will allow Yelena to invest more in her family’s well-being. She hopes to do some remodeling at home to provide a better living environment for her son and herself.

loans.use: to restock her merchandise

loans.name: Rohban Group

texts.en: Here we see the four members of a loan group known as Roban. They are small businesswomen who live and work in the town of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 3,600,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva in order to expand their businesses. Fatu leads the group. She is 38 years old, married to a building contractor and has four children, all of whom are in school. She makes a living by selling bowls, palm oil, cakes, soaps and other items. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years and is applying for this loan to buy more items in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy bowls, palm oil, cakes, soaps and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juana Marlene

texts.en: Juana Marlene, who goes by her middle name, is 36 years old and lives in the city of Ibarra. She is single and lives on her own. Marlene is a sociable and friendly person who works as an artisan. Her craft is embroidery. She began her embroidery work recently and is starting her business with the help of this loan. This is her first loan and it will go toward cloth and thread for dressmaking. She hopes that this loan will help her increase the amount of dresses she is able to make for her customers and that it will increase her well-being. Marlene’s goal is to have her own business and export her dresses.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread for dressmaking.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife, 44, lives in the Philippines and is married with one child. She has a pigpen where she sells mature, grown pigs. She has had this business for ten years. Marife has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Marife has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Nuevo Amanecer”  está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, venta de joyas, preparación y venta de comida rápida, artesanía en tejido y ventas en un minimarket. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán. 
Paola delegada del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila y primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, además viste una chaqueta de cuero color negro y un sweater color amarillo. Ella se dedica al servicio en corte y confección de ropa, cuenta con una vasta experiencia en el rubro. Paola habilitó espacios de su casa para su taller de costuras, ahí cuenta con dos maquinas de coser puntada recta y una máquina de coser overlock. Confecciona ropa para colegios, cortinaje, además repara y transforma ropa. Comenta que durante todo el año las ventas son muy buenas, ya que recibe muchos pedidos para diferentes motivos y temporadas. Su horario de trabajo es durante las mañanas y las noches  todos los días de la semana, incluyendo los fines de semana. Paola recibe pedidos y también vende a domicilio sus confecciones. 
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará telas, cierres e hilos.
Sus metas son contar con maquinaria industrial, ya que de esta manera agilizaría su trabajo y vendería una mayor cantidad de productos. 
Paola vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos, ambos asisten al colegio. Uno de sus sueños es generar mayores ganancias para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza, sobre todo de conocer nuevas experiencias y redes sociales que le han permitido obtener nuevos datos para vender. Las capacitaciones le han servido en su negocio y también en su vida personal, ya que ha sido un aprendizaje integral. Respecto a las demás socias, estas son responsables y comprometidas. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) and has 17 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of occupations among which are: clothing sales, jewelry sales, fast food production and sales, woven crafts and sales in a minimarket.  They are all from the city of Chillán.

Paola is the communal bank group’s delegate.  In the photo she’s in the first row, first spot from left to right, wearing a black leather jacket and yellow sweater.  She is a clothing designer and seamstress and has vast experience in this line of work.  Paola equipped a room in her house as a sewing workshop where she has two sewing machines, a straight stitch and an overlock.  She manufactures school uniforms, drapery and also repairs and remakes clothes.  She comments that sales are good all year because she gets orders for different reasons and seasons.  Her work schedule is mornings and evenings every day of the week including weekends.  Paola takes orders and also sells her items door to door.  She buys her merchandise from distributors in the city of Santiago and will use the loan to buy fabric, zippers and thread.  Her goal is to get industrial machinery because that will make work easier and she will sell larger numbers of items.

Paola lives with her husband and two children who are in school.  One of her dreams is to generate higher profits to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She is very happy and grateful for the services given by Fondo Esperanza above all becoming aware of new experiences and social networks that have led to new sales data.  Training has been useful for her business and also for her personal life because it’s been integrated learning.  With respect to the other members, they are responsible and committed.

Chillán is a commune in south-central Chile.  The name means “Seat of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the language of our Mapuche indigenous people.  Chillan is also known as “Cradle of the Nation” or “Land of Artists” because many outstanding people in Chile’s history have been born here like the well-known pianist, Claudio Arrau, for example.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers and thread.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is married and has 7 children. She is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Melita is a farmer who has raised pigs for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase piglets and feed. Melita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Melita hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth, a 37-year-old married mother of three, lives with her family in The Philippines where she has a store in her home selling basic products of excellent quality at affordable prices.

Lilibeth believes that working hard is the key to success, and one of her business goals is to grow her enterprise by stocking it with more products. To this end, she is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy groceries such as sugar, assorted biscuits, soft drinks, shampoo, detergent, etc. to sell in her shop.

Lilibeth has faith that her efforts will give her the opportunity to provide her family a better quality of life, most especially her school-aged children.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as sugar, assorted biscuits, soft drinks, shampoo, detergent and other ingredients for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: The oven in the picture is used by Araba to bake pastries, bread and other items for sale. She is divorced and has six children. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and other supplies for baking. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy another oven.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other supplies for baking.

loans.name: Women Power Group

texts.en:
Liliyosa is 43 years old and lives in Masvingo.  She is married and her husband is a driver.  They have three children aged 24, 20 and 13.  The last-born is still at school.
Lilyosa sells clothes, seat covers and curtains.  She has one employee.  She also has some rental income. The biggest problem she faces is selling on credit and late payments by customers.
Lilyosa will spend the money she borrows to buy clothes for sale and will use the profits to help pay school fees for the children and food.
Over time, she hopes to open her own shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old housewife as well as a working lady. In order to financially support her husband, she sells clothes as well as operates a beauty parlor at her home. She has done a diploma in beautician. Her husband is a vegetable seller. He sells fresh seasonal vegetables to his customers at reasonable rates. She has 3 children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She knows the importance of education and wants her children to become successful in their lives by getting the latest education. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s vegetable business. With the loan, her husband will buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling to his clients for a profit. He started his business 3 years ago and Nasreen is hopeful that an investment will earn better profits for him.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Originario de  Larreynaga, Malpaisillo municipio de León, habita don Ricardo, de 58 años de edad ,casado, padre de dos hijos,  de oficio Licenciado en Biología, pero hoy en día se dedica al comercio . El trabajo como profesor en la universidad de León donde enseñaba biología esto lo hizo durante 18 años, pero dejo de dar clases y con su liquidación y ahorros que el tenia puso el negocio de molinos, lleva 13 años con este negocio , también se dedica a vender cereales, estos dos negocios son de lo que sobrevive , su humilde molino lo tiene en su hogar y es uno de los más concurridos en su zona pero aun  así él dice que necesita más publicidad para darse a conocer en varios lugares, tener más producto que ofrecer y darle acondicionamiento a su local. Es por tal razón que solicita el préstamo para comprar productos tales como pinol, pinolillo, semilla de jícaro, soya , canela y cacao que son los ingredientes que necesita para realizar sus deliciosos y muy solicitados cereales, también quiere darle mantenimiento y reparación a sus molinos porque ya están algo viejos. Esta inversión le ayudara vender más sus productos pues tendrá  materia prima para producir y maquinas en buen estado listas para trabajar. El desea expandir las ventas de sus cereales en varios municipios de León  y vender en Chinandega, invertir en compra de un vehículo para transportarse en sus rutas de ventas.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 58, lives in Larreynaga, Malpaisillo in León Township.  He’s married and the father of two children.  He has a Bachelor’s degree in Biology but is currently a merchant.  He worked as a professor at León University where he taught Biology for 18 years but he stopped teaching and used his savings and severance pay to set up a mill grinding business.  He’s had this business for 13 years.  He also sells cereals.  These two businesses allow him to survive.  His humble mill is located at home and it’s one of the most popular in his zone but even so he says he needs more publicity to become known in more places, to have more product to sell and to furnish his locale.
