This is the reason for his loan request to buy such products as pinol [roasted corn], pinolillo [roasted corn with cocoa added], jícaro seeds, soy, cinnamon and cocoa which are the ingredients he needs to make his delicious and highly sought after cereals.  He also wants to repair and service his mills because they have aged a bit.

This investment will help him sell more of this products because he’ll have raw materials with which to produce and machines that are in good working order.  He wants to expand his cereal sales to other towns in León and to sell in Chinandega and to buy a vehicle to transport himself along his sales routes.

loans.use: to buy grains and to service his mills.

loans.name: Mlambo Group

texts.en:
Sevious is a 26-year-old man who is married with two children, aged 3 years and 3 months. Neither of his children goes to school. They have one dependant who also lives with them.

He has been operating his stand at Garikai Flea market for three years and sells dried foods. He buys some of his products from Mutare while others he gets locally. He does not have any employees. 

Sevious has applied for a loan of US$150 to buy dried beans, rice and rapoko for sale. The client faces a challenge of packaging material to sell in smaller quantities. 

He has a vision of owning a wholesale shop in the next five years. He wishes to save money for his children's future from the profits he makes from his business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, and rapoko.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Las Mercedes del Distrito D. TambogranD., perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicada a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque. Bertha vive en zona rural D. este distrito y aún  no cuenta con servicios básicos.

Bertha se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores, como ovinos y aves D. corral, teniendo actualmente 25 cabezas y 10 pavos, los cuales cría y engorda para luego sacrificarlos y/o venderlos en su caserío o comercializarlos en el mercado local. Su esposo trabaja en un fundo agrícola como peón estable, y con estos ingresos pueden solventar los gastos familiares.

Bertha desea comprar alimento balanceado para el engorD. D. su ganado ovino y aves D. corral, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa. Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo y así mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Bertha is 50 years old; she is married and has one son. She is from the village of Las Mercedes in the TambogranD. district of the Piura Region. This town is about four hours from the city of Chiclayo. Bertha lives in a rural area that still doesn't have basic services.

Bertha works raising small livestock like sheep and poultry. She currently has 25 head of sheep and 10 turkeys, which she has raised and fattened to later sell them in her village or at a market nearby. Her husband works as a farm laborer, and with this income they can cover their family expenses.

Bertha wants to proviD. a balanced diet to fatten her sheep and poultry, so she has applied for a loan of 1,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This loan will help her continue to grow her business and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase feed for small livestock

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира по специальности портниха. Она занимается шитьем у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки разноцветных и однотонных тканей, чтобы сшить платья для торговли.
texts.en: Munira's profession is a seamstress.  She is involved in sewing at home and has been in this business for 20 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of colorful and single-tone fabrics in order to sew dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase colorful and single-tone fabrics

loans.name: Ronald Luis

texts.es:
Luis sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Luis sigue dedicándose a su profesión que es ingeniero geólogo y también sigue trabajando en la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos, chalinas, guantes, gorros, mantillas, mantas grandes, ponchos, chalecos y adorno en cerámica.

Luis con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio.

Luis solicita este nuevo préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería como por ejemplo desea comprar más tejidos. 

Luis se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luis continues to be an active member of communal "Choquequirao" from the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. Luis continues being a geological engineer and also continues selling crafts such as woven fabrics, scarves, gloves, hats, baby clothes, large blankets, ponchos, sweaters, and ceramics.

Luis was successful with his previous loan which is why he is interested in requesting a new one.

Luis is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as fabrics.

Luis is thankful for the opportunity offered through this medium and commits to pay off the scheduled repayments.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as fabrics.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a single lady who owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

Amina has operated a retail shop for the past year.  Her clients are neighbors and visitors.   She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  Amina dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan she wants to purchase more bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access working capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim, 62, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Kim and her husband are farmers. Kim is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase groceries to resell when she is available from the rice field. In the future, Kim would like to use her additional income to purchase rice in stock to resell when the price is profitable. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell.

loans.name: Joreynelle

texts.en: Joreynelle is 28 years old, single and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by growing rice and earns about PHP 8,000 a month. She joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan for PHP 14,062 to buy supplies for her farm, such as fertilizer and seeds. This will be Joreynelle's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a farm.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Château de Ségou. Le petit commerce de condiments (cubes magies, échalotes, ail, tomate, sel iodé, poudre de gombo), draps de lit, poisson, jouets d’enfants et habits de  friperie. 
Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, elles ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 11ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou (1ère femme en position debout sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de condiments dans le marché Château de Ségou.                                                                                                                 Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une  tonne d’échalote avec les paysans de la zone office du Niger à Niono. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché Château de Ségou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Oumou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 0000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. 
Madame Oumou a pour ambition d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Pour  acheter des échalotes

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
The featured borrower of this group is Sailabala. She is pictured here;the lady standing with a raised hand. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children. They live as a joint family, which means her husband’s brother and his wife also live with them and Sailabala helps take care of her husband’s parents. They are all farmers and cultivate the land near the house and sell the goods in the local village market. 

Sailabala is now requesting a loan to invest in her portion of the rice farm. She wants to buy higher quality seeds and fertilizers. She hopes this will help her earn a higher profit so she can save enough to buy more land for cultivation. She’s a little nervous about taking her first loan, but is also really excited for the opportunity to take the responsibility to help provide for her family. She wants to use the profits to have a good life for herself, as well as her family. She says, “I want to see my daughters have a good future. I expect to help them get married in a good family and for my son to become a government employee.”

The other women in her group are also engaged in farming activities and small shops. According to Sailabala, they all help one another. “If any one is at a problem, we are there for her.” 

She and her whole group say “Thank you” to Kiva for reaching out to help vulnerable women in India.

loans.use: To purchase higher quality seeds and fertilizers for her rice farming.

loans.name: Pamella's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Pamella, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Chwele District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 4 children, known by her community as a very resourceful person.

Initially, Pamella joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Pamella plans to buy a cow.

Between the 16 farmers in Pamella's Group, a total of 7.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is a single mother with two children attending school. She manages a small  plantation growing taro, banana, ufi and taamu. Her income from this is usually around USD 200 per week and she takes her produce to the market on Friday and Saturday. She also makes donuts which she sells at the local school between 10AM and 11 AM every day for the morning break. Her previous loans have mostly been used to buy fertilizer and weed killer for the plantation. In addition part of the loans have been used for school fees. She is the leader of her lending group in the village of Sataoa.

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser, weed killer and ingredients for donut business

loans.name: Luz Areli

texts.en: My business is making and packaging tortillas, and I have been doing so for 3 years. I distribute them in my community, and I support my family with the income I earn.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and packaging for tortillas.

loans.name: Washington

texts.en:
Mr. Washinton has a bar where he sells snacks, within a school in his community. This bar originally belonged to his brother-in-law, but after he left, Mr. Washington took charge.

At the beginning he sold snacks and later he began to sell bagged lunches, which he prepared alongside his wife. He now sells lunches on commission from various parents who children go to the school and who cannot prepare the lunches themselves. With the loan, he wishes to buy more supplies, as the demand for school lunches has increased and every time he offers higher quality products, his business increases.

Washington is sure that with the additional supplies, he will attract more customers and earn higher profits. Washington is 35 years old, has three children and his home is made of reed. He is sure that with the progress of his business he will be able to give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El Sr. Washington tiene un bar donde vende golosina (snacks) dentro de una escuela de su localidad. Este bar en primer pertenecia al concuñado pero despues de quedar despedido lo asumio el.

En un principio vendia golosina y despues empezo hacer fiambres (bagged lunches) que preparaba junto con su esposa. Actualmente vende almuerzos a pedido de varios padres de familia de la escula que no les pueden preparar el almuerzo a sus hijos. Con el prestamo quiere comprar más mercaderia pues la cantidad de niños ha aumentado y como cada vez ofrece mejores productos la clientela esta aumentando.

Washington tiene la seguridad que con el incremento de que haga a su negocio positivamente podra tener mayor cantidad de clientes y asi mejores ganancias. Washington tiene 35 años, tres hijos que estudian y su casa es de caña. El tiene la certeza que con el progreso de su negocio dara a su familia una vidad mejor.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is an artisan, like the vast majority of the women in her village. She weaves blouses, skirts, tablecloths and napkins, and shawls and then embroiders them before she sells them to middlemen. They in turn sell her products out of state, where they are highly prized because of their beautiful colors and detailed work. Rosa is 34 years old, married and has five children. She belongs to a co-op called Fatima 7.

This loan will be used to purchase fabric and yarn to be used in expanding her production capacity so that she can sell her creations directly in high tourism areas.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANÍA AL IGUAL QUE LA GRAN MAYORIA DE LAS MUJERES DE LA ZONA DONDE ELLA VIVE, ELLA CONFECCIONA BLUSAS, FALDAS, MANTELES, CHALES, SERVILLETAS Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS BORDA N Y LAS VENDE CON LOS MAYORISTAS QUIENES LO COMERCIALIZAN FUERA DEL ESTADO POR SER MUY APRECIADAS POR LA BELLEZA DE SUS COLORES Y BORDADOS. ELLA TIENE 34 AÑOS, CASADA, 5 HIJOS, PERTENECE AL GRUPO FATIMA 7. CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS TELA, HILO Y AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION PARA PODER TAMBIEN ELLA COMERCIALIZAR SUS PRODUCTOS EN LAS ZONAS DE MAYOR AFLUENCIA TURISTICA.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and yarn

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila lives with her husband and three small children who attend school. She works selling sweets and regional fruits from the area from a small stand in her home. She started the business on her own initiative after seeing that the salary of her husband was not sufficient to cover the cost to educate and feed her family.

Her house is located in front of a community park where children and adults go every day to get some exercise, or simply have a chat. This location allows Domitilato to sell her products more easily. Her husband works nights as a driver for the municipality of Pucallpa, and is paid only a minimum salary for his work. He contributes this to the household and education expenses for his children.

Domitila and her husband's desire is to continue growing the business with the construction of a stand in their patio. For this, they need a loan of $250 which they will repay in 6 months. For the urgent need of Domitila and her family, let's help secure her dreams to improve the quality of life for her family and the education of her children.

Domitila vive son su esposo y sus tres pequeños niños en edad escolar actualmente se dedica a la venta de dulces y frutas regionales de la zona en un pequeño espacio de su domicilio. El negocio lo inició por iniciativa propia en vista de que el sueldo del esposo no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos de educación y alimentación de su familia, su casa está ubicada frente al parque de la comunidad que frecuentan niños, jóvenes y adultos diariamente para recrearse o simplemente charlar, el cuál le permite comercializar sus productos con mucha acogida.Su esposo trabaja como chofer en el horario nocturno de la municipalidad de Pucallpa, y por su labor percibe un sueldo mínimo, con el que contribuye a satisfacer los gastos familiares y la educación de sus retoños. El anhelo de Domitila y su esposo es seguir creciendo y mejorar el negocio con la construcción de un stand en el patio de su casa y para ello necesita la suma de 250 dólares en calidad de préstamo para ser retornados en un período de 6 meses, por ser de necesidad urgente para ella y su familia, ayudemos a concretar los sueños de Domitila y a contribuir con mejorar la condición de vida familiar y la educación de sus niños.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: THE LOAN WILL BE USED TO CONSTRUCT A SMALL STAND, AND TO BUY FRUITS AND SWEETS TO SELL.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a grinding machine for crushing tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Thaghet

texts.en: Mr. Thaghet is 48, and married with two children. He lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region. Thaghet is a taxi driver and is looking for credit so that he can make repairs to his vehicle which is his main source of income.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Tina's Mafamikio Group

texts.en:
Tina, age 42, is married with 3 children (ages 25, 20, and 18). She has a farming business where she raises chickens and cows. She started this business in 2002 and now makes a monthly profit of about $140 from her work. She works from 6am to 9pm daily maintaining her small farm.

Tina took out a previous loan to expand her farm and was able to pay it back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup who have businesses in timber and general items sales.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
The district of Cupi is located 40 kilometers away from the Melgar province. This town is a predominantly cattle raising and agricultural zone, and Mrs. Avelina C.’s family is no stranger to this noble traD.. She, along with her husband and two young daughters, actively works in agriculture and raising alpacas. Avelina and her husband, Miguel, work arduously and try to take the most advantage of the small plot of land that they inherited from their parents, meticulously cultivating barley, quinoa, potatoes, and other tubers, while concurrently raising their livestock. With these jobs, they are trying to augment the family’s income and keep their beloved children from want. She wishes to boost her capital in order to increase her number of alpacas and crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

A unos 40 kilómetros D. la provincia D. Melgar está ubicado el distrito D. Cupi. Este pueblito es una zona eminentemente ganadera y agrícola, la familia D. la señora Avelina no es ajena a esta noble labor, ella junto a su esposo y a sus pequeñas niñas se dedica activamente a la agricultura y al cuidado D. sus alpaquitas.Avelina y su esposo, Miguel, trabajan arduamente y tratan D. sacarle el mayor provecho y beneficio posible al terrenito que por herencia le dejaron sus padres, cultivando empeñosamente cebada, quinua, papa y demás tubérculos, al mismo tiempo se dedica a la crianza D. sus animalitos, con estas labores tratan D. mejorar los ingresos económicos D. su familia y a mantener sin privaciones a sus amados hijos.Desea incrementar su capital D. inversión para acrecentar el número D. sus animalitos y los productos D. sus tierras.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger number of alpacas and seeds to increase crops

loans.name: Emefa

texts.fr:
Emefa K., 40, is the married mother of four children. She walks through the central market of Avetonou, a little village located about 120 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital, selling "akpan", a local dish made of maize. With this loan, she hopes to buy two bags of maize to use in preparing her "akpan", a dish of which the local population eats a great deal. The bags of maize that are sold in Togo are very large, weighing about as much as a normal person would, and the cost of transport further explains the relatively big loan she is requesting. This will allow her to expand her sales, earn more, and better cater for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

K. Emefa, 40, est une femme mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle se promène dans le marché d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle vend « akpan », une pâte locale fabriquée à partir du maïs. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit, acheter 2 sacs de maïs pour la préparation de « akpan » énormément consommée par la population. Les sacs de maïs qui sont vendus au Togo sont d'une taille importante, à peu la taille moyenne d'une personne, et aussi le coût de transport expliquent la valeur élevée du crédit demandé. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes, gagner plus et répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use:
purchase two big bags of maize (corn)

acheter 2 grands sacs de maîs

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married woman with one child, age two. Bahati is a bed sheet and clothes seller. She started the business in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more bed sheets and other clothes for her business.

loans.use: To  buy more items for her clothes business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restart a small business cooking fried foods

loans.name: Kanchi Thapa

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi Thapa M. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati village. She lives with her husband, Mr. Bhairab Thapa M., and her two sons. Her father is a carpenter.  Her sons are in 7th and 12th grade.
Mrs. Kanchi is a farmer, growing different types of vegetables. Due to the lack of technology, most farmers in her area depend on seasonal farming.  
Mrs. Kanchi sells her vegetables at the local vegetable market in the morning and the evening. She is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy seeds and fertilizer. 
She wants to increase her income to provide a better education for her children and increase the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mukarwego's Group

texts.en:
Mukarwego B. was born in 1968 in Kimisagara. She is a married woman with seven children and two orphans under her charge. She sells crops. She began her business in 1999 with 5000RWF as capital. She currently has a capital of 200,000RWF. She has seven children in secondary school and pays for the school fees from income generated by her business. She has also been able to build their own shelter.

She is requesting a loan to increase her business and expects to extend it by selling honey from Umutara producers.

loans.use: Increase and extend her business by adding honey

loans.name: Erika Sandra

texts.es:
Erika is 28 and lives with her cousins, Vanesa and Yadira. Erika is a very enthusiastic young woman and wants to get ahead in life. Even though she has a college degree, she hasn't been able to get a job in her field and that's why she currently sells beauty products. Erika is from Lima but moved to Juliaca seven years ago to go to school. She works all day selling her products, since her income directly depends on the amount of orders she receives. What she likes most about her work is interacting with and talking to her customers, convincing them to buy her products. Her least favorite aspect is going door to door to collect the money. Erika works every day to create a better future for herself and to have a family in the future. With the money from the loan she's requesting, Erika will purchase additional products so she can have a greater variety and increase her sales. In the near future she would like to have her own stand to sell cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Erika tiene 28 años, vive en la casa de sus primas Vanesa y Yadira. Es una entusiasta joven en busca de superación, a pesar de contar con una educación superior, no ha podido ejercer su carrera, por ello vende productos de belleza, es natural de la ciudad de Lima, pero desde hace siete años reside en Juliaca a causa de sus estudios.Erika se dedica a vender todo el día, ya que sus ganancias dependen de los pedidos que tenga, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el tener que interactuar, conversar y convencer a las clientas de que compren sus productos y lo que menos le atrae es tener que caminar de casa en casa para cobrar. Erika trabaja todos los días para forjarse un prospero porvenir y formar una familia. Con el dinero solicitado comprara más productos de belleza para tener variedad de mercadería y vender aún más, y en un futuro cercano tener su propio stand de productos de belleza.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise (cosmetics) for her business.

loans.name: Livith

texts.es:
La señora Livith, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín,  provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa, se dedica a  la  venta de ropas para damas caballeros y niños y todo tipo de correas y bolsos, desarrolla su negocio en el mercado de la ciudad, sus clientes son las personas que a diario visitan el mercado a quienes atiende con mucha amabilidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra ropa para damas, caballeros y niños como polos, blusas, pantalones, shorts, ropa interior, gorros y toallas de diferentes, colores. Livith desea surtir bien el negocio para asegurar las ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y aprovechar la cosecha de maíz, pues ese producto mejora aún más las ventas.

La señora Livith tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 2 hijos, quienes aún dependen de ella. Se caracteriza por ser muy optimista y perseverante. Su meta es contar con un local propio para asegurar y hacer crecer el negocio ya que vende en el suelo, en un espacio del mercado.
texts.en:
Livith belongs to the Communal Bank “Judith Tuanama”. She lives in the area of Saint Martin in the province of El Dorado district of San Jose de Sisa. She is dedicated to the sale of clothing for women, men, and children, and all types of belts and bags. Her clients consist of the people who visit the market daily, and whom she tends to very pleasantly. With this loan of 1,500 soles, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will invest in the purchase of materials for her store such as inventory. Livith hopes to improve her business to secure her sales, and satisfy the needs of her clients. She also wants to take advantage of her harvest of corn, which will improve her sales even more. Livith is 36 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children who still depend on her. She is characterized as being very optimistic and perseverant. Her goal is to own her own store to secure, and grow her business since up until now she sells from the floor in a space in the market.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of cloths for Men Women and Children

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: El-Pidio Komla

texts.fr:
Mr  D. E. El-Pidio Komla  est un jeune célibataire sans emploi né à Lomé le  18 Décembre 1984. Après ses études universitaires, il exerça comme stagiaire dans une société
de commerce de la place pour une période limitée et après il se retrouve au chômage. Cette situation l’a obligé à se lancer dans de petits commerces tels que la vente de manuels scolaires usagers et d’articles divers au bord des rues. Ce petit commerce lui a permit d’avoir une clientèle conséquente et en même temps une hausse de la demande.
	
Pour répondre aux besoins de ses clients, il sollicite un financement pour ouvrir une petite librairie et constituer un stock important en manuels scolaires neufs et usagers et en divers fournitures et articles scolaires. Ce financement lui permettra de relever ses revenus et son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Mr. El-Pidio Komla D. E. was born in Lomé on December 18, 1984 and is a young single man without a steady job. This has forced him into small local trades such as selling used school textbooks and miscellaneous items by the side of the road. This local trade has brought him a lot of customers as well as created an increase in demand. To meet the needs of his customers, he is requesting financing to open a small bookstore and stock up on new and used textbooks and various school supplies. This financing will enable him to increase his income and raise his standard of living.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell textbooks and school supplies

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Maximiliana es casada, tiene 43 años y 9 hijos, Maximiliana venD. emoliente (bebida caliente preparada con semillas D. lino, hierbas, cebada, que tiene propiedades curativas) sus ventas los realiza ambulantemente en una carreta y se ubica diariamente en una calle céntrica que se ubica cerca D. los terminales terrestres.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, linaza, cebada.
Maximiliana sueña con mejorar su casa, ampliar su negocio y educar a todos sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a partner of the Seagulls Community Bank. She is 43 years old and married, with nine children. Maximiliana sells emolinte (A hot drink that has curative properties. It is prepared with flax seeds, herbs, and barley). She sells the emolinte walking up and down a busy street and also stations herself each day on a central street near the bus terminal. Maximiliana needs a loan of 600 soles which she'll invest in sugar, linseed, and barley. Maximiliana dreams of improving her house, growing her business, and educating all of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maximiliana needs a loan of 600 soles, which she'll invest in sugar, linseed, and barley.

loans.name: Miramar Femenina Group

texts.en:
Zunilda J., one of the members of the group, came to Esperanza International with almost nothing, just a desire to work hard as a means of changing her life and the life of her children. Zunilda is the mother of three children: two who are young and one who is 35 years old. She said she had a hard time raising the eldest child because money was scarce and she did not have a steady income. With her two young children, she wants to give them the best possible future and put them both in school.

She opened a salon with her first loan and is now trying to increase the size of the business. This has been the first steady income in her life, and finally she is starting to feel like a proper provider for her children. She has never been so happy! She is excited that her children are in school and preparing for a better future. She dreams of sending those children to college, and would also love to travel someday. She knows that she is going to continue growing and become a real success story!

Zunilda is part of a "Bank of Hope," and in conjuction with the other members of her group she will repay this loan over the coming months.

loans.use: To buy products for the salon

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria es comerciante y venD. ropa y artículos para el hogar, su esposo es empleado y tiene 3 hijos 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Irpavi II D. la ciudad D. La Paz. Vive en casa propia pero no cuenta con el servicio D. alcantarillado 
Es la es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera que requiere el apoyo D. Kiva. El crédito solicitado será usado en la compra D. más ropa y articulos para el hogar. 
Su trabajo y las ganas D. superación  le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que con esta ayuda mejoraran sus ingresos y por enD. su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a merchant who sells clothes and other homeware. Her husband is employed and they have three children. Her home is located in the Irpavi II zone of the city of La Paz. She lives in her own house but does not yet have a sewage system installed. This is the sixth loan she has taken out with IMPRO and the third that she will finance with Kiva. The loan requested will be used to purchase more clothes and small home items. Her work and desire to improve allows Maria to access this credit which will help increase her income and therefore her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Álvaro

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro S. T. es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, ellos ya tienen 5 años de vivir en su hogar. El señor Álvaro trabaja como mesero en un restaurante desde hace 4 años y percibe buenos ingresos, los cuales son necesarios para mantener a su familia.
El señor Álvaro S. está solicitando un préstamo para construir una galería en la parte de en frente de su hogar para resguardar un poco el calor que se siente en la entrada de su casa. (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Álvaro S., sino aparece su esposa).
Esta mejora ayudará a que el señor Álvaro y su familia puedan vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Mr. Alvaro S. T. is married and lives with his wife and two children. They have lived together for the last five years. Mr. Alvaro has been working as a waiter in a restaurant for the last 4 years and receives a good salary, which is necessary to take care of his family.

Mr. Alvaro S. is requesting a loan to build a porch in the front of his house for shade against the heat so that they can sit outside about the entrance of their home (note: In the picture, Mr. Alvaro does not appear, but his wife does).

This improvement would be a great help to Mr. Alvaro and his family to be able to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a front porch for his home.

loans.name: Antonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Antonia pertenece al banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo” vive en Jr. La merced primera cuadra, distrito de Juanjui, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 27 años y es madre de 2 niños. Es conviviente, su pareja trabaja como vigilante. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente vende refrigerios en un local de un familiar, prepara jugos, además de tamalitos, juanes, sándwich, etc. Esto le genera un ingreso diario para el pago puntual de las cuotas del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/ 2,000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará mesitas, sillas, y alquilara un kiosco en el colegio para vender cuando comience las clases, además de los productos que necesita para su preparación.

Antonia manifiesta estar contenta de pertenecer al banco, y agradece el apoyo que le brinda.
texts.en:
Antonia belongs to the communal bank “Honestidad y Trabajo.” She lives on Jr. La Merced, first block, in the district of Juanjui, in the state of San Martín. She is 27 years old and is the mother of 2 children. She lives with a partner, who works as a watch guard. With her first loan of 300 soles she decided to invest in the sale of clothing. She has been working for 2 weeks with the bank. She actually sells refrigerated goods in a business of a family member. She prepares juices, and little tamales, juanes, sandwiches, etc. This generates a daily income that enables her to pay her bank quotas punctually. With this loan of 2000 soles, that will be paid in 6 months, she will buy little tables and chairs, and she will also rent a kiosk at the local high school to sell food when classes start. Furthermore, the loan will also be used to buy the products she needs for the preparation of her merchandise. Antonia expresses her content with belonging to the bank, and appreciates the support that it grants her.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs, and to rent a kiosk so that she may sell her merchandise at the high school when classes start.

loans.name: Eléphant Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Éléphant (deux mariées et deux célibataires) avec une moyenne d’âge de 23 ans, un enfant, vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koumantou préfecture de Bougouni  région de Sikasso.
Ces femmes font le commerce d’articles divers (charbon de bois, beurre de Karité, tissus, tasses, etc.). Après avoir correctement remboursé leur premier prêt de groupe, elles  sont à leur deuxième prêt qui servira à acheter, 800 sacs de charbon de bois, 100kg de beurre de karité, 200 pièces de pagnes et 200 mètres de tissus en provenance du Burkina Faso.
Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des paysans producteurs de Koumantou et des villages environnants, et des grossistes du grand marché de Bamako. Elles effectuent leurs ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs (venant des grandes villes) de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent avoir en moyenne 40.000 FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice servira à rembourser l’échéance du prêt et une partie réinvestie dans le commerce (achat  de moutons, des céréales).
A  l’avenir les femmes veulent avoir des magasins de vente.
texts.en:
The women of the group Éléphant (made up of two women who are married and two who are not) average 23 years of age and one child each. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Koumantou, in Bougouni prefecture in the Sikasso region. These women do commerce in various goods: charcoal, karité butter (from the shea nut), fabrics, tubs and basins, etc. After having correctly repaid their first group loan, they are on their second loan, which will serve to buy 800 sacks of charcoal, 100 kg of karité butter, 200 bolts of pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and 200 meters of fabrics from Burkina Faso.

The women acquire their supplies from rural producers of Koumantou, surrounding villages, and wholesalers at the grand marketplace of Bamako. Sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of retailers (from the big cities), women, and men.

The women hope to obtain 40,000 francs CFA on average per month. This profit will serve to repay the loan, and a portion will be reinvested in commerce (buying sheep and grain). In the future, they want to have some sales shops.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Mrs. Jasmin R. is married to Antree, a carpenter. The couple is blessed with two children, both in school. Jasmin became a member of Paglaum MPC under their Individual program in 2005. She has had previous loans from Paglaum MPC usually for additional capital for her Furniture Shop that she started long ago. She is now on her eighth loan, this one for Php 10,000.00. She will use her present loan to purchase of materials like woods, nails, varnish, glass and many others.

The couple wishes to expand their shop but they need more people to help her husband and capital to fill the customer's orders. Her children are already in college; she wants them to be able to finish their courses. She added, while I’m still a member of the Cooperative, I strive hard and be a MIGS member so I can access credit easily and hopefully all my dreams will be achieved. She is very grateful that she's one of the members of PMPC and has an opportunity to use KIVA services too.

loans.use: To buy woods, varnish, glass & nails

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en:
Agartha B. is 33 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, currently pursuing education in the primary school. She lives with the children in a family house in Oda, which is a farming as well as a commercial community in the eastern region of Ghana.

Agartha loves trading, which is the business by which she makes a living. She trades in tomatoes and other vegetables on a tabletop in the local market. She buys boxes of tomatoes, peppers, etc., from farmers who come from surrounding villages to sell at affordable prices. She sells mostly to the food vendors in her community. She has been in business for six years.

Agartha would like a loan in order to to buy vegetables in larger quantities so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure tomatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Comité Renacer, asi de denomina el comité conformado en fecha 17 de diciembre de 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora General, la Sra.Laura R. contactó con la asesora para informarse de como funciona el Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundacion Paraguaya.  Una vez enterada logró conformar un comité con 19 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando en el 2º ciclo del programa.

El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 500.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderias para la despenza (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lacteos, panificados, yerba, etc), venta de ropas, venta de cosméticos y perfumes, venta de carnes, venta de remedios refrescantes, ect.

Todas ellas estan trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria, ayudandose mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.

Laura R. - 	Despensa - 
Lorenza Cáceres  - 	Despenza - 
Raquel A. - 	Venta de carne - 
Marcelina C.  - 	Venta de ropas - 
Ambrosia M. - 	Venta de carne - 
Juliana S.	- Venta de lencerias - 
Mirtha Benítez - 	Venta de frutas - 
Benita S. -  	Venta de ropas - 
María Quiroga - 	Copetín - 
María A. - 	Venta de ropas - 
Abelina V.	 - Venta de frutas - 
Josefina V.	- Venta de frutas - 
María M. - 	Venta de ropas - 
María Fernández	 - Despensa - 
Delcy P.	 - Venta de ropas - 
Mariacita González	- Venta de carnes - 
Elsa R.	- Venta de mercerias - 
Rosa S.	- Venta de remedios refrescantes - 
Lorenza Martínez	- Venta de cosméticos -
texts.en:
Comité Renacer is the name of the committee constituted on December 17, 2008, thanks to when the current Director General, Mrs. Laura R., contacted the advisor to find out how the Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundación Paraguaya (Program for Women Entrepreneurial Committees Paraguayan Foundation) worked. Once she was well-informed, she managed to constitute a committee of 19 women who are now working in the second cycle of the program. The average loan withdrawn for each member is for 500,000 Gs, which will be intended for different activities such as hardware sales, sales of foodstuffs (rice, sugar, pasta, dairy products, baked goods, yerba tea, etc.), clothing sales, cosmetics and perfume sales, meat sales, traditional medicine sales, etc. All of the women are working in a united and jointly-shared way, mutually helping themselves to arrive at their common objectives, which they all have within the group and with the Fundación Paraguaya. Laura R. - food store Lorenza Cáceres - food store Raquel A. - meat shop Marcelina C. - clothing shop Ambrosia M. - meat shop Juliana S. - linen shop Mirtha Benítez - fruit shop Benita S. - clothing shop María Quiroga - liqueurs/spirits María A. - clothing shop Abelina V. - fruit shop Josefina V. - fruit shop María M. - clothing shop María Fernández - food store Delcy P. - clothing shop Mariacita González - meat shop Elsa R. - hardware shop Rosa S. - traditional medicine shop Lorenza Martínez - cosmetics shop

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs (rice, sugar, yerba tea, dairy products, baked goods, carbonated beverages, etc.), purchase of clothing, purchase of hardware, purchase of cosmetics and perfumes, purchase of fruit, purchase of traditional medicines, purchase of linens, etc.

loans.name: Doeurn's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in Konh Taing Commune in Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Doeurn R., 47, has been selected as the group leader by the other members. Doeurn R. grows different kinds of crops, and she sells the produce to the buyers every three months after she begins planting them. She is the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local primary school. To support the family's food needs a little more, her husband works as a domestic building worker. The family spends a lot of money on taxi for touring requirements. They hope to reduce the transportation cost, which is why Doeurn R. is seeking a loan added with her personal saving to purchase a motorcycle to transport her produce to the market for sale. 

N. sells pork in the local market and she requests a loan to buy additional pork for sale. S. is a grocery seller, who is applying for a loan to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for family's riding requirements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing a very succulent groundnut commonly called « efio »

loans.name: Yelna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Yelna Isabel R. A., tiene la edad de 42 años , habita en el barrio San Juan , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijas , ya casadas e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder comprar un terreno y heredar a sus hijas , doña Yelna desde hace 11 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo ya que carecen de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para combatirlas, ella inicio esta actividad con esfuerzos propios . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Yelna Isabel R. A. is 42. She lives in the San Juan neighborhood, which is located in the Concepción municipality. She lives with her husband. He works and helps her with the household expenses. They have two married and independent daughters. Their family plans are to improve their living conditions and to be able to buy a piece of land for their daughters to inherit. Yelna has been farming for 11 years. The biggest difficulty is the pests that affect the crop because they lack the necessary fertilizers and supplies to combat them. She started the business with her own efforts. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to improve her crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers to apply to the crop

loans.name: Dolores Aurora

texts.es: Doña Dolores Aurora esta solicitando su 5to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para construir una habiatción, labora como docente de la Escuela  San José en la colonia San Francisco desde hace 9 años , esta clienta tiene una niña de 11 añitos de edad, la cual la tiene estudiando  su 6to grado de educación primaria, a pesar que es madre soltera ha luchado para que a su hija no le falte nada, es un docente que asume con la responsabilidad su deberes crediticios, ama su trabajo y posee  alto espitud de superación personal , Dolores se ha desarrollado en el campo laboral para poder ayudarle a sus ancianitos padres,  es una cliente que esta satisfecho por los beneficios que ha recibido por la institución ya que por medios de estos creditos a logrado comprar sus electrodomésticos  y ha mejorado su vivienda, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral salud y una vivienda  digna con buenas condiciones humana en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dolores Aurora is requesting her fifth loan from AFODENIC to build a room. She has worked as a teacher in the San José School in the area of San Francisco for 9 years. She has an 11-year-old daughter, who has finished her sixth year of primary school. Despite being a single mother, she has fought so that her daughter doesn’t lack anything. She is a teacher, who accepts her loan obligations responsibly. She loves her work and has the desire for personal improvement. Dolores has taken on fieldwork so that she can help her elderly parents. She is client who is satisfied with the benefits that she has received from AFODENIC, since through these loans she succeeded in buying electrical appliances and in improving her house. Her dream is to have job security, good health, and a dignified house with good conditions in her community. .

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma B. is already 60 years old. She is old but still strong enough to manage a business. She has seven children who are also married. She has been very particular as to the size of her harvest. That is why she encourages all her laborers to do everything to improve their yield. Vilma is a member of a CEVI cluster organization. She would like to ask for a loan to be able to buy sacks of fertilizer and chemicals. She is very optimistic that these things will help in having an abundant harvest on her farm. CEVI helps Vilma sustain her livelihood. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Jose Ovidio

texts.es: José R. nació el 16 de septiembre de 1,942 en santa Catarina Pinula tiene 5 hijos 4 ya están casados y el menor de 13 años vive con el y estudia, el casado tiene 18 años con una pequeña maquila en la cual tenia 12 personas trabajando sacaba 70 docenas diarias de blusas cerro su negocio por que viajo a los estados unidos  al regreso inicio su empresa de taxis y tiene 8 años de tenerla actualmente tiene 4 taxis y tiene 3 chóferes su ingreso diario es de Q 1,000.00 a la semana por cada taxi también tiene una paca, en la cual quiere invertir con el préstamo.
texts.en:
José R. was born on September 16, 1942, in Santa Catarina Pinula. He is married and has five children. Four of his children are married, while the youngest is a 13 year old student.

For 18 years, Sr. José operated a small import-export business in which he had 12 employees producing 70 dozen blouses each day. He closed the business so that he could travel to the United States. When he returned, he started a taxi business that has been in operation for 8 years. At the moment, he has 4 taxis and 3 drivers who are paid daily and generate weekly revenue of 1000 GTQ per taxi.

Sr. José also owns a wholesale clothing store in which he will invest this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Mnazi mmoja borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 32 Year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 15 and 18 years old. She also cares for other 2 dependent.

Elizabeth has owned a food business selling banana,potatoes, oranges etc for  8 years, she works 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately  200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Elizabeth`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities  for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Elizabeth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more food product

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is from the village of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Theresa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Theresa owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruit in the local community. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Theresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Theresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Theresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kao

texts.en: Kao S., 43, is married with five children. She lives with husband and children in Battambong Province. She is engaged in a business of sewing clothes and repairing motorbikes with one of her sons (pictured), earning collectively an income of US $5 per day. Her husband is employed at a private company as a security guard, earning an income of US $1.5 per day. This couple tries to work hard everyday to ensure a comfortable standard of living for the family. S. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase motorbike spare parts to expand the business of repairing motorbikes. S. hopes that the expected loan she is going to invest in her business will be successful so that she is able to generate more income for her household use.

loans.use: purchase motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
She is a vegetable vendor in the market.  She is 42 years old and married to Roger, 44 years old who works as a tricycle driver. They are blessed with two children: Glorybeth, a college student and Analiza, a college undergraduate.  She dreams that her children will finish their studies and have a more comfortable living standard.  

Anastacia wants to borrow a loan amount of PHP20,000 that she needs to improve her business. She will buy sacks of vegetables from different villages that she will then sell in the local market..

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Bread delivery and hog raising are Henry's main sources of income. His daily net income is Php 500.00. He wants to take a loan of PHP 9,000.00 because he will use it for the additional needs of his business. He wants to buy more bread to sell to gain more income. He is also a part time electrician in their baranggay. According to him, he will do his best in order to meet his family needs and he will pursue his businesses in order to have a bountiful and productive life.
He has been married to Rosal C. for almost six years now, and they are blessed with three children. Hansel, 14, is a second year high school student;  John Rey, 11, is in grade four; and Veronica, 9, is in grade two. They reside in the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural area. Their house is near the Day Care School and the national highway. He hopes that KIVA lenders will grant his loan to pursue his business to become profitable.

loans.use: To buy more bread to sell

loans.name: Hamida Najame Yar Group

texts.en: Hamida leads the Hamida Najame yar Group, which has four members, all of whom have applied for funding to expand their businesses. Hamida leads the group. She is a married and has two children, one daughter and one son, both of whom are students at the University of Kabul. She works as a seamstress and has applied for this loan to expand her business by buying a new sewing machine. M. Mamtaz and M. D. will use their portions of the loan to expand their grocery stories. Nelofar runs a small jewelery store and needs funds to expand it. All of the applicants are committed to improving their lives, and want to thank Kiva for its commitment to support the poor people of Afghanistan.

loans.use: to expand four small businesses

loans.name: Lourn

texts.en:
Lourn R., 35, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children.

R. is engaged in a business selling ground rice at a local market in the province, earning an income of US$8 per day. Her husband helps her in the business, and he operates his motorbike as a taxi driver, earning an income of US$4 per day. These incomes from R. and her husband help cover the family expenses.

R. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, R. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike to transport her ground rice to sell at the markets.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport her ground rice

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn T. is from the village of Map-an. She is 37 years old. Merlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a banana buying & selling business out of a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling bananas in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Juntos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS PARA EL PROGRESO”; los socios provienen en su mayoría D. diferentes provincias D. L. ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos viajan a diferentes provincias del Perú a traer ropa, juguetes, zapatos, materiales D. construcción en L. modalidad ferretería y otras novedades que debido a L. geografía D. L. ciudad del Cusco no se encuentran, nuestros socios pertenecen al centro trinitarias, son centros D. comercio y expendio D. ropa a bajo costo y D. toda calidad, Los socios solicitan el préstamo D. dinero para así viajar y traer mayor número D. mercadería para implementar sus stands.

Nuestros socios agradecen L. oportunidad brindada y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Juntos Para el Progreso Communal Bank. Most of the members are from the different provinces of the city of Cusco. Our members alternate their activities between the home and their small businesses. They travel to different provinces in Perú to bring clothes, toys, shoes, hardware, and other items, which due to the geography of the city of Cusco, cannot be found there. Our members belong to the Trinitarian Centers, which are business centers that sell quality clothes at low cost. The members are asking for the loan to be able to travel to get a greater amount of merchandise to stock their stands. Our members are grateful for and value the loan. They promise to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater amount of merchandise to stock their stands

loans.name: Maristelle

texts.en:
Maristelle A. is from the village of Curvada in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 29 years old. Maristelle is married and has 2 young children. To make a living, Maristelle owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells sugar, coffee, toothpaste, biscuits and candies in the local community. Maristelle has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maristelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maristelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maristelle is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Maristelle's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Abdugafur

texts.en:
B. Abdugafur has been selling women's shawls for eight years. He is 39 years old and married with three children. Abdugafur began selling to acquaintances and friends and, after a while, he realized that he had a lot of clients. So, he decided to rent a shop and establish himself in the market. He is a very enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. His business has been able to show the fruits of his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman. Abdugafur needs a loan of $1500 US, which he plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his clients. You can be an important part of the growth of this business. Today is your opportunity to help, have no doubt! More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increasing working capital for development of the business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong P., age 33, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in the business of producing ice cream. She earns a gross income of US $15 each per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially those for the children’s education. She has been doing this job since 2008. P.’s husband helps his wife in the business, and he also sells ice cream, earning US $3.30 per day. P. is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase a motorbike to transport ice cream to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport the ice cream.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn G. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old, is widowed, and has four school-aged children. Evelyn owns and operates a food stall, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Evelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juliana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora V. trabaja en una escuela de manejo con el salario que devenga ahí mantiene y sufraga los gastos de su menor hijo que tiene cinco años de edad, el crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL es para gastos personales. Ella sacrificadamente le quiere dar un mejor nivel de vida a su hijo y una buena educación familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. V. works at a driving school. She uses her salary to support her five year old son and to pay his expenses. The loan she is requesting from Ceprodel is for personal expenses. She selflessly wants to give her son a better quality of life and a good family education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie D. is from the city of Dona Consuelo, Ozamiz City. She is 35 years old. Rosalie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie provides welding services to local community members. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2007, Rosalie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Rosalie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rizeq

texts.en:
Rizeq, who lives and works in Ramallah City, has been a perfume and accessories distributor in Ramallah District since 2005. He buys accessories, perfumes, make-up, etc., and distributes them in Ramallah City and to shops and stores in the neighboring villages. After five years in the market, Rizeq has become a well-known and hard-working merchant.

Rizeq asked for a $1000 loan from FATEN to start his own store where he will sell the products that he distributes, in addition to distributing them. Rizeq will use the loan to paint and decorate the store and prepare it to exhibit goods. 

Rizeq's job is rewarding and he hopes the store prospers and becomes a major one in the city of Ramallah.

In the picture, Rizeq appears in the FATEN office.

loans.use: Store start-up

loans.name: Honronkantigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Honronkantigui est de  huit  femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans,  4 enfants et  habitant à Kafela  un des villages de la préfecture de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur treizième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers les céréales, le bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois à l’image de Djenebou S..
Djenebou compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 tonnes de charbon de bois.Elle s’approvisionne dans le dit village et dans les villages  voisins.
Elle les revend aux passants au bord du goudron et  à Sikasso ville les jours de foires hebdomadaires, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille (scolarité des enfants et mariages) et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Honronkantigui group is made up of eight married women who average 40 years old with four children. They live in Kafela, one of the villages of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their thirteenth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better meet their clients' needs. This group of women sells diverse articles like grains, firewood, and wood charcoal. Djenebou S., one of the members, counts on purchasing two tons of wood charcoal with her loan. She stocks up on supplies in her village and in neighboring villages. She sells charcoal to passer-bys on the asphalt road and in Sikasso village at the weekly fair. She makes her sales in cash to a clientele composed of men and women. She foresees making a median monthly profit of 15,500 FCFA which she will use to meet her family's needs (education and marriages of her children) and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood coal

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi A. lives in Ijevan city with her husband, a daughter and a son. For a long time, she worked in a consumer services agency. Since 2008, she has had her own food and household goods shop (which is only in that area), and also Varduhi's mother-in-law helps her to manage a fruits and vegetables trading in one of the Ijevan central streets. With the profit from her business, Varduhi was able to buy some necessary furniture for her house, and solve her family's needs. In future she intends to gain bigger profits and thereby to develop her business.

Now Varduhi needs a 700,000 AMD loan to extend the assortment of household goods (soaps, detergents, etc.) in her shop and to buy strawberries, cherries and apples to increase her fruits and vegetables trading.

loans.use: To buy more household goods for her shop and buy strawberries, cherries and apples for her fruits and vegetables business.

loans.name: Shah Sultan

texts.en:
Shah Sultan is a daughter of M. K.. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married with 6 children. Her husband has got a general store where she works to help support the family.

She needs to take out a loan for her husband to purchase essential things such as, beverages, canned food and so on. Her husband hopes to have a great number of clients and to progress more.

loans.use: purchasing beverages and food

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia V. is from the village of Linabu, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old and is married with six adult children. Emelia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling coco sugar and medicinal coco wine in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Emelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Emelia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Abbey Joyce

texts.en:
Abbey Joyce C. is from the village of Minante 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 29 years old, married, and has three young children. To make a living, Abbey Joyce owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Abbey Joyce has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Abbey Joyce joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Petra Consuelo

texts.es:
Petra de 58 años, ella tiene un taller de costura y confección, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas).

Hace años atrás ella aprendió a coser y confeccionar ropa ya que trabajo en una textilera, con esfuerzo y algunos ahorros decidió independizarse y trabajar desde su casa con una maquina de coser, poco a poco obtuvo clientela. Ahora ella tiene un taller de costura y confección trabaja desde las 06h00am. 

Para confeccionar mas ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, hilos y almohadillas. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para transportar la ropa.
texts.en:
Petra is 58 years old. She has a workshop for making clothes. She lives in Fortin de Guayaquil (suburban zone with unpaved roads and hills). Years ago she learned to sew and make clothing while working in a textile factory. With effort and some savings she decided to become independent and work from her own home with a sewing machine. Little by little she obtained a clientele. Now she has a sewing and clothing workshop. She works starting at 6:00 am. To make more clothes she would like to buy with the loan fabrics, wires, and padding. In the future she would like to buy a car for transporting the clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabric, wire, padding

loans.name: Shiyoen's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of fifteen people, located in BoE. Krum Leu village, Kandal province. Mrs. Shiyoen C., age 44, is the village bank president, having been selected by its members. Each member of this village loan will use their portion to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Shiyoen C. and her husband, Mr. Muth Kong, are farmers who own 1-hectare of land that they use to cultivate rice. Aside from farmers, Mrs. Shiyoen C. also sells groceries in the local village while her husband is also fisherman. With their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family.

In order to support her husband's fishing business, Mrs. Shiyoen C. will uses the loan to buy fishnets, a fishing machine for husband's fishing and with the rest of the loan, she wants to buy more groceries to resell. This couple has six children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, another is a laborer and two are attending the local school. The youngest is age 5, and not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy fishnets, a fishing machine for husband's fishing.

loans.name: Sonia Yeni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
