Sonia Yeni; ella tiene 31  años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de llamadas  a celulares, ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria en la puerta de una centro comercial de la ciudad, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes en el futuro. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  celulares y renovar sus líneas de teléfono.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sonia Yeni belongs to the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Community Bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, belonging to the province and department of Cusco. She is 31, lives with her partner and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with a cell phone call business. She works on the street outside of a city shopping center. She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. She wants to have a grocery store in the future. She is requesting this loan to purchase cell phones and update her phone lines. She thanks those who will be part of this dream through this loan, and promises to repay the loan as established.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cell phones and update her telephone lines

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie R. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: S. est une femme qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales notamment le maïs qui est très utilisé dans la cuisine togolaise; sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays pour avoir une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ces ventes. elle a une ancienneté de 7 ans dans ce commerce. faisant face à une rupture de stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 32 sacs de maïs et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Akossiwa S. is a woman who earns money in grain sales, notably corn, which is frequently used in Togolese cuisine. Her customers come from all backgrounds. She gets her supplies inland in order to have a larger profit margin on her sales. She has seven years' experience in this business.

Facing a stock shortage, she would like to restock and thus is seeking a loan through WAGES in order to buy 32 bags of corn and to arrange delivery of the merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena M. is forty three years old, married and has six children. Her children are between the ages of 13 and 25 years old. Helena and her husband  hope to give their children a quality education to the university level. 

Her business is located at the busy Mwingi market, though she is served by the Thika branch office. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. She operates a restaurant known by the name of Corner Cafe. She has been in this business for five years and has two employees. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is high prices for food items making food unaffordable to some customers. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy food items to make food to sell to her customers. She hopes to have many restaurants in different towns in the future. She describes herself as jovial, aggressive, accountable and inquisitive.

loans.use: Flour, rice, milk, etc.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren D. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Mongolia's Uvurhangai province. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent. His older daughter, who is six years old, attends a local primary school and his younger daughter is in kindergarten. Davaasuren makes a living selling spare parts for machines. He has been in this business for more than six years and has gained significant experience as well as built a stable company. He supplements his income by selling coal and firewood. He is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 MNT to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Dagva

texts.en: Dagva M. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and son in Hovd province, Mongolia. His only son is in kindergarten. He started his business in 2005 by selling construction materials with his help of his brother. Since 2009, he has been operating a fruit and household's goods trading business of his own in his town. His wife helps with the business. For the future, he hopes to continue growing his business. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more fruit and other small products for his retail business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit

loans.name: Thourk

texts.en:
Mr. Thourk O. (pictured here) is 36 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Leakhena Yean, is 28 years old. They live along National Road Number Six about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1994 and have three sons and one daughter. Three of their children are in school and the fourth is too young. 

Mr. Thourk O. has been a construction contractor for 12 years. His wife stays at home to take care of the children and the main source of family income is from Thourk’s business.  Thourk is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase materials for his construction business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Iona

texts.en:
Iona is married. She sells clothing at an open market in Novomoskovsk town. Good location and affordable prices attract many customers. Her net profit is 4,000 Grivnas.

Iona has been in the clothing sales business for 11 years. A few years ago, she took a break from her business to take care of her baby daughter. When her daughter turned two years old, Iona decided to return to her business. 

Iona is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnas to purchase additional inventory to increase sales. This business is the only source of income for Iona’s family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon M. is 51 years old and married with 10 children who are now between the ages of 2 and 30. Six of the children are currently attending school.

Zablon has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, that produces milk, sugarcane, tea, coffee and maize. He has been in the farming business for 20 years and sells his products to the local market.

He has requested this loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for his children. He would like to acquire four dairy cows in the next five years and open a butcher shop.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SUMAC SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Mercedes; ella tiene 34 años de edad, soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de publicidad, ella realiza propagandas acerca de diferentes tipos de productos que se desea publicitar ahora ella está brindando la publicidad de cursos de post-grado de la universidad nacional San Agustín de Arequipa, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en esta actividad y de esta manera ella sale adelante.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más volantes y todo lo referente a marketing de su producto que esta publicintando.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana Mercedes, 34, is a member of the “SUMAC SONCCO” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is single and alternates her daily activities with advertising.  She advertises a variety of products that need to be advertised.  She is currently advertising post-graduate courses at the San Agustín de Arequipa National University.  She has been in this line of work for some time now and this is how she gets ahead.

She is asking for the loan to buy more flyers and everything related to the marketing of the product she is advertising.

She is happy about the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy flyers and everything related to the marketing of the product she's advertising.

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Faïda sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le commerce des habits de la friperie, du riz, du savon, de l’encens et des légumes (laitue et tomate). 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire.
Madame Mamou T., a une grande réputation dans la préparation et la vente d’encens surtout du côté des nouvelles mariées. Elle  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 kg de magnonkisseni, 3 bouteilles d’eau de Cologne et 6 tubes de parfums. Pour fabriquer l’encens, elle imbibe le magnonkisseni dans l’eau de Cologne pendant une semaine au moins, ensuite elle l’assaisonne avec ses différentes qualités de parfums. L’encens ainsi préparé est reparti entre les bouteilles destinées à la vente. Elle se ravitaille en ses matières de base au grand marché de Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché Château à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Mamou T. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les petits besoins du foyer. 
A l’image des autres membres du groupe, elle ambitionne devenir grossiste dans la préparation et vente de l’encens dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Faïda solidarity group are married women who live in monogamous families. They average 32 years of age and four children each. They all live in the Hamdallaye district of the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali), and met through their income-generating activities at the Château market, in Ségou. They sell second-hand clothing, rice, soap, incense and vegetables (lettuce and tomatoes). 

In order to expand their businesses, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and are on their second group loan. 

Mrs. Mamou T. enjoys a great reputation in the preparation and sale of incense, especially among new brides. She plans to use her loan to buy 1 kg of magnonkisseni grains, 3 bottles of Cologne, and 6 tubes of perfume. To make incense, she soaks the magnonkisseni in Cologne for at least a week, then adds the various perfumes. The incense is then poured into bottles to be sold. Mrs. T. gets her supplies at the Grand market of Ségou. She sells for cash and credit, from her home and at the Château market, to a clientele composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, Mrs. T. hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA to be used for the needs of the household and for reinvestment in her business. Like the other group members, she aspires to become a wholesaler in the preparation and sale of incense through her collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for the preparation of incense

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 30, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. and her husband are employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 70 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase silk products to sell at the factory. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase silk products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Doña María, resiD. en Puerto el Triunfo, departamento D. Usulután, su familia está conformada por su esposo y dos hijos, ella tiene 56 años D. edad, su negocio es una tienda la cual la administra desD. hace 12 años, trabaja todos los días D. la semana y cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo.
Ella necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería, ayudando D. esta manera a surtir el negocio, a mejorar la atención a los clientes y realizar más ventas. 
Para doña María el principal objetivo y por el cual trabaja todos los días es que sus hijos culminen la carrera universitaria, para que puedan desempeñarse como profesionales y mejoren sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
María lives in Puerto el Triunfo, department of Usulután.  Her family consists of her husband and two children.  She is 56 years old, and for the last 12 years she has managed her store.  She works every day of the week, and her husband helps.  She needs a loan to buy merchandise, to stock her business, better serve her customers, and increase sales.
For María the goal for which she works daily is for her children to complete their studies at the university, so that they can work as professionals and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso tiene 51 años de edad y es casado. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Olmos en la provincia de Lambayeque, situado a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace varios años, se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. También se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. Cría los animales menores y cuando alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en los mercados locales. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.

Ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa  para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. También planea comprar alimentos balanceados para sus animales para que puedan lograr mejor tamaño y peso. De esta manera, podrá venderlos a mejores precios. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ganancias para poder solventar sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Narciso is 51 years old and married.  He lives in his own home which is located in Olmos district, in Lambayeque province, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For several years, Narciso has been providing a passenger transport service in his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle which consists of a motorbike with a cabin in back inside which he transports passengers).  He also raises and sells cattle.  He raises young animals and, when they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale in local markets.  He learned this business from his father, which is to say that he knows this work inside out.

Narciso has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can have some maintenance work and repair work done on his motorcycle taxi.  He needs to keep his vehicle in good condition so that he can continue offering a good service to his customers.  Narciso also plans to use his loan to buy balanced feed for his animals so that they can achieve a better size and weight.  This will enable him to sell them for a better price.  With the help of this loan, Narciso hopes to increase his profits so that he can cover his family expenses.

loans.use: to fix his motorcycle taxi and buy balanced feed for his cattle

loans.name: Shinehuu

texts.en:
Shinehuu, 52, is divorced and lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her two older children got married and she lives in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her son's backyard. 

Shinehuu came to live in Ulaanbaatar in 2009 and began operating a tailor shop. She wants to expand her business and create work places as her daughter is currently unemployed. She is a hardworking person with initiative who says, "I would like to expand my business in order to give jobs to other people including my daughter." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy additional stitching machines for her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stitching machines

loans.name: Mitooma Tumanyane Association, Bushenyi Group

texts.en: N. Betty is the leader of the Mitooma Tumanyane Association. She is 34 years-old and married with three children who are all in school. Betty has a retail shop that sells general merchandise to town residents in Mitooma. His shop is by the side of the road and this helps her to attract even passer by customers. She is able to make 90,000/= weekly income and she is grateful that she also sells bananas as a side business. She has had the business for four years and hard work and determination has enabled her to grow stronger. Her dream is to be able to set up another outlet in the future.She needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who is involved in the transportation business. He drives a rickshaw and provides pick-up and drop-off services to his passengers and school children. His rickshaw has grown old and its engine needs repair work. With the loan, he will repair the engine, which will help him provide better transport services and earn better profits. 

Naseem is a widow who lost her husband few years ago. It was a difficult time for her but she worked very hard to raise her two sons. Her youngest son works in a factory and contributes to the family financially from his earnings. Both of her sons were educated to the 5th standard but couldn’t study further due to Naseem's poor financial conditions. Naseem now prefers staying at home and doing her household work. She lives in Sahiwal, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Ghala mandi in a two-room brick house for the last 20 years. 

She hopes that through the loan, her son’s business will improve and she will be able to marry him soon. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. She is a very responsible client and in previous loans, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To repair her son's rickshaw

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 41 años,  es viuda, es una mujer trabajadora y vive en su propia casa junto a sus 04 queridos hijos, por quienes desea brindarles una buena educación. Dina, es una mujer muy laboriosa, su fin es sobresalir, el oficio que tiene es de ser comerciante y tiene una tienda, que se llama “La bodega de Dina”, establecimiento que es muy concurrido por sus compradores. Es así que cada mañana abre su tienda para recibir a sus clientes, quienes gustan de la variedad que productos que vende. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores, lleva 05 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias y ampliar su puesto de ventas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesta cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos.
Con el crédito solicitado comprará más productos para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dina, 41, is a widow.  She’s a very hard working woman living in her own house with her four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a good education.  Dina is a very hard working woman; her goal is to stand out.  The occupation she has is being a merchant.   She has a store called “La Bodega de Dina” that is quite patronized by her buyers.  Every morning she opens the store to receive her customers who like the variety of products she sells.  What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers because this is one of the skills she uses to win over a larger number of consumers.  She’s been in business for 5 years and considers the most difficult part having to stand almost all day.  In time she hopes to increase profits and enlarge her sales stand.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She feels that it will be very helpful for her store’s progress and is willing to repay in a timely fashion.  She will use the requested loan to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Roció

texts.es:
Al negocio de la señora Roció le está haciendo falta más mercancía, solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mas variedad de ropa como es para dama, caballeros, niños, también quiere vender aparatos electrónicos como son televisiones, licuadoras, microondas y  planchas. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá de su negocio con esta nueva inversión que realizara. 
Ya que su esposo el señor José De Jesus se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Roció's business is in need of more merchandise.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a greater variety of clothes for men, women and children.  She would also like to sell electrical appliances such as television sets, blenders, microwaves and irons.

Roció plans to repay her loan with the profits that she will make from her business as a result of this investment as her husband, José de Jesus, will cover their family expenses with the wage that he earns in his job.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 29-year-old lady and the mother of two children. She started her own small home business designing and sewing clothes a long time ago. She has gained a wide base of clients through the years. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a cutting machine that will help her productivity. In the future, Fadia would like to have her own sewing workshop and wants to be able to start a fabric trading business.

loans.use: to buy a fabric cutting machine.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ему 32 года.Он женат. Имеет троих детей. Более семи лет он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для покупки коровы. Баходур хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Bahodur lives in A. Jomi. He is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He has been working in animal husbandry for more than seven years.  He raises cattle at home. He primarily breeds cattle for sale. He is taking out a loan to buy cows. Bahodur wishes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Dodzi

texts.fr: Revendeuse d’épices (ail, piment, cube) et d’huile végétale depuis 2005, Dodzi a 03 enfants et son conjoint est revendeur. Elle est à son premier prêt et veut ce montant pour  acheter 03 bidons d’huile végétale et des épices pour contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: A retailer of spices (garlic, peppers, bouillon cubes) and vegetable oil since 2005, Dodzi has three children and her spouse is a retailer. She is on her first loan and would like to use the amount to buy three cans of vegetable oil and spices for resale in order to contribute to providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy spices, oil, and onions.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
As a young couple just 33, Mrs. Tep and her husband try to win the struggles in their life. Now she is a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh, where she can earn $3 per day. Her husband, as the head of the family, never has free time. He always purchases cows and sells cows so that he can earn $5 per day. 

Both of them wish to borrow the amount of $1,200 in order to purchase more cows and repair their old house.

loans.use: To purchase more cows and repair their old house.

loans.name: Edvin Alberto

texts.es:
Edvin Alberto es soltero, tiene 29 años de edad, es bachiller en computación, se dedica a la atención de cibercafé, inicio este negocio ya que era sus sueños tenerlo, y lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para incrementar su negocio, ya que va a comprar accesorios para el mismo como son, audífonos, tintas, memorias, discos compactos, altavoces, etc. Ya que en el futuro espera que se negocio sea amplio y que brinde un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edvin Alberto, 29, is single.  His degree is in Computing.  He runs an Internet Café.  He started this business because it had been his dream to have it.  He has three years’ experience and has support from his parents.

He decides to request a loan to increase business because he’ll buy accessories for it like: earphones, ink, memory sticks, compact discs, speakers, etc. because he hopes in future that the business will be large and to provide quality customer service.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a determined 21-year-old businessman. He is single. For the last three years, he has been distributing soft drinks to make a living. In the next five years, he wants to have diversified his investment to at least three other different sectors. His dream is to own a large firm.

 He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sodas and water. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now financially literate.

loans.use: To buy sodas and water.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona is a twenty four year old divorced woman. She has four children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

Phiona has been dealing in clothes for eight years.She started with a capital of 500,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings. Her hardship is bad debtors. Her vision is to start another business and to build a good house. Phionah needs the loan money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong is 47 years old and married. He has two children, one son and one daughter. He lives with his wife and children in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns an income by selling cashew nuts. 

Cuong supports his family by running a beauty shop at his house. He has been engaged in this activity for over 12 years. He intends to borrow money to buy additional hairdressing tools and related products to enable him to attract more customers and increase his income. He hopes that with the requested loan, his business will expand and he can better financially support his family.

loans.use: To buy additional hairdressing tools and related good quality products.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
MERCEDES JUANA ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO "MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS" DESD. HACE DOS AÑOS, TIENE 54 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS, GRACIAS AL TRABAJO QUE ELLA REALIZA COMO MODISTA PUED. APORTAR LA MITAD D. LOS PAGOS D. LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES.
HACE 20 AÑOS  SE INICIÓ COMO MODISTA A CONSECUENCIA QUE SU ESPOSO FUE DESPEDIDO D. LA EMPRESA EN LA QUE TRABAJABA, POR ESTE MOTIVO ELLA EMPIEZA A OFRECER SUS SERVICIOS D. MODISTA A SUS VECINOS, AMIGOS Y FAMILIARES, POSTERIORMENTE LLEGA A ALQUILAR UN LOCAL EN EL MERCADO CAQUETA, UN CENTRO COMERCIAL D. MUCHA CONCURRENCIA.
GRACIAS A SU TRABAJO ELLA CONSIDERA QUE HA LOGRADO REALIZARSE COMO PERSONA, ES INDEPENDIENTE Y HA LOGRADO ADQUIRIR SUS MÁQUINAS Y MATERIALES PARA REALIZAR SUS TRABAJOS SIN NINGUN PROBLEMA.
UNA D. SUS METAS ES CRECER COMO EMPRESA Y LUEGO EXPORTAR SUS PRENDAS D. VESTIR.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. MATERIALES NECESARIOS PARA CUMPLIR CON PEDIDOS Y EMPEZAR LA CONFECCION D. PRENDAS PARA LA CAMPAÑA NAVID.ÑA.

NOTA: EN LA FOTO OBSERVAMOS  QUE HAY OCHO PERSONAL, UNA D. LAS CUALES  ACOMPAÑA A UNA D. LAS INTEGRANTES PORTAL NO ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO (VISTE D. PANTALÓN JEANS MORADO).
texts.en:
Mercedes has been a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras for 2 years. She is 54 years old, married and has 3 children. Thanks to her work as a dressmaker she can contribute half of the household expenses.

Twenty years ago her husband lost his job and as a result of that she began to offer her services as a dressmaker to the neighbors, friends, and relatives. Then later she decided to rent a place in the Caqueta Mercado, a commercial center with a lot of activity. 

Thanks to her work she believes she is now an independent person, and she has been able to get the machines and material to do her work without a problem.

One of her goals is to grow as a company and then later export her clothing. She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of the necessary supplies to complete her orders and to begin making clothes for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase materials for delivery of clothing orders

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old, married and has six grown children. She has a personal products business in which she sells products like shoes, shampoo, lotions and dresses in the community.

Evelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional products that she can offer like lotions, toothpaste, dresses and bags.

Evelyn wishes to someday establish her own stall for her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, lotion, shampoo and soap for her business.

loans.name: Angel Alonso

texts.es: Ángel Alonso, tiene la edad  de 21 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno apto y ya sembrado en producción, actualmente la siembra necesita fertilizantes para poder cosechar con mejores resultados el próximo año por lo cual recorrió al préstamo. El quiere asistir su café de la mejor forma para así obtener el máximo de rendimientos en la próxima cosecha. El tiene como meta poder superar la producción de cosecha del anterior año y sacar el doble de las ganancias para su futuro y ayudar a sus padres con las responsabilidades del hogar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ángel Alonso is 21 years old; he is single and lives with his parents. He will use the loan to purchase supplies for his coffee farm. He has a good plot of land which is already planted. His farm needs fertilizers so that next year's harvest will be better. He wants to provide the best care for his coffee in order to get the maximum results out of his farm during the next harvest. His goal is to increase his production from the year before and double his profits to benefit his future and to help his parents with the household expenses. This will be his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He had been unable to get a loan from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with better conditions and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: purchase supplies for his coffee farm

loans.name: Kossiwavi

texts.fr:
Kossiwavi est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un agent au port. Elle a 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Le premier a 10ans et le dernier a 03 ans.
Kossiwavi travaille comme revendeuse de produits vestimentaires depuis 1an. Elle a une boutique dans laquelle elle répond à la demande de ses clients.
Kossiwavi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits vestimentaires. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kossiwavi voudrait développer l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossiwavi is a 35-year-old woman who is married to a harbor officer. She has three children, two of whom go to school. The oldest child is 10 years old, and the youngest is 3. 

Kossiwavi has been selling apparel for the past year. She has a shop where she caters to her customers’ needs. She is seeking a first loan from WAGES to purchase clothing and reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Kossiwavi would like to expand her business. She will use the profits to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy apparel for resale

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en: Tahreer is a 37-year-old young woman who is married with three sons and two daughters. She is an employee with a decent salary in addition to having a good source of income from her grocery store. Tahreer wants to expand her grocery store by opening a new section for toys. She would like to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Tahreer gets the loan, she will be able to open a new section for toys. She needs to purchase the toys and install the shelves and lighting. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her sales and income and live in a better condition with her family. Tahreer is photographed in her store.

loans.use: To open a new toy section in her store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of selling bags in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more bags to sell to customers.

Teresita has been in this business for five years. Teresita earns more income from buying and selling of clothing.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es:
Ayda María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene desde hace 13 años una pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio con la venta de chiverías y poco a poco lo fue aumentando.
En la actualidad es una de las más grande de su barrio donde vende desde granos básicos, productos lácteos, productos higiénicos, leña, medicamentos, licor…etc.
texts.en: Ayda María is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has had a grocery store for 13 years.  She started the business selling snacks and gradually has been enlarging it.  Currently it’s one of the largest in the neighborhood; she sells everything from basic grains, to dairy products, to personal hygiene items, to firewood, medicine, liquor, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with five children, one of whom attends school while four have graduated from secondary school. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mariam has operated a business selling goats for meat for the past two years, selling her goats in the market. One of the major challenges she faces is losses from livestock theft. She dreams of expanding the business to meet her customers' needs in the future.

With this loan of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase goats for sale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for sale.

loans.name: Chhuny's Group

texts.en:
A 35-year-old mother of four children, Chhuny is a farmer in a village located in the Tbaung Khmum district. She has three dependent children working as farmers and students. In addition to farming rice, Chhuny also plants cassava and sometimes works for others to gain extra income. She has been in this business for 18 years. She is able to earn 3 USD per day and saves .75 USD daily. 

This is Chhuny's first group loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crops and earn more income to make a better living and also to keep her children in school. She also hopes to increase the amount of farmland she owns.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Magaly Judith

texts.es:
Magaly es una mujer trabajadora que tienes muchas aspiraciones con sus ventas y elaboración de toldos.   Trabaja en su casa sola confeccionando los toldos y vendiéndolos en las horas que ya tiene un grupo destinado. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para seguir con su negocio ya que ayuda a su esposo a mantener a sus tres hijos pequeños.  Para continuar con mas ingresos ella quiere comprar telas con el préstamo para poderles dar una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Magaly is a hardworking woman who has many aspirations with her sales and manufacture of awnings. She works at home alone making awnings and selling them when she has a group ready to go.

She has many aspirations to continue with her business since it helps her husband in supporting their three small children. To continue with more income she wants to buy fabric with the loan to be able to give a better life to her children.

loans.use: buy fabric.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Cristina has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. Cristina has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase dried fish to sell to customers of her dried fish stall.

Cristina has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she would like to have a number of dried fish stalls in the locality.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell to customers of her dried fish stall.

loans.name: Jaguar Group

texts.en:
Ruth, who is in her early 30s, is single with one child who still goes to school. She has been running a fruit and vegetable business for nine months. Ruth works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

She is requesting her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Ruth used the previous loans to buy stock for her business and to pay her child's school fees and has successfully repaid all her loans. She now wants a loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to one day be a big businesswoman.

Ruth will share this loan with her loan group "Jaguar" which has a total of 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Chandrama

texts.en:
Chandrama is 43 years old a widow lady. She lives with her parents. She earns 4,000 INR per month from her betel shop. She sells betel, biscuits, detergents, wafers, incense sticks, face cream, etc. in her betel shop. But she needs to go to the market to bring the goods when required. She does not have enough funds to have these goods in bulk amount in stock. As a woman, it is difficult for her to go to the market very frequently and because of that, she is not able to meet the customers' demand. She wants to purchase the above goods and some other additional products like chocolates, talcum powder, soaps, shampoos, etc. in bulk to meet her customers' demand. 

She requested a loan of 36,000 INR to purchase the above products in bulk. She has a dream to grow her business so that she can meet the customers' demand and save some money for her future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing betel, biscuits, detergents, wafers, incense sticks, face cream, etc. for her 'betel cum variety' shop.

loans.name: Hulya

texts.en:
Hülya is married and a mother of two.  She is sewing children's clothes and dresses at home by getting orders and selling them.  She gets lumps of deals from schools for their uniform.  With the help of her second credit from Maya she bought bulks of fabric.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hülya hanım evli iki çocuk annesi evde çocuk giysileri ve çocuk kostümleri siparişi alarak dikiyor ve  satış yapıyor. Okullarla anlaşmalar yaparak toptan sipariş alıyor.  Maya dan 2. kredisini kullanan Hülya Hanım kredileri ile toptan kumaş aldı.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her vegatable farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mrs. Mean S. is 33 years old, married and a mother of four children, who all attend school. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia and makes her living by running a grocery store with about $1.30/day in revenue. Meanwhile, her husband works on a farm raising pigs and other domestic animals for a meager sum. To service her family's expenses and keep investing in her business, S. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase rice seeds for her plantation and to purchase different grocery products to meet her clients' demands. In the future, she hopes to have sufficient money to improve her farm by adding more pigs and seeds to generate an additional income.

loans.use: To purchase rice crops and grocery products to invest in her store

loans.name: Karla

texts.en:
Mrs. Pavon is a young single mother with a knack for sewing; she has used this skill to start a business manufacturing and selling mattresses, pillows, sheets and other products for the home.

She is requesting this loan to purchase raw material such as thread, needles, fabric, cotton and foam to be used in the fabrication of her products. This additional investment will allow her to increase her sales and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. P. es una joven madre soltera con mucha facilidad para la costura, debido a esto se ha dedicado a la confección de colchones, almohadas, sábanas y otros productos para el hogar. Esta solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales (hilos, agujas, tela, algodón, esponjas, etc.) que le permitan confeccionar sus productos. Con el crédito espera incremetnar sus ventas y por ende mejorar la situación económica de sus familiares.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for  the manufacturing of mattresses and pillows

loans.name: Jackelyn Laurent

texts.es:
Jackelyn is mother to four children, two of whom are getting ready to test into the university in their city and to more who are still in school. She lives with her husband who works in public transportation in his own car in the streets of Pucallpa. In this way, they share both the household's expenses and their children's education. Before this, they lived in the city of Huanuco and since way back, they have worked selling quick meals. Now, in this beautiful region, they keep working on that same activity in a corner of their home, which they have arranged for this purpose in spite of some problems such as lacking electricity and drinking water. Thanks to the good service they offer and to their loyal clients, they are now in need to buy equipment to generate electricity and also replacements for the kitchen utensils that are used in the preparation and sale of their delicious specialty. To cover these expenses, Jackelyn needs to count on our support, she requests $200, committing herself to return them in six months. Let's allow our help to illuminate the way to their wishes.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Jackelyn es madre de cuatro hijos, dos de ellos estan preparándose para postular a una vacante en la universidad de su ciudad y los otros dos aún se encuentran en el colegio. Ella vive con su esposo que se dedica al transporte público en su auto por las calles de Pucallpa, de esta manera comparten los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos; anteriormente vivían en la ciudad de Huánuco y desde siempre se han dedicado a la venta de comidas rápidas y ahora en esta bella zona continuan desarrollando la actividad que ya conoce en una esquina de su casa que acondicionó para este fin, afrontando ciertos problemas como es la falta de energía eléctrica y agua potable. Gracias a la buena atención que brinda y a los clientes asiduos, es que se encuentra en la necesidad de comprar un equipo para generar luz y la renovación de los utensilios de cocina que utiliza para la preparación y venta de su deliciosa especialidad. Para cubrir estas necesidades Jackleyn necesita contar con nuestro apoyo, solicita la suma de 200 dólares, comprometiéndose a devolverlos en seis meses.Hagamos que nuestra ayuda le proporcione luz para alumbrar el camino de sus anhelos

loans.use: Buying kitchen utensils and electricity generator

loans.name: Yunely

texts.es:
Ms. Yunely belongs to the Progressive Womens' Mientras Tanto group. She lives in the San Martin Region, San Martin Province, Banda de Shilcayo District. Her home and business are located in Jr. Las Palmeras, number 135. She provides internet services, and sells snacks and soft drinks to the customers who use her service.

She is a single woman who opened her business of her own initiative. Her home is located near the Technological Institute, and she serves the needs of students. She has the support of her parents, and has been open for two months. Every day she gains new customers, giving them personal service based on the training that she has received.

With the recent loan of 300.00 soles ($100.00) which she has received from Manuela Ramos to be repaid in 4 payments, she has purchased some printing material (paper), snacks, and soft drinks.

Ms Yunely's goals are to become independent, (operate without her parents' support,) and to with her own location, open a store selling clothing and shoes, while continuing her internet service, as she feels able to manage both businesses at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Yunely pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Mujeres Progresivas”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, su domicilio y negocio están ubicados en el Jr. Las Palmeras Nº 135, se dedica a prestar servicios de Internet y en el mismo local vende algunos refrigerios y gaseosas para su clientela que utiliza este servicio.

Es soltera y su negocio lo puso con iniciativa propia ya que su domicilio está ubicado cerca de un Instituto Tecnológico y era una necesidad para los estudiantes, tiene el apoyo de sus padres, empezó hace 2 meses y cada día está incrementando sus clientes, la atención es personalizada y tiene estudios al respecto con el cual puede dar soporte a sus clientes.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 ($ 100.00), el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró algunos materiales de impresión (papeles) y golosinas, gaseosas para la venta de refrigerios.

La señorita Yunely quiere, más adelante, independizarse (dejar el apoyo de sus padres) y teniendo su propio local piensa instalar una tienda de venta de ropas y zapatos sin dejar el servicio de Internet ya que se siente capaz de administrar los dos negocios a la vez.

loans.use: Purchase of paper.  Purchase of snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi K. was born in 1982 in Attoèta. He is single and takes care of three other people. He would like to develop his business of selling planks, which will allow him to satisfy his customers. For this project, Mr. K. is requesting a loan of $800 so he can buy the planks and transport them to Lomé, where they will be sold. The success of this project will build up customer loyalty and give him a stable income so he can satisfy his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Koffi est né en 1982 à Attoèta, célibataire, il a à sa charge trois personnes. Son activité est basée sur le commerce de planche. Ce qui lui permettra de vite satisfaire ses clients. Par ce projet, Monsieur Koffi sollicite un financement de $800 afin de payer et transporter des planches sur Lomé et qui seront destinées à la vente. La réalisation de ce projet le rendra encore fidèle à ses clients et lui permettra de disposer d’un revenu sûr pour la satisfaction des besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of planks

loans.name: Easther

texts.en: Easther J. lives and works in a neighborhood in Dar es Salaam called Keko. She runs a small cafe there and sells various dishes and snacks throughout the day. She is now hoping for a loan to increase her food sales. She has received a loan from BRAC Tanzania before and this helped her business. She belongs to the loan group called Mafamikio.

loans.use: To buy food items for the cafe

loans.name: Burhon

texts.ru:
Burhon Huseynovich S. lives in the region of Shahrinau. He is married and has five children. He is 54 years old and has secondary education. He is an entrepreneur and makes his living by buying and selling livestock. He has a 25-year experience in this field. He plans to use the loan to buy sheep and goat for their feeding and resale. This business helps the development of animal husbandry in this region besides that it provides the residents with fresh meat and meat products. Buhron plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Садиков Бурхон Хусейнович проживает в районе Шахринау. Женат имеет 5 детей. Возраст 54 года..Образование среднее.Работает предпринимателем по купле-продаже мелко-рогатого скота. Опыт в данном бизнесе 25 лет. Кредит планирует использовать на покупку овец и коз , для откормки и последующей перепродажи.Этот вид деятельности позволяет способствовать развитию животноводства в данной местности, что кроме того позволяет обеспечит население мясом и мясными продуктами.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Samar 3 Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria P. has been raising pigs for a living for 2 years, selling them to local butchers. She is a 47-year-old mother of 3 children, whom she has been able to move forward thanks to this job. She would like to purchase more piglets, vitamins, and pig feed so that her piglets can grow healthy. The other members of the group are: Maria Pérez V., who sells medicinal products; and Carolina G. L., who also raises pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA MARIA AGUSTINA DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS , PARA DESPUES VENDERLOS A LOS QUE VENDEN CARNE DE PUERCO, TIENE 47 AÑOS Y 3 HIJOS A LOS CUALES A SACADO ADELANTE CON ESTE TRABAJO, DECEA CON SU CREDITO DECEA COMPRAR MAS PUERQUITOS, VITAMINAS Y ALIMENTO PARA QUE CRESCAN SANOS Y BONITOS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: MARIA PÉREZ V., VENDE PRODUCTOS MEDICINALES Y CAROLINA G. L., A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS.

loans.use: Purchase more pigs, vitamins, and feed

loans.name: Beas's Muungano Group

texts.en:
Beas is 33 years old and married; she has two children, ages 16 and 20. Beas owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her group members Rosy and Tatu, who have businesses in vegetable sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Ntinda Kafene Women's Group

texts.en: Joan K. has been selling crafts out of her home in Ntinda for 25 years. She is the chairperson of Ntinda Kafene women’s group that has been together for one and a half years. She is married with five children. She sells her crafts to the local community as well as exporting them. Currently she is deciding between a few possible locations for her new shop. She will supplement the loan with some of her own savings to start up the shop. She is grateful for you support.

loans.use: Joan Kasinje plans to open up a retail shop to sell sugar, salt, soap and bread.

loans.name: Nhu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nhu Thi G., 49 years old, is living with her husband in the center of Gia Loc Town, Hai Duong. Therefore, they decide to do business in fertilizers and also wood products. Because of good location, their business is growing well. Everyone in her area comes to her store for farming supplies. Her husband has been doing carpentry and selling wood products for 12 years. Therefore, their business in wood products is going very well, too. Their average income is approximately 400 USD/ month. This time, she wnts to borrow 425 USD to expand their business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Với địa bàn kinh doanh khá thuận lợi, chị Nhữ Thị Giỏi 49 tuổi cùng chồng là anh Nguyễn Văn Tuấn hiện đang sống tại thị trấn Gia Lộc- Hải Dương trung tâm của huyện nên việc kinh doanh buôn bán được anh chị lựa chọn hàng đầu, gia đình anh chị có cửa hàng bán lân, đạm và cửa hàng bán đồ gỗ, việc kinh doanh của gia đình anh chị rất thuận lợi và thị trường rất rộng, hầu hết bà con sống ở các xã lân cận làm nghề nông nghiệp đều đến cửa hàng nhà chị mua hàng, chồng chị chuyên kinh doanh và sản xuất đồ gỗ, mỹ nghệ với kinh nghiệm 12 năm trong nghề nên cửa hàng của anh rất có uy tín, với việc kinh doanh quy mô như vậy nên thu nhập của gia đình anh chị rất cao thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn nay gia đình anh chị xin vay 7.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vốn vào mở rộng cửa hàng gỗ.

loans.use: expand business in fertilizers and home furniture from wood

loans.name: Margarita Lisseth

texts.es:
Margarita is 26 years old and lives in the “Hialeah II Etapa” neighborhood. She is single and has no children.

Margarita works as a cashier at a bank in the city of Managua and at nights she goes to the university. She has been working as a cashier for a year.

Margarita’s house is half in concrete and the other half in zinc. That is why she requests a loan so that she can change all the zinc walls into concrete. She will do the changes little by little with the financing she will receive.

Margarita would like to have a better standard of living so that when she has a family, she can give her children the comforts they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Margina tiene 26 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah II etapa, es soltera y no tiene niños. Trabaja como cajera en un banco de managua, y por las noches asiste a la universidad. Tiene un año de experiencia trabajando como cajera. La casa de Margina actualmente es mitad de concreto y mitad de zinc. Ella quiere construir toda su casa de concreto. El préstamo solicitado es para cambiar la parte de las paredes hechas de zinc por concreto. Las mejoras espera realizarlas poco a poco y con financiamientos. Quiere tener una mejor condición de vida para cuando forme una familia, y por darles a sus hijos la comodidad que necesitan.

loans.use: To change all the zinc walls in her house to concrete

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi H. is 55 years old. After losing her husband at a young age, she struggled to raise her children who now all have finished school and have grown. She has been a member since 2006. Her initial loan of 2.000.000d was used to purchase hogs in hope to support her family financially. After seeing the success of her business, she became more confident and seeks more loans to help with her business. The profits gained and loan she received thereafter was used to expand her business and she was even able to buy hens-to lay eggs. At this present time, her livestock consists of 7 pigs and 200 hens. Her daily income is about 200.000d. Three of her five children are grown and are living on their own. The other 2 children reside with her and both have steady jobs with a 3.000.000d/month income. This time she is requesting a loan of 6.000.000 to invest in farm animals. Her average income is 5.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ 55 tuổi. Chồng mất sớm một mình chị vất vả nuôi các con ăn học và trưởng thành. Tham gia Quỹ năm 2006 Số vốn vay lần đầu 2.000.000đ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập trong gia đình. Qua viêc đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn có hiệu quả chị lại càng mạnh dạn hơn trong việc vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Các vòng vốn sau mức vốn chị vay cao hơn và đầu tư lớn hơn không chỉ chăn nuôi lợn mà chị còn đầu tư chăn nuôi thêm gà đẻ trứng. Hiện tại chị đang nuôi 7 con lợn và 200 con gà đẻ trứng thu nhập bình quân 200.000đ/ ngày. Các con chị hiện đã lớn, 3 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 2 con đang sống cùng chị và có công việc ổn định thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 6.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Susan Magali

texts.es:
La señorita Susan Magaly, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y lencería por catálogos. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguia Nº 159. Los clientes son sus amigos, compañeros de trabajo, vecinos de su barrio y familiares. Trabaja con pedidos.
 
Con este crédito de S/.800, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfume para damas, caballeros y niños, desodorante, joyas, esmalte, lociones, etc., para surtir el negocio y pueda tener mayor ganancia y volver a invertir nuevamente.

Susan tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, y a pesar de su corta edad es muy  decidida y trabajadora. Su meta es comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos, llegar a tener una boutique y terminar la carrera de Derecho.
texts.en:
Miss Susan Magaly, a member of the “Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo” Communal Bank, lives in the department and province of San Martín, in the Morales District. She sells beauty products and lingerie through catalogues. She runs the business out of her own house, No. 159 on Jr. Augusto B. Leguia. The clients are her friends, coworkers, neighbors, and relatives. She takes orders. With this loan of S/.800, to be paid off in four installments, she will buy beauty products like perfume for women, men, and children, deodorant, jewelry, nail polish, lotion, etc., so she can supply her business, increase her profit, and reinvest. Susan is 21 years old, single, and despite her young age is very determined and hard-working. Her goal is to buy a display cabinet for her products, get a boutique, and finish her Law degree. .

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing beauty products

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo T. est détentrice d’un bar à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 51 ans, Adzo est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Sa bonne gérance lui a permis de réaliser de bons chiffres d’affaires au cours de l’année précédente. Elle désire avec ce second crédit accroître la capacité de son activité en passant des commandes de casiers de boissons afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Adzo T. keeps bar in Danyi, a town situated approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. 51-years-old, Adzo is married and the mother of six children. Over the course of the last year, her good management enabled her to earn a decent profit. To better meet customer demand, with her second loan Adzo wishes to expand her business by ordering drinks by the case.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail beverage manager

loans.name: Razak

texts.en:
Razak B. is a 26 year old businessman. He is a married and the father of one male child who is currently in school. He has been trading in cows for five years now.  He buys the cattle from the northern part of Ghana and supplies them to restaurant operators as meat for their meals. Beef is enjoyed by many Ghanaian households because the flavor is good and it is quite affordable. 

Razak's business progress is slow because of inadequate funds to buy the animals from the farmers. The loan will give him the resources he needs to buy more cows to serve his customers and meet their demand for good quality meat. He also hopes to save more to support his son in school. He belongs to the community group called Saamu (Receiving) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loans. His photograph was taken after their group meeting.

loans.use: To buy cattle to supply restaurants with beef

loans.name: Adelia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora  Adelia del carmen C., tiene la edad de 34 años habita en el sector de buenos aires ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo y  hijos los cuales actualmente estudian y le ayudan cuando hay producción, el esposo de doña Adelina trabaja como jardinero en una casa privada para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar y le apoya en la agricultura a la vez. La señora se dedica a la agricultura y va a  vender al mercado oriental, ella comenzó su negocio de los mismo que cultiva, pero eso solo lo hacia cuando sale la cosecha; después de un tiempo decidió comprar frutas y verduras que con sus propios esfuerzos y de su esposo ha logrado establecer un poco su negocio. Con la ayuda de Afodenic que durante tres préstamos la ha apoyado, la señora se siente contenta porque su producción la vende a mejor precio, por los insumos que le aplica con cada préstamo que financia nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Adelia del Carmen C. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Ticuantepe municipality of Buenos Aires. Her children lend a hand when it's harvest time. Adelia's husband works as a gardener at another house to help out with the household expenses and also helps out in the crops. Adelia is a farmer and sells her produce at the oriental market. She started her business with the income she made from the sales of produce, but the income would only happen if the harvest did. So, she decided to buy fruits and vegetables to sell and with much effort, she and her husband have been able to establish their business. With the continued support of Afodenic, Adelia has been able to afford fertilizing her crops, and as such, has been able to sell her produce for a better price -- which makes her very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and poison

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Martha Lorena Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es casada Doña Martha tiene 3 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 20 años trabaja por cuenta propia y su otro hijo de 12 años que cursa el  1 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 15 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora de obrero en el Ingenio San Antonio, las aspiraciones que Doña Martha tiene son de mantener su negocio y lograr tener mas recurso para almacenar su materia prima, sus deseos son sobrevivir a la situación económica ya que no quiere que siempre se mantenga la ayuda para los países pobres pese a la situación política del país en sus sueños esta lograr mejorara su casa y que sus hijo puedan tener una carrera profesional ya que tanto esfuerzo que ha realizado hasta la fecha no quiere que sea en vano para que el día de mañana puedan enfrentar los retos  para el día de mañana.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de tortillas y venta de refrescos, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación en chichigalpa, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, su negocio inicia por su Mama que fue la fundadora del negocio y paso a sus manos de Doña Martha y lo logrado ya que desde ahí  se hace cargo de su Mama y sus hijos y a la misma vez mantiene los mismos  clientes y también con su negocio de refrescos ya que este no tiene mucho tiempo de poseerlo pero ha logrado tener mas clientes con este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene darle mas inversión a su negocio para la compra de materia prima como: leña, maíz y para los refrescos azúcar, frutas, sal y leche por lo que no quiere que la afluencia de clientes se disminuya por no ofrecer lo suficiente.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena Gutiérrez is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and is self-employed; her second is 15 years old and in the 3rd year of high school; her third is 12 years old and in the 1st year of high school. Her partner is a labourer for the Ingenio San Antonio sugar mill. Martha's dreams are to keep her business and have a better ability to store her raw materials; her wish is to survive the economic situation as she does not want continued aid for poor countries despite the political situation. She dreams of improving her home and that her children may have a career; she has worked so hard that she does not want it all to be in vain, so that they will be prepared for future challenges. She sells tortillas and refreshments from her home in Chichigalpa. She has had this business for 3 years. Her mother started the business, and passed it to Martha who is now responsible for her mother's care in addition to that of her children, all the while serving the same clients in addition to her refreshments business which she has not had for very long but thanks to which she has managed to increase her client base. The loan is for working capital as she wants to invest in her business by buying basic materials such as wood, corn and for the refreshments: sugar, fruit, salt and milk as she does not want to lose customer due to not having enough to offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Daniela

texts.es: La Sra. Daniela H. se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y carteras desde hace diez años, ella sale a vender ya que tiene clientes fijos en empresas que le comprar al credito y al contado, aparte de este negocio ella esta montando una pulperia y necesita credito monetario para poder establecer bien su negocio ya que con las ventas de zapatos y ropa no le ajusta para el sustento de su hogar, ella tiene todos los deseos de superarse y quiere cambiaar su calidad de via, ella es una persona luchadora y siempre cuenta con el apiyo de su esposo, en estos momentos ellos no tienen hijos.
texts.en:
For the past ten years Mrs. Daniela H. has been selling clothes, shoes, and handbags for a living. She goes out to sell on credit or cash to her clients who work at companies. Apart from this business she is setting up a local store and needs a loan to be able to establish her business in a satisfactory way, as the sales of shoes and clothing do not cover the expenses of her home. She wishes to improve and change her life quality. She is a fighter and she can always count on the support of her husband. At the moment they have no children.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains, dairy products and meat.

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es: Jovanna tiene 25 años,  vive con su esposo en una casa arrendada. Se dedica a atender su restaurante desde hace un año y medio, empezó vendiendo primero comidas al paso, en la calle y hoy ya tiene establecido su negocio en una de las principales calles de su localidad, la atención que ofrece es todo el día, vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, y por las tardes generalmente vende jugos de frutas en su mismo establecimiento. Jovanna quiere implementar mucho más su negocio  por lo que recientemente empezó a vender gaseosas y así notó que su negocio se hizo más rentable, lo que le da más a ánimos a perseverar. Es la segunda vez que Jovanna tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es muy disciplinada en el pago de sus cuentas y una vez más renueva su compromiso de un trabajo decidido para mejorar su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos no perecibles por sacos y de esta  manera abastecerse para la preparación de los platos que ofrece en su restaurante, con otra parte comprará artículos para decorar su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Jovanna is 25 and lives in a rented house with her husband. For the past year-and-a-half she has earned her living running a restaurant. She started out selling takeout food on the street, and now she has a business on one of her area's main streets. She works all day, selling breakfasts, lunches, and dinners, and in the afternoon she typically sells fruit juices right from her restaurant. Jovanna wants to do a lot more with her business, so she recently started selling soft drinks and found that her business became more profitable, motivating her even more to keep it going. This will be Jovanna's second loan with MFP. She is extremely disciplined with her payments and is committing herself once again to work hard to improve her village bank. She plans to invest her loan in sacks of non-perishable ingredients to use in the meals she sells. She'll use the remainder to buy decorations for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for preparing her meals

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур мужчина 34 лет , отец троих детей,женат.Жена работает продавщицей в сельском магазине.Сам Баходур работает в сельской школе ,учителем математики.Его заработная плата не хватает для прожиточного минимума,поэтому Баходур занимается продажей скота.Он каждые две недели ездит на рынок скота и перепродаёт скот, с чего имеет дополнительный доход для проживания.Для ремонта своего сарая Баходур хочет получить кредит, и на оставшуюся сумму хочет закупить корм.
texts.en:
Bahodur is a 34 year old man, married and the father of three children. His wife works as a salesperson in a town store. Bahodur himself teaches math in the town's school. His pay does not even cover a basic standard of living, so he also trades livestock. Every two weeks he goes to the livestock market to resell animals, which provides additional income for living expenses. Bahodur would like to obtain a loan to repair his barn, and buy feed with any leftover funds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and sale of livestock

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Mrs. Khorn S. is a farmer in the Thkouv Village of Takeo Province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice and also sells Khmer cakes. She is a 37-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is an employer while the other is a motor taxi driver. Although her children have careers, they still do not have much money to support their household. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Khorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for a pig breeding business.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: La Fortaleza, Group 4

texts.en:
Armanda O. is the representative of this group of five micro entrepreneurs. She started her business a year ago. She took a first loan of 8000 pesos (about 220 dollars) and is applying now for a second loan of 10000 pesos (about 277 dollars).

She is a seamstress and makes bedding items such as bedspreads, sheets, pillowcases and curtains. She makes different models to offer her customers when she visits them, but also accepts special requests. Her clients can pay her cash or take credit. In this case she arranges payment plans with her customers.

Armanda says that "preoccupations never cease to exist." She finds it challenging to sell enough merchandise to complete her loan payments and generate profits. She envisions her business as a house store with more variety. She wants to have a shop with employees that sew for her, and a secretary to take the orders. She would want to do this venture with her other group friends as business partners.

Please help us support Armanda and her friends. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase sheet and bedspread fabric, foamed fabric, zippers for cushions, lace for bedspreads and pillowcases, ground foam to fill pillows.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca M. is a 28 year old mother of three children, ages 11, 8, and 6. All of her children are in school. She is originally from Kissi in Kenya, but married a man from Kisumu. Rebecca says she likes it here, but misses the cooler climate of Kissi. She runs a small kiosk in the Nyamasaria slum where she sells cereals like beans and rice. She uses the income to pay her children's school fees. This is her first loan and she is asking for 10,000 KSH.

Rebecca recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW, she will be trained by K-MET and begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutri Flour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To expand her business selling cereals.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco L. A. vive el departamento de Ahuachapán  junto a su esposa y su hijo, Francisco tiene 46 años de edad y se dedica a su negocio que es un taller de estructuras metálicas y carpintería. Francisco hace su trabajo desde la producción de cada sala y comedores hasta la comercialización de los mismos, los clientes llegan al negocio de Francisco a comprar un juego de sala y Francisco les da facilidades de pago, a raíz de esto Francisco ve un buen nicho en su negocio e inclinarlo más a un almacén de este tipo de productos y con facilidades de pago,  este es el sueño de este hombre, que su negocio crezca y pueda tener más inventario a la vista, pero por el momento ahora el solicita un crédito porque le han pedido una gran cantidad de muebles y no posee la materia prima suficiente para elaborarlos.
texts.en:
Francisco L. A. lives in the department of Ahuachapán together with his wife and their son. Francisco is 46 years old and is dedicated to his business, which is a metals and carpentry workshop. Francisco produces furniture for every room including dining sets and sells all of this himself. Clients come to Francisco's business to buy furniture sets and Francisco offers them easy forms of payment, which is where Francisco sees a strong niche for his business and why he is inclined to add more of this type of products to a warehouse and still offer ease of payment. This is the dream of this man, that his business grows and that he may be able to have a larger inventory for display, but for the moment, he is requesting a loan because his clients have requested a great quantity of furniture and he does not have the raw materials to make it all.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Las Magnificas Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Las Magnificas” esta representadas por la señora Julia y compuesto  por 16 personas que van cursando juntas su quinto ciclo en la cual demostraron solidez, honradez y responsabilidad y siguen con las ganas D. seguir creciendo a pesar D. haber tropezado con algunos malos integrantes ellas siguen luchando por salir adelante en sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. frutas, carne, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos por catálogos, comida y su dedicación a la música. El destino del crédito es para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo para la compra D. materiales insumos y herramientas que ayuden a genera un mayor ingreso para seguir superándose y mejorando la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Las Magnificas" is represented by Mrs. Julia and has 16 members who have been together for five seasons showing strength, honesty, and responsibility, and continue wanting to go on growing in spite of having had problems with some bad members. They are still struggling to get ahead with their small businesses selling fruit, meat, groceries in local stores, cosmetics from catalog, food and dedicated to music. The loan will be spent to increase the work capital and buy supplies and tools to help increase earnings in order to continue to move ahead and improve the life quality of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Gladys Estela

texts.es: La señora Gladys Estela Sánchez García, tiene la edad de 26 años habita en el barrio el Rodeo, junto con sus padres, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder realizar sus sueños de ser enfermera, ella desde hace cinco años, se dedica a  la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que le afectan al cultivo ya que carecen de insumos, los planes hacia su cultivo es poder inducirlo bien y obtener mejores beneficios tanto económico, como para el cultivo . Ella inicio esta actividad con ayuda de su papá. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para obtener una buena producción y poder vender a buen precio.
texts.en:
Gladys Estela Sánchez García, 26, lives in the Rodeo neighborhood with her parents. The family plans are to improve living conditions and be able to follow her dreams of being a nurse. She has been farming for five years. The greatest difficulty is the pests that affect the crops because of lack of supplies. The plan for her farm is to be able to do well and gain better benefits both economically and for the farm. She started farming with her father’s help. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and the necessary supplies for a good production in order to be able to sell at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to improve her farm and get better production

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Maria Mercedes H.
