el grupo Rio Lindo esta integrado por 3 mujeres muy trabajadoras y amigas, este grupo esta ubicado en la colonia  Buena Vista de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan.
doña Sonia Marleny D. tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos y esta casada.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa, en esta epoca de navidad la ropa se vende muy bien.

la señora Antonia M. C. tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera y se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 13 años, negocio con el cual a educado y mantenido a sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, cal, leña.
 
doña Karina Janeth D. S. tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de cuatro hijos,  su esposo le ayuda economicamente.
Karina se dedica a la elaboracion de pan, tamales, tortas y pasteles.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para fabricar sus panes.

todas son muy unidas, desean trabajar y salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The Rio Lindo group is made up of three very hard-working and friendly women.  This group is located in the Buena Vista residential development in the city of San Lorenzo.  We detail their different business activities below:

Sonia Marleny D. is 36 years old.  She is married and has four children.  She sells clothes.  Her loan will be used to buy clothes, which sell very well during the Christmas season.

Antonia M. C. is 51 years old.  She is a single mother who makes and sells tortillas.  She has been in this business for 13 years and it has helped her to educate and support her children.  She will use her loan to buy corn, lime and firewood.
 
Karina Janeth D. S. is 24 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Her husband helps her financially.  Karina makes bread, tamales and cakes.  She will use her loan to buy ingredients to make her bread.

All the women are very united.  They would like to work and get ahead with their families.

loans.use: To buy clothes, flour, firewood, corn, lime, sugar, flavorings, wheat flour, eggs, margarine, butter, yeast and baking soda

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C., 50, is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Helen runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as beverages, snack foods and biscuits in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Helen is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as snack foods and beverages. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, such as snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Ziyovaddin

texts.en:
B. Ziyovaddin is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young Ziyovaddin has been around people raising animals. Thanks to this knowledge he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. He has been able to bring stability to his family with experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle. The desire that Ziyovaddin harbors in his heart is to increase his capital in order to invest in acquiring more animals. He requests 6000 Somoni to buy more cattle as a way to expand his business. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him continue to bring well being and security to the members of his family.         


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta G. is from the town of Trento. She is 39 years old, married and has three children, ages 11, 9 and 5. To make a living, Marieta raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marieta works hard to build her business and earn more for her family. Marieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marieta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marieta is requesting a new loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Aida María

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura,  al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mejía.

La señora Aida tiene 69 años, hace varios años quedo viuda y de esta relación tuvo 8 hijos 6 varones y dos mujeres, todos son mayores y comprometidos todos ellos viven aparte pero en las noches dos de sus hijos duermen en su casa para acompañarla. Está en el  Banco Comunal desde sus inicios  y le  gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado tanto a ella como a sus amigas del banco.

Tiene una pequeña granja de pollos en su casa  en la cual mete hasta cien  pollos por temporada,  la misma que es de dos o tres meses y luego los vende enteros o por libras a personas de la localidad  y además muchas veces entrega también en las tiendas. Trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas por día en el cuidado y alimentación de sus animalitos, sus pollos las compras en Agripac en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar más pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Sus sueños son tener una granja más grande y con tecnología.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of Mejía community bank meet in Mejía which is located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo.  Most of the people in this city work in agriculture, growing and selling coconuts.

Aida is 69 years old.  She has been widowed for several years and has 8 children from her relationship: 6 sons and 2 daughters.  All of her children are now grown up and engaged.  They all live away from home but at night two of her children sleep in her home to keep her company.  Aida has been a member of her community bank since the very beginning and she likes being a member because of the help that she and her friends have received from the bank.

Aida has a small chicken farm at home where she keeps up to 100 chickens a season.  She keeps them for two or three months and then sells them whole or by the pound to local people.  She often delivers them to stores as well.  Aida works every day, for two or three hours a day, looking after and feeding her animals.  She buys her chickens from Agripac in Portoviejo.

Aida will use this loan to buy more chickens, feed and medicine so that her chickens develop well.  Her dream is to own a bigger farm with technology.

loans.use: To buy chickens, medicine and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Elgun

texts.en:
Elgun O.  is a responsible young man. From the time he was a teenager, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock from his parents, a work which today brings him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. 

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals.  Elgun hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his livestock will bring better prices. For this reason, he is requesting the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase one calf

loans.name: Munhdelger

texts.en:
Munhdelger is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a herdsman and her three children, 13 to 17 years old, attend high school. 

Munhdelger operates a home product sales business in a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2010 after working as a salesperson for two years. Now her working capital exceeds 600,000 MNT -- which was 300,000 MNT when she started.  Munhdelger gained much experience and wants to continue her business in the future. She is a hard-working lady with a good personality. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase home products for her business.

loans.use: to purchase home products to resell

loans.name: Washington

texts.en:
Washington M., 44,  is a resident of Muranga in Central Kenya. He is the father of two, aged 14 and 9 years. 

He has been in active farming for seven years, producing milk and selling it to Brookside Dairies. He gets additional income from his employment.

Washington has requested a loan of 83,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow and a chuff-cutter (to cut grass for the cows).
 
He says he wants to buy a better breed of dairy cow to improve his milk output and a chuff-cuter to ease the feeding of the cows. He is focusing on running a farm with an output capacity of 200 litres of milk per day.

Washington, like others farmers, notes that animal feed has become quite expensive yet milk prices continue to be unstable. Nonetheless, he remains optimistic about the business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and a chuff cutter

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is a 41-year-old single mother of one child.

Mary runs a clothing business in Kiembeni. She has been in this business for the last year. 

This marks her first loan from KADET Ltd.  She plans to purchase curtains and bed sheets to add into her business.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business and repayment of the loan.

Her dream is to have a bigger stall with a variety of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase curtains and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Duo Panminab'ey Group

texts.es: Duo Panminab'ey:este grupo esta formado por dos señoras las cuales se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos y fajas, nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque le ha hido bien en su negocio y le pide a Dios que fape le pueda ayudar con este credito ya que pues nececita mas capital para trabajar esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos y de la misma manera aumentar su ganancias,Vilma yolanda tambien se dedica a la Cofeccion de guipiles y por esa razon esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima, el sueño de ellas es tener un local y vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Duo Panminab'ey
This group is made up of two ladies who make woven products and belts.  One of the ladies tells us that she is very happy because she has done well in her business and she asks God that FAPE be able to help her with this loan since she needs more capital to carry out her work.  She is requesting the loan to buy raw materials for making her woven products.  In this way, she will increase her profits.  Vilma Yolanda also makes 'guipiles' (traditional blouses or tunics) and she is requesting this loan to buy raw materials.  Her dream is to own business premises and to sell her products wholesale.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Ruth Marlene

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Trenzas de Oro” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Ruth tiene educación secundaria.
Trabaja con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace un año, su primer  préstamo  fue de          S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizo en su negocio de compra y venta de animales domésticos como vacunos, ovinos y porcinos, esta es su principal actividad.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, comprará una vaca la cual engordará por tres meses y la venderá en la localidad de Ilave.  Trabaja junto con su esposo. También nos cuenta que se dedican a la chacra como papa, cebada, habas y quinua.
Su sueño es mejorar los ganados.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Trenzas de Oro (Golden Braids)" located in the Ilave district, province of El Collao and department of Puno.  She is 30 years old,married and has 4 children.  Ruth has a high school education.

She has been working with el Movimiento Manuela Ramos since a year ago.  Her first loan was 500 nuevos soles, which she used in her business of buying and selling domestic animals such as cattle, sheep and pigs; this is her main business.

With this new loan of 800 nuevos soles, she will buy a cow which she will fatten for three months and sell in the town of Ilave. She works with her ​​husband.  They tell us that they also work the farm with crops such as potatoes, barley, beans and quinoa.  Her dream is to improve the livestock.  What she likes about the Communal Bank are the talks.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1983. She is married with a child. She lives in Xom Trong village. Her husband is a driver. She sells clothes  in the market. She has had this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. 

For her last loan, she borrowed 6,758,000 VND and repaid punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND to expand her clothes shop.

loans.use: to expand her clothes shop.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a single woman with one child in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child. For the past 25 years, she has operated a retail vegetable-selling business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another branch in the future. With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Yawa Edem

texts.fr: Revendeuse de sacs, chaussures et pagnes, Yawa est célibataire et a 01 enfant. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend sur place. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 04 douzaines de chaussures, 05 pièces de pagnes. Elle veut assurer un avenir radieux à son enfant elle a 33ans.
texts.en: Yawa sells bags, shoes, and traditional dresses, she is single and has 1 child. She buys her stock at Lomé and resells on site. She requests this first loan to buy 4 dozen shoes and 5 dresses .She wants to provide her child with a radiant future. She is 33 years old.

loans.use: purchase bags,shoes and traditional dresses.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has two children and makes a living by selling canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has been in business for two years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Ramosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria; La socia tiene 56 años de edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 3 hijos de 38, 30, 14 años de edad; la socia es docente de profesión y se dedica a la Dirección de su jardín, la socia se dedica a administrar el jardín de niños llamado Lucesitas; el jardín es muy bonito y acogedor, en este jardín  trabajan toda la familia, los esposos y las hijas; la socia  requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de materiales para implementar el jardín la socia suele comprar, papeles, como las hojas A-4, papel lustre, papel seda, corrospum, crayones, temperas, colores entre otros materiales didácticos para implementar el jardín de niños. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de papeles en millares como las hojas A-4, corrospum, papel seda, papel lustre, colores, crayones, temperas.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the communal bank "Maria Elena Moyano."  This bank is located in the Huanchac district of Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

Maria is 56 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 38, 30 and 14.  She is a teacher by profession, and works as a kindergarten administrator.  She runs a kindergarten called "Lucesitas," which is a very nice and cozy school.  Her whole family works in this kindergarten, including her daughters and their husbands.  Maria needs a loan to invest in materials for her kindergarten.  She will buy paper, such as A-4 photocopy paper, construction paper, crayons, tissue paper, foam craft sheets, paints, colored pencils, and other teaching materials for her kindergarten.  She requests a loan to invest in reams of photocopy paper, foam sheets, tissue paper, construction paper, colored pencils, crayons and paints.

Maria is grateful for the support that she is being granted, and as such pledges to make all of her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy reams of photocopy paper, foam sheets, tissue paper, construction paper, colored pencils, crayons and paints.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  Sofia has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 8 months, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Sofia sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Sofia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. 

The main business challenges for Sofia include seasonality and transportation and ever increasing prices.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop. Sofia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt,  and  boxes  of soap.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
For the past twelve years, Aba has been cooking banku and serving it with okra soup.  On her extreme left is the okra soup that she prepared for the day.  She also serves it with hot pepper sauce and fried fish at Ayensudu near Elmina. 

She is a widow taking care of three children who are currently in school. She hopes to expand her banku business and needs a loan to buy corn, peppers, tomatoes, cassava dough and firewood to make her food production easier.  Her future plan is to build a better place to host her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, peppers, tomatoes, cassava dough and firewood to make her food production easier.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 28 years old. She lives with her family in Samtredia, Imereti Region, West Georgia. Natia’s family consists of 5 members: herself, husband Merab, 5-year-old daughter, and her parents-in-law. Natia works as teacher at a local school. Along with her job, she is actively involved in the family agricultural business. In particular, they have a greenhouse with a total area of 200 sq. meters. In the winter, the family grows onions in the greenhouse, and in the summer, tomatoes. Also, the family grows strawberries on family-owned land and sells them during the summer season. The fruits and vegetables are sold on local market by the family members. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Natia requested credit for renovation of the greenhouse. She plans to change the existing plastic, as it is already torn and can’t keep the needed temperature. Also, part of the credit will be used for the purchase of onions for seeding. After the renovation, the needed temperature will be maintained in the greenhouse and the family will get a quality harvest, which will be sold at a favorable price. The family will use the anticipated income to cover daily expenses for food, clothes etc.

loans.use: to purchase plastic for the family's greenhouse renovation and onions for seeding

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Solución, tiene 38 años y 7 hijos, pero ahora solo 5 de ellos están a su cargo, Olga les pudo educar sola, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 9 años.
Olga vende gelatina en el Mercado de su localidad, siempre de dedicó a vender gelatina y este pequeño negocio no le ayudaría a educar a sus hijos, es por ello que gracias a los préstamos que recibió sus hijos pudieron estudiar, recuerda que antes para ayudarse tambien vendía papa con huevo y queso, pero un día le robaron todo, con esa decepción ya no quería saber nada, preocupada por sus hijos una amiga la trajo al Banco Comunal, ser socia para ella significa mucho, es como su segunda casa. El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará para poder comprar gelatina y pagar la escuela de sus hijos, el sueño que tiene es poder tener un puesto de especerías.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Solución Communal Bank.  She is 38 years old, and she has seven children.  However, only five of them are now under her care.  Olga was able she provide an education for her children by herself.  She has been a member of Finca Peru for nine years.

Olga sells gelatin at the local market.  She has always sold gelatin, but this small business would not help her give her children an education.  That is why; thanks to the loans she received, her children were able to get an education.

She remembers that before, in order be of help, she also sold potatoes with egg and cheese.  One day she was robbed of everything.  With this disappointment she no longer wanted to learn anything.  Worried about her children, a friend took her to the communal bank.  Being a member means a lot to her; it is like her second home.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy gelatin and to pay for her children’s school.

The dream that she has is to be able to have a stand to sell spices.

loans.use: to buy gelatin.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a forty-year-old divorced woman with three children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Ever since she divorced her husband she has been solely taking care of the family. She has been in the produce business for ten years. Her challenge is high transportation costs; her dream is a bigger business and a good house for her family. Agnes needs the loan to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria Lourdes tiene 48 años, su actividad  la venta de comida. Inicio hace mas de 13 años, cuando los gastos de sus hijos eran mayores, ya que todos  estaban estudiando entonces decidió buscar una alternativa de empleo propio para ayudar a su esposo a los gastos del hogar. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes que llegan a disfrutar de sus platillos pues siempre se esfuerza en proporcionar un buen servicio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, crema, detergentes, pan, refrescos, jugos, golosinas, bolsas, platos desechables entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Lourdes is 48 years old and her business activity is the sale of foods. She started out more than 13 years ago when her children's expenses increased. They were all in school so she decided to look for an alternative way of working for herself, to help her husband with the household expenses. She has a great variety of clients who come to enjoy her recipes. She always strives to provide a good level of service. The reason for the loan is to purchase basic grains, cream, detergents, bread, soft drinks, juices, sweets, bags, disposable plates, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, cream, detergents, bread, soft drinks, juices, sweets, bags, disposable plates, and other products.

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.es:
María de 26 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos años, su mercadería lo ofrece en su casa a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.  También cría y comercializa aves de corral, contando con otro ingreso para su hogar.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa para abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores y alimento balanceado para sus aves de corral, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito, mejorar su calidad de vida y para seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
María, 26, lives with her husband and children in her own house which only has electricity and is located in the rural part of Tambogrande District belonging to Piura Department, a zone noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts making.

María sells clothes, a business she’s run from home for a few years.  She sells her merchandise to her customers at home and also brings merchandise to order trying to increase customer demand so that income will increase to meet her family expenses.  She also raises barnyard fowl to sell thus having an additional source of household income.

Seeing that her business is more profitable every day she thought it necessary to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy larger amounts of clothes to stock her store with innovative items and to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her barnyard fowl with the goal in mind that her customers continue to increase so that she can repay the loan, improve her quality of life and continue supporting her family economically.

loans.use: to buy clothing and animal feed.

loans.name: Jaenly

texts.en:
Jaenly owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products in her community.  She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

Jaenly is 32 years old, married and has two grown-up children.  She has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month. 

Jaenly is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell and to expand her store.

In 2011, Jaenly joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve her business and living conditions.  

She plans to reinvest her profits and doubled her income so she can improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and for the expansion of business venue.

loans.name: Yellow Group

texts.en: Glay was happy with a previous loan which helped him to start a stationary business. He is now requesting another loan to increase his stock of stationary products. His family is happy because he can afford to take care of them. The group is doing fine; that is why they are back for a new loan.

loans.use: To increase his stock of stationary products

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tien dos hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace más de seis años, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes. Actualmente se dedica al servicio de copias e impresión.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de un millar de papel bond, lapiceros, cuadernos, también comprará golosinas y galletas.  En el negocio le ayuda su hijo y esposo. 

La señora desea superarse más en el negocio y así conseguir más ganancias.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones porque es una distracción con las socias.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “Brisas del Lago” (Lake Breezes) which is located in the Province and Department of Puno. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Margarita received her higher education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for more than six years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling groceries. She currently provides copying and printing services.

Margarita is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of a ream of bond paper, pens, notebooks, and also candy and cookies. Her son and husband help with the business. Sra. Margarita wants to achieve more success with her business so that she can earn more income. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the savings and the meetings because they provide a distraction for the members.

loans.use: to buy a ream of bond paper, pens, notebooks, candy, and cookies.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Alba de 55 años es una mujer que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y vende productos derivados de la harina de trigo como,  pasabocas empanadas y deditos; ella hace 9 años inició su negocio en la ciudad de Valledupar, departamento del Cesar,  donde aprendió todo lo relacionado con su emprendimiento, en los aspectos técnicos y en el mercado. Cuando se radicó en la ciudad de Barranquilla, lo primero que hizo fue hacer una preventa y ofrecer  sus productos en tiendas, hospitales del barrio, empresas y a la comunidad de amas de casa en general, logrando conseguir clientes, con los aun hoy cuenta, porque se esmera en ofrecer productos de calidad, a un buen precio y en condiciones de frescura y calidad inigualable.  Su meta mas adelante, es ampliar su infraestructura, dotarse de maquinarias y enseres para tecnificar sus procesos y finalmente lograr tener su propia casa. En la actualidad su mayor desafío, es el poco capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para lograr el crecimiento gradual esperado y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará una maquina cilindradora, con el fin de amasar con mayor efectividad  y aumentar su productividad, aprovechando especialmente la época de Diciembre, que contiene fiestas familiares, donde el consumo de estos productos se incrementa y con ello Alba se daría a conocer aun mas y ampliaría  su potencial de ventas. Su utilidad actual es del 35% y está de acuerdo con este tipo de negocios, que desde ahora y  con el impulso de su mercado,  muestra un potencial de crecimiento que le permitirá aumentar sus utilidades y así mismo su nivel de bienestar, siendo apoyado con capital de financiamiento como el que le ofrece su credikiva..
texts.en:
Alba, 55, is a woman living in the city of Barranquilla; she sells products derived from wheat flour like snacks, turnovers and deditos [finger cookies].  She started her business nine years ago in the city of Valledupar, Cesar Department, where she learned everything related to this enterprise both technically and marketwise.

When she moved to Barranquilla the first thing she did was conduct a presale and offer her products to stores, neighborhood hospitals, firms in the community and housewives in general thereby acquiring customers which she still has to this day because she strives to produce quality products that are fresh and of unequalled quality and are sold at good prices.  Her goal for later on is to expand her infrastructure, acquire machinery and appliances to mechanize her processes and in the long run acquire a house of her own.  

Currently, her biggest challenge is the little working capital she can count on to reach the desired growth and this is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, the first financing she’s had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy a rolling machine to knead the dough more efficiently and increase productivity to take advantage of the December season that contains family festivities where consumption of her products increases and Alba will be able to be more widely known and her sales potential will expand accordingly.

Her present profit margin is 35% which is in accord with this type of business which from now with impulse from her market shows growth potential that will allow for increased profits as well as the her wellbeing level being supported financially with capital from her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a rolling machine.

loans.name: Claribel

texts.en:
Despite problems and difficulties in life, Claribel aims to improve her status of living and become financially stable in the future. She is 42 years old and has no children, for she is separated from her husband due to problems and family conflicts. She lives with her parents and she decided to take care of them, for they now old and incapable. 

She planned to continue managing their farm lots by planting onions to generates income but due to financial difficulty, she is asking for an additional capital of P20,000 to buy onion seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for onion production. She believes that this loan will be a great help for her to work out her plans and is hoping that she will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for onion production

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en: Munhjargal is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt/ nomadic tent) in Govi-sumber province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed and her two kids are kindergarten students. She started her pig farming business in early 2011. She started with only two pigs and now she has 11 pigs. Even though she is fairly new to the business, she has already found a buyer. Her business has potential to grow. However, due to the lack of experience her farm is cold and she is short on food supply. She is requesting 2,800,000 MNT to buy materials for a making the sty warm and to purchase forage for her pigs. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Due to the uncomfortable farming place (sty), my pigs are tired and I'm afraid that if I keep it up this way, I will lose them."

loans.use: To buy materials for making the sty warm and to purchase forage for her pigs

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 38 years old a single business lady, she is blessed with one child aged 12 years. She has been running a hotel for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support the family.

She is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Julia will use the loan to buy a stock for wheat flour and sugar for her hotel. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy a stock for wheat flour and sugar for her hotel

loans.name: Dennis  Onyango

texts.en:
Dennis has been renting a motorcycle for micro-business work for three years. He  is married with two children and lives in a heavily populated suburb of Kisumu  City. Denis has committed to  provide transport to CHWs targeting youth groups and patients.

Dennis says owning the bike is great but supporting his community is greater. Dennis should also be able to grow his business and provide for his family. Dennis belongs to a business association and hopes to encourage many more members to join in supporting the CHW work in Kisumu City

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to support Community Health Work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 46 years old, she has two sons. Angela sells clothes and she is a professional masseuse. 

She needs a loan to buy more clothes for her business because she sells the clothes in many different locations including offices and houses. She will take advantage of the christmas season 

Angela sells new clothes. She hopes you can help her because she is the only person who earns money in her household. Angela is a single mother.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business at christmas season

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has a general store where she provides many of the items the community uses in daily consumption. When she started, she only had $100 of capital and could only sell vegetables from a stand. Now her store has items ranging from food to office supplies to cleaning products for the home. She is requesting the new loan because she wants to continue investing in all of her merchandise but also wants to introduce baby products into her sales. She sees that diapers and formula are highly in demand and she wants to take advantage of the business opportunity. Esther moved to Guayaquil from a rural sector named Los Rios. She has three children that she works very hard to educate and to feed.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in baby products

loans.name: Jocqueson

texts.en:
Jocqueson is an artisan who makes large baskets and bins made of bamboo strips woven together. He creates different shapes and sizes, makes designs with how he weaves the threads and paints each craft different colors. Jocqueson takes his two children to school then heads off to a mission near their house where he is allotted a small room that serves as his workshop. This loan will allow him the funds to expand his business, which is very small and lacks capital for materials, yet is showing promise for large growth in the marketplace. He sells his products in large outdoor markets in Trou-du-Nord and Cap-Haitien - two densely populated urban areas in the northeast of Haiti.

NOTE: Jocqueson is the leader of his solidarity group called Fraternite. He and his business represent the nine other members of Fraternite, who each will receive a share of this $1,200 loan to fund their respective businesses. As members of a solidarity group, Jocqueson and the other 9 micro-entrepreneurs have gone through Esperanza´s business training courses and have proven to be committed to their business to provide for their family. If a member of the group is unable to make a payment, the other members are responsible for making up the difference and helping the person to improve. This group-lending method creates a social support network within the community as well as an accountability system to ensure that not only are loans paid back on time, but that the loan capital is invested in developing their business and providing for the basic necessities of their families.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials, paint, cover transportation costs, increase capital and savings to expand business

loans.name: Sabit

texts.en: S. Sabit is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh, which he left in 1993. He is married and has 2 children. His small business consists of 1 cow. He is going to purchase another cow and a calf. In 2002, he borrowed 1200 USD to cover his business needs.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mrs. Soeun N. is a 34 year old widow. She is a farmer, who earns about $5 a day from this activity. She would like to use this loan to buy 10 more pigs to add to her livestock and also to purchase fertilizer for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy 10 pigs and purchase fertilizer for her plantation

loans.name: Sriningsih

texts.id:
Sriningsih has a business of sewing dresses. She lives with her husband in a rented room that cost Rp200,000.00 (about US$22)/month. She is doing the business from the terrace of her room. Sriningsih has a steady customer from the garment business. When orders are slow, she took orders from customers from surrounding area. In one day she could finish 2 to 3 dresses. The transpotation she uses to pick up and deliver her sewing items is a bicycle. Raw materials like cloth she bought by kilograms to reduce cost. Daily living expenses are about Rp20,000.00 ($2.20). Monthly profit could reach up to Rp1,300,000.00 ($143). The expected capital will be used to buy clothing raw materials. This will help her in her creativity to desgn dresses. She hopes that she would not only complete customer's orders, but also to sell the ideas she put into the dresses she makes.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sriningsih mempunyai usaha Menjahit Pakaian. Dia tinggal berdua bersama suaminya di kos - kosan. Biaya sewa per bulannya Rp 200.000,00. Dia menjalankan usaha di tempat kosnya, tepatnya di bagian teras. Sriningsih mempunyai langganan tetap dari salah satu perusahaan garmen. Apabila sepi pesanan, dia mengambil jahitan dari pelanggan di sekitar tempat kosnya. Satu hari dia bisa menyelesaikan 2 sampai 3 potong pakaian. Alat transportasi yang digunakan Sriningsih untuk mengantar dan mengambil jahitan adalah sepeda gayung. Bahan baku – berupa kain - dia beli kiloan, dengan harga lebih murah. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 20.000,00. Keuntungan per bulannya mencapai Rp 1.300.000,00. Modal yang dia dapat nantinya akan dia gunakan untuk membeli bahan baku kain. Hal ini akan membantu dia mengembangkan kreatifitasnya dalam mendesign pakaian. Dia berharap tidak hanya mampu memenuhi pesanan pelanggan, akan tetapi juga mampu menjual ide – ide yang dituangkan dalam setiap pakain yang dia buat.

loans.use:
To buy clothing raw materials

Membeli bahan baku kain

loans.name: Lemoe

texts.en: Lemoe is a mother whose child helps out her and her husband in running the family plantation.  Lemoe plans to use her loan to expand the plantation. She sells 2 sacks of taro and yams every Friday at the Fugalei market, where she can usually earn more than 300 Tala ($120 US) of profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, tools, cement, and timber for her family plantation

loans.name: Margrete

texts.en:
Margrete is a 56 year old widow who cares for six children, seven grandchildren and 100 chickens. With that many children around, she often goes to the henhouse when she wants some peace and quiet! Each hen lays an egg per day on average. Margrete collects and places the eggs in a 36-egg cardboard tray which she sells for about 3,000 Uganadan shillings (about $1.75).

Her daily collection of eggs brings her about $5.25 per day, which is above the national average in Uganda. However she then has to pay for chicken feed and new chicks from her income. With her Kiva loan, Margrete will buy more chicken feed and week-old chicks.

loans.use: Margrete plans to buy chicken feed and more week-old chicks with her loan.

loans.name: Salma's Nyota Group

texts.en:
Salma, age 49, is a widow and has four grown-up children. She takes care of her three grand-children who are 16, 11, and 5 years old. Salma is a food vendor and works from 7 am to 4 pm daily, making and selling food dishes and snacks. She started this business in 1988 and now makes a monthly profit of about US$80.

Salma is asking for a loan to increase her food sales. She will share this loan with three other women who have businesses in selling food, vegetables, and snacks.

loans.use: Increase of food stock for a grocery store

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
I am Mussarat B. and I have lived all my life in Multan, a city famous in Pakistan for its shrines. I am married and the mother of four: three boys and one girl. We live in a two-room brick-mud house here in Multan. My daughter creates beautiful embroidered dresses, which her aunt sells in the big city of Karachi. We plan to use our portion of the loan to expand her business, and will use the profits as her dowry.

I lead a group of four other women who have applied for a loan: Nighat B., Bushra B., Parween B. and Saeedan B.. Nighta B. and Bushra B. both are textile designers who embroider clothes. Saeedan B. runs a beauty shop. Parween B. needs this loan for her stitching business. All these women are hard working entrepreneurs and dream of providing better lives for their families.

loans.use: To expand five small businesses

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura T. Salas, partner of the Santa Rosa de Lima Community Bank, lives in the San Martin region, providence of Mariscal Caceres in the city of Juanui. Her business of selling new and used clothing is located in her own home. From here she heads out into the local communities to sell her items to clients who like this type of clothing. When she separated from her husband, she decided to begin her business. She knew she had a daughter to raise, so she began selling local and American clothing, which is now a successful business thanks to her many clients. With her $1075 loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of new and used clothing items. These items will be for men, women and children and will consist of various sizes and styles. They will be brought in shipments from the city of Lima. Laura is a woman who has learned to make her own decisions and has grown to be sure of herself. She lives wither only daughter, who is the sole reason for her keep going. She dreams of having a well stocked store and also would like to implement various types of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise

Laura T. Salas, es socia del Banco Comunal “ Santa Rosa de Lima ” vive en la Región San Martín , Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres , distrito de Juanjui . Su negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada esta ubicada en su propia casa,desde donde se desplaza a las comunidades cercanas a vender sus productos a los moradores que gustan de este tipo de prendas de vestir. Al separarse de su esposo y teniendo una hija a quien criar decide dedicarse al negocio, de la venta de ropa nacional y americana en la que le va muy bien en la actualidad cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes. Con el crédito de S/.3000.00 el cual pagara en un plazo de pago de 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir nuevas y usadas para damas caballeros y niños en diferentes tallas y modelos los mismos que vienen en fardos, que lo envían desde la ciudad de Lima. Laura es una mujer que ha aprendido a tomar sus propias decisiones, segura de si misma vive con su única hija, quien es su principal motor para seguir adelante, sueña con tener una tienda bien abastecida, además implementarla con productos de plástico.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing for subsequent sale.  Con el prestamo comprara mas ropa para su venta

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo P. is a native of the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega, and has a business selling clothing, pillows and some small appliances, which he offers to clients from his home . He is a hard-working gentleman who has managed to provide his family (wife and two children) with what is needed to survive.

Today, Mr. P. urgently needs to acquire financing to buy merchandise. For this reason he is looking for help from Ceprodel to receive a loan which will allow him to buy clothing, pillows and some small appliances to sell and in this way, to continue to support his household.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Pedro Pablo P. es un caballero originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega el cual se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa, almohadas y algunos electrodomésticos vendiéndolos en su casa de habitación donde los oferta a sus clientes. Es un caballero muy esforzado que ha logrado proporcionar a su familia (cónyuge y dos hijos) las condiciones necesarias para subsistir.

Hoy en día, la necesidad que el caballero P. atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir el recurso económico para la compra de su mercadería, por ello es que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para recibir el crédito que le permita realizar la compra de la ropa, almohadas y algunos electrodomésticos para luego comercializarlos y así continuar con el sostenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase products.

loans.name: Musriah

texts.id:
Musriah and her husband rent a house for IDR 1 million/ year (around USD 125/year). The house has 4 rooms and because she only lives with her husband, she rents out the other 3 rooms to others. She's been living in that house for 10 years. Their 2 children are grown up and married already. They live in their own places.

Musriah sells cookies and traditional snack for living. She sells her cookies and snack at local market and nearby food stalls. She also accepts orders for parties. She is hoping to be able to expand her business with the loan money she is receiving.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Musriah saat ini tingal di Jl.Mertasari Denpasar dengan mengontrak rumah dengan sewa Rp.1.000.000 per tahun. Karena saat ini tinggal hanya berdua bersama suaminya,rumah sebesar 4 kamar itu, hanya satu yang ditempati sendiri. Ketiga kamar lainnya disewakan lagi. Sudah 10 tahun klien tinggal dirumah itu. Dua anaknya sudah menikah dan mempunyai keluarga sendiri. Sehari-harinya, Musriah bekerja sebagai penjual kue. Dia biasanya menjual kue buatannya di Pasar terdekat, menitipkan di warung-warung langgananya dan juga menerima pesanan kalau ada pesta atau acara. Usahnya cukup menjanjikan. Karena itu dia berharap diberi bantuan odal usaha, sehingga usahanya bisa lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kadidia T. is a 64 year old widow with 9 children living with her in the home of her late husband in the Pelengana Nord district of the city of Ségou.

She began working in income-generating activities in her youth with her mother. After a long period of inactivity due to the refusal of her husband, she started producing and selling peanut paste after her husband's death a year ago.

To obtain financial rersources, she decided to turn to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her first individual loan.

She supplies herself in the villages surrounding Ségou during village fair days. She intends to buy 8 sacks of peanuts of different qualities and transportation costs for 12 trips by truck of firewood, which she will dispatch to Ségou. She roasts these nuts herself and converts them into peanut paste using specailized presses. Afterwards, the paste is put into jars for sale at the commercial level or in bulk at the market or at home.

With this new loan, she hopes to realize a monthly profit of 48,000 CFA, which she intends to use to feed her fatherless children.

In the future, she hopes to raise cattle, sheep, and goats, as well as poultry, with the profits she obtains.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Kadidia T. est une veuve, âgée de 64 ans, mère de 9 enfants vivant avec ses enfants dans le domicile de son feu mari à Pelengana Nord quartier de la ville de Ségou.

Elle a commencé a faire des activités génératrices de revenus dés son jeune âge à côté de sa mère. Après une longue période d’inactivité pour refus de son mari, elle entama la fabrication et la vente de patte d’arachide après le décès de ce dernier il y a une année.

Pour obtenir des ressources financières elle décida de faire recourt à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.

Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Ségou pendant les jours de foire. Elle compte acheter 8 sacs d’arachide graine de différentes qualités et 12 voyages de camion en bois chauffe qu’elle fera acheminer à Ségou. Ces graines sont grillées par elle même et transformées en patte d’arachide par des mouliniers spécialisés. Ensuite les pattes sont mises dans des pots pour la vente au niveau des entreprises ou en vrac au marché ou à la maison.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 48 000 CFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour nourrir ses enfants orphelins.

Dans l’avenir elle espère faire de l’élevage des bovins, ovins et caprins ainsi que de l’aviculture avec les bénéfices réalisés.

loans.use: To buy sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Caroline

texts.fr:
Born on 27 May 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of BENIN, Mrs. Caroline T. is married and has 4 children, of which the eldest, Yélian, is 12 years old in Class 5 (equivalent to 7th grade), and the youngest, Christella, is 4 years old and in preschool. She is a seamstress by profession and has been since 1992. But in parallel with this, she sells various items such as liquor, food pastes, detergents, and also pagnes (a West African type of cloth), which she delivers to her clients who come to her to have their clothes made. In order to respond to the needs of her clientele, she is asking for this loan, which is her second with the organization Alidé.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 27 Mai 1970 à Cotonou dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame T. Caroline est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont l'aîné Yélian âgé de 12 ans est en classe de cinquième au cours secondaire et la benjamine Christella âgée de 04 ans est en classe de maternelle 2. Elle est couturière de profession et est en activité depuis 1992. Mais parallèlement à celle ci elle revend divers articles comme les liqueurs, des pâtes alimentaires, des détergents et aussi des pagnes qu'elle livre à ses clients qui viennent chez elle confectionner leurs habits. Afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite ce crédit qui est son deuxième prêt chez Alidé.

loans.use: To buy 20 pieces of Hitarget pagne cloth and 20 pieces of bazin (damask) cloth

loans.name: Ikupa R.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Ikupa M.. She is married and has one child, aged nine months. In 2007, Ikupa established her clothes business. She opens her business six days a week and nine to twelve hours a day. Ikupa requires a loan in order to purchase more clothes in bulk. In the future, Ikupa plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially among the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress; however, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Худойдодова Салтанат жительница района А.Джоми. Возраст 68 года, вдова,имеет 1 сына. Образование среднее. Занимается куплей продажей  сельхоз.животных более 30 лет.Помогает клиентки ее  сын. Вместе они покупают на местном рынке молодых бычков или барашкев,откармливают их и перепродают по более выгодной им цене.Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода их семьи.Сейчас Салтанат планирует закупить одного бычка,на что и берет кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saltanat H. is a resident of the Jomi region. She is a 68-year-old widow with one child. Saltanat attended secondary school, and has purchased and sold farm animals for more than 30 years. She is assisted by her son. Together, they buy calves and lambs at the local market and fatten them for resale at a profit. This business is the sole source of income for their family. At present Saltanat plans to purchase a steer and is taking out a 12-month loan for that purpose.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: увеличение денежного оборота Purchase of a steer

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casada y con dos hijos de 16 y 20 años de edad, el de 16 está estudiando la secundaria y el de 20 años trabaja y estudia para ayudar a sus padres, su esposo es cadete de taxi. Las ventas de doña Maria son cosméticos y también es costurera desde hace nueve años, inició sólo con la costura pues tiene bastantes clientes ya que su trabajo es bien fino, pero debido a la poca costura que a veces tiene, por que no todos los meses son bueno,  se vió en la necesidad de vender cosméticos ya que son productos que las mujeres usan a diario, pues vende al crédito y al contado. Con la solicitud que está haciendo es para invertir en el negocio en la compra de productos Zermat y comprar juegos de joyas Romannel, así como telas para sus costura. A largo plazo es comprar otra máquina de costura marca Overlok para mejorar las costuras así como seguir invirtiendo en cosméticos, también desea poder brindarle estudios a su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She is married with two children, 16 and 20 years old. One is studying in high school, and the 20 year old works and studies, and as well helps his parents. Her husband is a taxi driver. Maria sells cosmetics, and she has been a seamstress for nine years. She started her business only with sewing work and has a good clientele because her work is very detailed. But because at times she has little sewing work, not all months are good. Because of this she saw the need to sell cosmetics, since they are products that women use every day. She sells on credit and with cash, and many times the products are ordered, so it has not been a difficult task to have clientele because part of her clients are from her sewing business. The loan request she is making is to be used to invest in the business, in the purchase of Zermat products and Romanel sets in order to offer and sell more, as well as for fabric for the sewing business. A goal over the long term is to buy other overlock sewing machines to improve her sewing and as well to continue investing in cosmetics, and to be able to provide schooling to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar Zermat cosmetics and Romanel clothing

loans.name: Lilia Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Lilia Gregoria Ucañán  D. C. tiene 54 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias al Éxito II y vive en la calle Lambayeque Mz C  lote 41 del Puerto D. Salaverry provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió Secretariado Ejecutivo y trabajo en lo mismo durante muchos años pero se casó a los 29 años y dejó el trabajo para dedicarse a su hogar. 
Tiene una hija y un hijo, depenD. D. ella solo el hijo varón ya que su hija se casó.
Actualmente trabaja en servicio alimentario D. Wuawua Wuasi (casa D. atención para niños y personas D. bajos ingresos).
Además, para ayudarse económicamente también trabaja en sociedad con su hija haciendo parrilladas (carne a la parrilla) los días domingo, lo mismo que Papa a la Huancaína (comida típica D. la zona)  para repartir.
Su primer crédito D. 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas, le sirvieron para empezar con sus polladas.
Con este crédito D. 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, implementará su local con diversos insumos.
Lilia sueña con terminar D. construir su casa y arreglar un lugar para restaurant propio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lilia Gregoria Ucañán D. C. is 54 years old and belongs to Business to Success II Village Bank. She lives on Lot 41 of the Lambayeque Mz C Street in the Puerto D. Salaverry section of the Trujillo province of the La Libertad department in Peru. She studied in a secretarial course and worked in the same job for many years, but got married when she was 29 years old and left the job to devote herself to her home. She has a daughter and a son, and at this time, only her son depends on her since her daughter got married. She currently works in food service for Wuawua Wuasi (home care for children and low-income individuals). In addition, in order to help financially she also works in partnership with her daughter to make barbeque food (grilled meat) on Sundays, as well as enough “Papa a la Huancaína” (food typical of the area) to go around. Her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in four installments, helped her to get started with their chickens. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she will implement new various ingredients into her business. Lilia dreams of finishing the construction of her house and setting up a place for her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Marilyn T., 53 years old, is a widow who lives in Upper Dicayas, Dipolog City. She has 6 children. Her husband died in 1999 and she has been the bread winner of the family since then. After the death of her husband, she found ways to earn a living. She sold their pig and started her barbeque with only 1,000 initial capital. 

She decided to join Paglaum MPC in November 2006 to get a loan for additional capital. Now she is borrowing PHP 14,000 to buy additional pork meat and sacks of farm fertilizer. 

She also owns a little parcel of land for farming. With her land, she was able to send her children to school, and two of them have already finished college. 

Mrs. T. plans to own a “carenderia” (small / mini restaurant) whose main menu is barbeque. She also wants to repair her house in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional pork meat and sacks of farm fertilizer

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de quesos que compra en comunidades alejadas para luego traerlos a las ciudades y venderlos en los mercados, dentro de su labor, lo que más le agrada realizar es la comercialización, y lo tedioso es ir a los pueblos lejanos. Pero de todas maneras esta actividad es muy rentable, ya que los pobladores solicitan todos los días quesos frescos y muy ricos, típicos de zonas rurales donde los preparan. Carmen es nueva en MFP, pero se muestra muy comprometida y responsable  ante los demás. Invertirá lo que solicita en la compra de mayores cantidades de queso, para venderlos, ya no tan solo en su ciudad, sino también en las ciudades aledañas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 29 and lives with her husband and 3 children. She has sold cheese that she buys in remote communities and takes to the cities to sell in the markets for 4 years. What she likes most about her job is selling. The tedious part is going to far away towns. But this business is very profitable because the people who live in the city request fresh and very delicious cheeses from her every day that are traditional to the areas where they are prepared. Carmen is new to Microfinanzas Prisma, but she has shown that she is committed and responsible above all. She will invest her loan in the purchase of larger quantities of cheese to sell, not only in her city, but also in nearby cities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of cheese to sell

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: Carla tiene 18 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos, actividad que aprendió de su madre, Carla compra zapatos y los lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de casa en casa, dejándolos a un precio cómodo para sus clientes, empezó este negocio hace un año y le gusta porque se relaciona con muchas personas y se esmera en darles un buen trato. Debido a la calidad y variados modelos que vende, sus clientes están empezando a recomendarla y su clientela empieza a crecer muy rápido. Este e su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que está solicitando comprará más zapatos, también quiere adquirir un porta zapatos donde pueda mostrarlos.
texts.en:
Carla is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents and brothers. She sells shoes, an enterprise she learned from her mother. Carla buys shoes and then re-sells them at a very fair price, going from home to home in different areas. She began this business a year ago and enjoys it because she is able to interact with many people and she takes pride in giving them a good deal. Due to the quality and variety of styles she sells, her customers are beginning to recommend her and her clientele is quickly growing. This is her first loan with MFP. With the funds requested, Carla will buy more shoes and also acquire a portable shoe display.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch T. is 36 years old and lives with his wife in the Bati district, Takeo province. He is a dealer who purchases and sells motorbikes in the village. He earns approximately US$20 in revenue every day. His wife makes US$2.5 of profit a day by selling roasted beef and cow stomachs. This couple has three young children and one is in school. Mr. Touch T. is asking for a loan to purchase motorbikes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for resale.

loans.name: Nyiragicali

texts.en: Greetings from Rwamagana, Rwanda!  R. Nyiragicali is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company.  She owns a small shop in Rwamagana which is located in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.  She has owned the business for 29 years and employs three people to help her with its operation.  She works every day from 7:00am to 10:00pm and earns a profit of approximately 120,000 Rwandan Francs each month (240 USD).  She will use the loan to buy more stock of the items in her shop so that she can increase her sales.  With her profits, she intends to pay school fees, buy more food for her family, and reinvest in her business.  R. is 50 years old, married, and has five children aged 30, 28, 25, 19, and 7.  She also cares for three orphans, aged 20, 15, and 6.  Her income is supplemented by the shop which her husband owns and operates, earning approximately 70,000 Rwandan Francs each month.

loans.use: More stock of the items in her shop so that she can increase her sales

loans.name: Ferila

texts.en:
Ferila E., 46, is married with five children. She has two years of experience in the vegetable garden business. Ferila sells to village people and the public six days per week.

Ferila has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~ USD).

SPBD loans are Ferila’s only access to capital because she was not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. The loan will only be used to buy things for her business.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for gardening business.

loans.name: Comunidad Unida - Group 8

texts.en:
These five young women are getting their first loan. All but one are starting their businesses with these funds. We had the chance of talking to them all about the activities they plan to do with this loan. Only Anecia had her business set up before and will restock with this loan.

Belkis A. is the group representative. She will sell hair products. She will use her loan to buy shampoo, conditioner, a special strengthening treatment called Penetrait, anti-frizz serum (which sells specially well because the Dominican Republic weather is very humid and hair frizzes fast), and hair wax for durable hair styles. Belkis knows that Dominican women are very conscious about their hair and take very special care of it. This is why she is committed to offering good quality hair products at a good price.

Nikaury E. and Alexandre M. will both sell clothes. Mostly pants, blouses, underwear and sandals. They will go to the flea market or to the Villa Consuelo commercial district to get their merchandise. At these two market places, they can purchase at better prices than most retail stores, which will allow them to realize larger profit margins for each sale.

Yoselin will sell bedding, bedspreads, curtains and sheets. She buys them by the dozen and sells them by the piece.

Last but not least, Anecia has a fried food stand that opens at 3pm. While she was at our office in central Santo Domingo, her husband was attending the stand. ''But my customers say I do it better'' she says with a laugh. Her group mates agreed. She mostly sells fried chicken, crackling pork, fried sweet potatoes and tostones (crunchy fried plantains).

Please help us support this group of entrepreneurs with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: Buy hair products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en: Blandina J. currently sells tea and is requesting a loan to open up a restaurant at the market of Gudele. She is a 30-year-old woman whose husband died two years ago. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she will pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a restaurant

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Reyna se dedica desde hace 20 años a atender su negocio de venta de productos varios como lo son productos comestibles asi como jabones, productos de limpieza, entre otros.

Ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los productos porque al habérsele agotado requiere comercializarlos y aunque su establecimiento no presta las condiciones necesarias, ella siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante en el negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna has had her business in Chinandega for twenty years. She sells various products like food, soap, and cleaning products, among others. She has asked Ceprodel for a loan to buy products to sell because she has sold old. Even though her establishment does not lend itself to good selling conditions, she always works hard to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline tiene 22 años, tiene un bebé de 3 meses y vive junto a su abuela en la casa de ella. Desde hace 3 años y medio se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, para ello sale todos los días a ofrecer sus productos a través de catálogos y muestrarios para dar mayor confianza a sus clientes. Cuando va a estudiar a la universidad sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de clases, de esta manera se genera los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades de su pequeño hijo. Debido a su habilidad para las ventas ha conseguido, con esfuerzo y empeño, obtener nuevos clientes, logrando superar sus ganancias anteriores, lo cual la anima mucho para seguir trabajando de esta manera. Además, esta actividad le permite seguir estudiando y cuidar de su bebé. Para un futuro, Jackeline quiere establecerse en un local comercial donde pueda vender sus productos. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está decidida a seguir trabajando solidariamente en su banco comunal, donde se siente respaldada por sus compañeros. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a la compra de mercadería en productos de belleza para incrementar su stock y poder vender de forma inmediata cuando se lo soliciten, sin hacer el pedido por catálogo.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 22 years old. She has a 3 month old baby and lives with her grandmother. She has been selling cosmetics for 3½ years. Her merchandise is sold through catalogs, and she provides samples to her customers so that they will gain confidence in the products. Her main clients are her classmates at the college where she studies. The revenue generated from her business has helped satisfy the needs of her young child. Jackeline’s effort and commitment are reflected in her sales results, her ability to gain new customers, and her increased income from previous years. She is encouraged to continue with her hard work. Her business enables her to continue studying and taking care of her baby. In the future, Jackeline wants to have her own shop where she can sell her products.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is determined to continue working with her communal bank, where she is supported by her peers. The money she is requesting will be used to increase her stock of beauty products so that she can sell them immediately upon request without ordering from a catalog.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona A. lives in the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married, and makes a living running a small retail store. This is a new business, and her main source of income comes from selling clothes and shoes. 

In 2008, Rona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC which she used to to buy additional products to sell. Rona is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to buy still more products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 5  De(Benkadi  A Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres  que compose le  groupe  BENKADI 5 de l’association BENKADI A sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour  acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 28 hectares.
Après les récoltes, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue dans les marchés du  village de Marka-Coungo et Fana,  à une clientèle  venant généralement des grandes villes.
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members who compose the group BENKADI 5 of the association BENKADI A are married women who average 45 years of age and 4 children.
